The last couple times I've been a bit disappointed that my bone marrow bone was very small and in turn, yielded very little bone marrow to enjoy. Luckily this time I had a nice, deep bone and all three of us were able to enjoy it. The texture is a little slimy and bulky, sometimes salty but it melts in your mouth...don't forget to add it on top the provided grilled bread, so delicious. Tuna tacos never fail either. They're marinated, diced tuna in fried wonton tacos (thin and light), with marinated cucumbers and sriracha mayo (not spicy).  The fries are garlic-herb salted, dusted with pecorino & truffle oil are always necessary to get. They are thin (almost McDonalds looking), and not greasy so you don't feel too bad eating them. Trust me, try them if you haven't. The herb cheese stuffed piquillo peppers on bruschetta are sooo good. The cheese is light, not heavy feeling and compliments being stuff inside the pepper. They come out warm on the bruschetta so I'd recommend eating them when they arrive. No worries if it cools a little because they're still delicious. My cousin and her fianc√© had a lamb gyro and enjoyed it. It was a reasonable size as they were able to split it between them.  Overall this experience went well. It was later at night when we arrived so there wasn't a wait (about 10pm), but if you're looking to go closer to the weekend you could be waiting for hours. Prior to this visit I utilized the "no wait" app and I'd suggest doing the same as well because once everyone gets out of work, or its dinner time on the weekend, the place will fill up real quick. Very quickly. I mentioned living close by so the "no wait" app works perfectly. (No joke) about 1.5-2.5 hrs before I know we want to go to dinner, I put our name on he list and just wait. An hour prior to their guesstimated time I will start getting ready and once we're the next to be seated we start walking over. I once put our name on the no wait app a little late (630-7pm?) and were given such a late time that we opted to go somewhere else. We forgot to take our name off the list and we're finally messaged around 1130 that a table was ready. We've already eaten elsewhere and made it uptown by that point so no need to make it over. Needless to say, do some research and utilize the no wait app if Soul is still affiliated with it. Otherwise you may not get to eat at a reasonable hour unless you score a seat at the bar which is first come first serve. Or, you may like the Parisian eating schedule, and all I'd have to say is "enjoy" :).   Great place, amazing and different food, great vibe with upbeat music... try to make a stop in if you're in from out of town. Your guests shouldn't be disappointed... unless they like the normal burger and fries or shrimp scampi and don't like trying new things.
Consistently good. We have eaten there a bunch and we keep finding new things we love.

I wouldn't say I'm a hipster, but I love Soul.   Luckily we live in the 'hood and can slip into this place on early evenings or afternoons when it's not slam packed.   I've not had anything bad here.  Sushi is wonderful and love the option of ordering several tapas plates to share.  Cupcakes for dessert - yum!  The decor is posh but the interior is small and can be very tight at times.  Always had good service here.
This place is amazing. Their pork belly tacos and lamb chop lollipops are to die for. I could get them all day! Just writing this review is making my mouth water

I have only one complaint. This place is popular - people know about their daily drink specials, their eclectic menu, and friendly service, full of suggestions and refills... and being that I wait tables myself, I am hardpressed not to leave the moment I've finished my meal and the place starts filling up. I'd LIKE to sit and stay for several more drinks but my inner-server tugs on my sleeve, telling me to get goin' and let the people make their money (not THEIR servers, though.)   Where do I start? Went with my boyfriend and roommate one Monday, arrived fairly early, around 6pm, and the server told us about the specials and I ended up grabbing their flatbread special after I heard the words "crab" and "arugula." I LOVED THIS DISH. The crab/arugula/lemon vinaigrette/candied garlic combo is genius, I could eat it out of a tub. It would be just as good as a salad, with more arugula, of course.   My roommate, who isn't altogether very picky or adventurous, ordered the sliders and cleaned his plate. My boyfriend and I shared the hamachi and jalapeno, which is super fresh, has a pretty presentation, and the accompanying sauce is right on point for the fish.   I drank their sparkling sake, sparking rose, and a glass of Sauvignon Blanc, the boys had Newcastles, and we were satisfied overall with their selection. I might have ordered beer if their selection was better. I could use some more microbrews, seasonal stuff, etc. The sake is ok, the rose is good, and the Sauvignon Blanc was good. Nothing to write home about. I sampled the new Greek wine they hadn't put on the menu after ordering an Assyrtiko blend that was on the menu, but it wasn't for me, and the server graciously agreed that she may not have wanted an entire glass of it, either. Makes you more comfortable when a server agrees with your dislike of something, so I appreciated it.   I love the warm ambiance, the coziness, and though I've only been there once, I could tell that many others love this place, too. It's moderately priced (well, pretty cheap, actually, if you're used to eating out fairly regularly,) and the three of us spent $80 (tip not included) on snacks and bunches of drinks, including a couple glasses of wine and a small-ish bottle of sake ($12.)    Definitely close to 5 stars for what it is -- a cool little gastropub.

1 star due to the HORRIBLE attitude of the manager. Decided to sit outside tonight because there was a 45 min wait for an inside table. After being seated and seeing it was pretty cold, we asked the manager to turn the heaters on. He told us that there was no way he would turn the heaters on with it being 65 degrees. Too bad it was actually 55 degrees and he was a total ass in his approach to our request. I've been coming to this place for years but seriously doubt I will be back anytime soon with how management wants to treat customers!

all I wanted was a simple steak and egg sandwich.   the waitress mentioned the egg would be sunny side up. having had unpleasant issues with a runny egg recently, I asked for the egg to be scrambled. she obliges and put my order in.  5 minutes pass and the waitress comes back to the table to let me know the chef REFUSES to scramble the egg. the choices: sunny or fried hard. why couldn't he just scramble it? she said she asked him the same thing and they got into it. i sullenly agree to "fried hard" -- whatever that means.  plate finally makes it to the table. dried ass tired looking egg on top of unseasoned "steak" with a butter soaked piece of toast underneath. gee, thanks.  honestly what I requested wasn't a substitution (the menu doesn't state sunny side up)... all you had to do was shake the damn fork or spatula around in the egg.  i was so displeased, i couldn't really enjoy my meal. the waitress was very nice but otherwise...

This place is an absolute gem of Charlotte. Great, relaxed atmosphere with some superb food. The sushi at this place is the best I have had in Charlotte. The staff were incredibly helpful and went out of their way to make sure that we enjoyed the food. The food is served in a tapas-style layout. There wasn't anything on the menu we didn't like. I will definitely be going back to this place ASAP.

Love love this place.  I have come twice now and I could live on the pork belly tacos alone.  Other standouts are the lamb lollipops and the hamachi jalape√±o plate.  The only thing I don't like is that they don't take reservations - get there early or use the wait in line app.  Also, if you are seated outside it smells slightly of mildew.  I think it's from the plastic curtains that shield the patio from the wind.  They probably get a bit damp post-rain.

Soul Gastrolounge can get really busy - so expect to wait outside or on the stairs for a table.  Because of the exciting choices on the menu, I was pumped to try out this place.  Armed with a Corporate card and a coworker, we arrived at Soul on a Wednesday evening and hardly had to wait.  We both got a table outside, which was actually really nice on an early fall evening.  Service was great - our server was very nice and our plates were cleared quickly and waters always full.    For food, we ordered the following:  Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos - ain't nothin' "Asian-glazed" about these tacos... unless something like five spice qualifies as "Asian".  However, these were my favorite out of the bunch we ordered.  The pork belly was nicely cooked, really flavorful with the "Asian Glaze" and the watermelon salsa (really just marinated watermelon) added a nice flavor to the bite as a whole.  I would probably rather have this without the tortilla.  Ramen bowl - very large serving!  The first 5 bites of this was really good, but then it just really became way too salty.  The ramen noodles were nice and chewy and reminded me of the kind that comes in American instant ramen (Top Ramen).  What really stood out here were the veal cheeks that basically melted in your mouth and the amazing goat cheese fried mushrooms.  YUM.  Bone marrow - pass.  This hardly tasted like anything and was basically a ton of butter on some crostini.  Flatbread - truffle whipped goat cheese, pistachio pesto, honey braised garlic and fresh arugula - actually quite tasty, but hard to eat.  It was very soggy, but had really good flavor from the mix of ingredients.  Korean BBQ wings - I live in NYC... where Korean chicken wings are a real thing and really delicious.... unfortunately these do not compare.  Chicken wings need to be more crispy, in my opinion.  For dessert, we got the banana chocolate phyllo turnovers - such a good decision and at $5, it was very reasonably priced.  However the star of this show was the banana pudding ice cream - SO GOOD.  Too bad they don't sell it by itself.  I'm not really sure what to call this place... like an American/Asian "fusion" or what, but it's a decent place for drinks and tapas with a good environment.  I'm pretty picky when it comes to food, only because I've had far better in NYC.  Bottom line - decent food, great atmosphere.

This place is cool.  The food is awesome and the prices are very reasonable. The drinks are equally reasonable and good.  The atmosphere is pretty cool but a bit cramped. Getting a table or place to sit can be a challenge.   Over all its a good value for your $ and its a fun place just to chill and grab a late night meal.
Always a culinary adventure and cool vibe. Plan on a wait, drinks at the bar or on the patio, and then indulge in inventive and yummy tapas. Pork belly tacos and sushi rolls rule.

The significant other and I just happened to stroll into this place and managed to get a seat at the bar despite there being an hour wait for any table.  The bartender (long hair and tattoos) was an excellent host and made all sorts of recommendations for things to try as well as places to check out in the city. What was supposed to be 2 tapas turned into about 4 or 5 over the next 2 hours and several drinks, all of which were outstanding.   The pork belly tacos were the stand out item but everything was amazing. The atmosphere is very chic and upscale, which I should have looked up in advance since I came in wearing jeans and sneakers but no one minded. Overall a great experience and definitely a place worth coming back too.

Love this place! Although they get really really busy and they don't take reservations, if you go early enough (around 6pm) you should be able to get seated promptly. Came here with 2 friends on a Friday night and we ordered a bunch of food and drinks and they were all fantastic. Some dishes were a little bit salty but nothing to steer us away! We will definitely be coming back!

I am a native Charlottean and this is my go to for anniversaries and birthdays. Also a must when we have people from out of town visiting.   No reservations and long waits but it is so worth it.   Small plates are perfect for sharing with a group with some of the most unique and robust flavors you will find. Some of our favorites are the pork belly tacos, southern fried nachos and the ramen bowl, but you cannot go wrong!   Their cocktails are out of this world and unlike other places worth the cost!

A unique dining experience with incredible flavors! The cocktails are on point. One of our favorite spots for a date night. The problem is it's so packed, it's not even worth trying to get in on weekends. Much better to settle for during the week!
Tapas style (small plates) restaurant. Each app was excellent. Really liked this placed and the drinks ere also good. Small space with limited seating so be prepared to sit outside.

I love the atmosphere and the food is awesome!  Their hummus and pita bread, rocks!!!  Oh and the Djs music is very soulful and will have you rocking in your chairs.  I will most definitely be back!!!
Amazing food, INCREDIBLE drinks, very fun atmosphere. Only negative was the noise. It was so loud that that we almost had to yell to each other at the table.

The customer service in this place is awful. We waited for an hour and a half only to be told that they gave our table away.  The manager did not offer an apology for the mistake and informed us that he could put us back on the list for another half an hour. He did not make any attempts to remedy for issue instead didn't care if we were going to write a bad review about the restaurant. The place is extremely loud for any kind of outing with friends and expect an extremely long wait that you may not be able to get in.

Soul has made a lot of changes since I've last visited when they first opened. I've recently gone back to meet star bartender Andy Maurer. If you're looking for a great, fun and creative cocktail experience...this is where you need to be. None of that crazy "mixology" stuff, just great drinks for real cocktailers. Also great food! The Korean BBQ wings, amazing! Friendly staff and great music. Most Monday's are old school night. And, I mean real old school. Marvin, Teddy, The Spinners, real deal music. Even if you just go for brunch, make sure you get there!
Pros: Sushi is good  Cons: Service slow and lacking, music too loud, people seated too close to you.  Recommend to others: Yes, if they are the patient sort.

I was in Charlotte visiting for business and stopped into Soul Gastrolounge. This place is AMAZING. The food was unique and full of flavor. Marshall the bartender was very sweet and personable. Even when we left around 9:45 on a Wednesday night, there were still people coming in trying to get a table. We did have to wait a little bit but it was well worth it. I would recommend showing up earlier rather than later. Great experience overall! I highly recommend for a new, fun place to eat/get drinks.

My favorite restaurant in Charlotte, not even close. Tapas and sushi mostly, everything is good. I need places to have good energy to want to go back and Soul has it, good music, good food, mostly good service.  Highly recommend the Lamb Lollipops, Soul Wings, Southern Fried Oysters, Wild Mushrooms on Toast (yes, try it), and for sushi - Replay Roll and Soul Roll.  The cupcakes are hit or miss and have mostly been a miss for me lately.  I could eat here 5 times a week.
I wanted to order everything in the menu. Our waitress went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied. Great and innovative food and they had a dj live mixing. The pork belly tacos are a must.

I always dread the long wait to get in but I totally get why there is one. Food is amazing, I've never had anything here that wasn't delicious. The family style portions are great for a girls night out!
Amazing people and music. Food smelled divine, didn't eat, but the size of the crowd definitely said this ace was hoppin'! Great drinks and the service staff was amazing! Can't wait to go back!!!

I'll definitely be back. I woke up this morning wondering what I'll try next time.  I'm ashamed to say it took me so long to eat at Soul (I'd been for drinks before). I'm a huge fan of the tapas style menu, and one of my favorite places no longer exists (Las Ramblas). Soul has great food. I loved the salmon o pita, saganaki (fried cheese), piquillo pepper bruschetta, and garlic french fries. The curried lamb skewers had awesome flavor, but were a tad bit dry. The marinated mushrooms weren't that memorable.  Our service was great. I tend to watch the wait/bar staff when I eat out, and I noticed they really get along and help each other out at Soul. I hope the owners appreciate them.  Comfortable atmosphere. I don't mind loud music as long as it's good. It was a pleasant experience, with great company :-)

Loved this place.  Tried 4 or 5 tapas, beef chimichuri, Korean BBQ wings, ahi sashimi tacos, and the bone marrow!  Everything was very flavorful!  We also had the ginger mule which was on draft and it was very refreshing.  Service was also great and the only reason this place didn't get the 5th star is because it was quite loud.   Highly recommended and I'll definitely try to go out there again on my next trip to Charlotte!

Our second time here, and the food is amazing. We got the pork belly tacos (sweetly gazed & topped with a refreshing &a juicy watermelon) which are absolutely delicious, obviously very popular too because everyone had one. We also got the tuna tacos again because they're light and refreshing, and the crispness of the wonton taco is a perfect addition to it. I got the hamachi jalape√±o salad, which was amazing. Again, refreshing. My boyfriend got the chicken gyro, which was filling and tasty. I recommend this place to anyone. Price is a little up there though. Service is great. We ordered a drink and took way too long to arrive but other than that, it was great.

Okay so I have no idea why I have not written a review for Soul because this is my absolute favorite restaurant ever. In the world. First the Hip eclectic ambiance is perfect for date night or just a night cap with drink . The Dj is always on point and will have you grooving in your seat. The staff is always friendly and service is always great. I would recommend calling before hand seeing that this place is very popular and the wait can get a little lengthy depending on what time and what day of the week you go. They specialize in tapas, or small plates, which is why this place is perfect for someone who enjoys many flavors and wants to try many different things in one sitting. Each dish comes out as it is ready which is nice so you don't have to worry about everything coming out on top of each other.  I have had every thing on the menu with the exception of maybe one or two things but trust me I am getting around to it. Of course I have my favorites. The pork belly tacos are a must! Everything about them is why you should try them and I'm sure everyone who has had them will agree their truffle fries are amazing along with the fried brussels sprouts which give you a perfect balance of sweet and savory. I have had the curried lamb skewers, and the chimichurri beef which are both amaze-balls and you cant go wrong with either! The veal short ribs are to die for and you shouldn't hesitate on ordering that Ramen bowl! I can always go for those sashimi tuna tacos, the cucumber and sriracha mayo together in one bite is heaven! I always end my meal with one of those grilled caesar salads and I never regret it! They have an awesome sushi selection and the drink list is one of a kind! I wish I could give this place more stars! Soul has earned a spot in my taste bud heart forever  WELL DONE SOUL!

Really great "white table cloth" restaurant for savvy bites and inventive cocktails.   Service is on point, and the staff is really attentive and well informed on menu items and bar selections.  When in doubt in the Queen City, you can't go wrong with dining at Soul!

Randomly stopped by with a friend late on a Sunday night. Pleasantly surprised.  DJ was spinning some great tunes & the place was croweded. My friend knew the chef, who sent over a sampling of some Tapas. Very very nice. Staff was friendly & the environment was alot of fun. I've been to Good Food on Montford Dr. & this place is definitely up there with food quality. Look forward to going back again. Definitely worth checking out!

Meh.   Hostess didn't want to seat us at open bar tables ("they fill up fast" - right, by us for example?). Claimed 90 minute wait with nobody else waiting. Slooooow service after that (tapas should be relatively quick...)  Overpriced drinks ($12 for a Manhattan?) Menu seems all over the place (sushi, tapas, gastropub). Bland white bean dip. Very good fries, but nothing to dip them in. My kid liked the chicken skewers. Brussels sprouts were cooked well but were a bit greasy and a bit sweet. Also, they put bacon bits on it. Bacon. Bits.   Menu *looks* good but they miss the mark on a lot of it. I think they read some menus from good places in other cities, but never actually ate at any of them...
Food is good. We got the Pan con tomate dish and a salad which was good not exceptional. Make sure you use the nowait app to put your name in before you arrive. Overall good experience.

2 hour wait? *cries* But I wanted good food so I waited. It was worth it! The highlight was the chicken skin nachos. We all know the best park of fried chicken is the skin, so they just took the skin and made nachos. The most gluttonous glorious dish ever. I don't think I will order them again, but they were certainly an experience.  Oh, and we sat at the bar right in front of the DJ, so much fun!

Ask me a year ago and I would have nothing but good things to say about Soul.  Ask me now and meh it is.  The first few times I went there, it was wonderful. I sat at the little mini bar around the dj, feasted on sushi and reasonably priced beers and left happy.  The last few times I went I had to  *wait two hours for a table....on a Wednesday night.  I'm sorry? This is Plaza.  *joined some friends who were on the patio dining and when the server came around multiple times, she didn't even acknowledge us. Even when I started acting childish and saying I'm so thirsty as a hint. I did this because when I tried to flag her down before, she straight up walked away. *Get dripped on with rain water since the plastic covering for the patio wasnt wanting to cooperate. I hope it was rain water at least.  Their sushi rocked when I went the first few times and I would love to have it again but it wasn't in the sushi stars.   Oh Soul, you were like a bad boy crush. Fun for the first few times but no real future with you.
The wait really kills it. The food is so amazing and very reasonably price, but unless you're ready for a two+ hour wait, it's not worth it.

Ho-ly SMOKES. This spot is phenomenal and absolutely worth it. First off I'd like to mention you should use the yelp waitlist feature because this small location will get a long wait of easily an hour to three.  The chefs and owners of this restaurant clearly took time to create amazing flavor fusions in their food that you won't likely find elsewhere. Highly recommend the pork belly tacos, as well as the ramen. The ramen was different from any ramen I've ever had before and really had a unique twist with great bold flavors. We also tried a couple sushi rolls, both were amazing but my particular favorite was the special of the day, and also the lamb lollipops were absolutely worth the price. Judging on the tasting I had with a sprinkle of things across the menu I can only assume everything they have to offer is amazing. That being said if you go with a group I'd recommend ordering a lot and sharing with the table so you can try a bit of all the unique flavors! (PS, while we didn't order it my friend said the only thing they've ever had that they didn't like was the white bean dip so maybe stay away from that!)

My husband and I love coming to Soul for a date night. It's ALWAYS packed so just be prepared to wait or sit at the bar. The food is hit or miss for me, but the portions are small and the menu's always changing that's the fun of it. The drinks are always good and the atmosphere is awesome

The vibe here is really nice. Its definitely a good date night or mellow night out. There is a bit of a wait during their peak hours which could be a little discouraging if you are looking to sit quickly somewhere.  Although, it may be worth it to hang around a wait for  the bar or outside seating when the weather is nice. I had the sushi which was pretty good, most say its hard to mess up sushi but I disagree. The chicken wings are also a great bite. Their menu options are a tad different than your normal restaurants but who said you cant try something new. The service was pretty decent and the music sets off the nice vibe I was speaking of.   Overall, the experience was enjoyable. During our wait the floor manager made sure that we were taken care of from beginning to end. I would recommend them if you're looking for something relaxed with a good ambiance.

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! The venue itself is great, there's a lot of interesting art and a cozy environment.  The food here is SO good. I love the tapas situation because I got to try so many things. The first time I came I LOVED the flatbread, pork belly tacos, shrimp ceviche, and salmon pita. I couldn't decide which I liked best. We also got the lamb skewers which I'd give 7/10--pretty good but nothing exciting next to the other things we ordered. This was TOO MUCH FOOD, and we only ate about half and took the rest home. Depending on what you order I would say 3, maybe 4 dishes is good for 2 people. We also got a Sapporo each, which ended up coming in a HUGE can, 2 full drinks worth. All that plus tip came out to around 70$ if i remember correctly. Considering how much I'd heard about how pricey Soul is I thought it was a good deal and totally worth it for what we got.  The second time I came we got the lamb lollipops, the dip trio and the tuna tacos. All were great, especially the lamb (although not worth 20$) but I wasn't as blown away as I was the first time.  I've yet to try the sushi but WOW it looked good when I saw it being brought to other tables!  Both times we went on a Tuesday around 6:30 and were seated right away.

I was looking forward to this place but the food was  disappointing. The Korean bbq wings were spicy but had no flavor and were too dry. The fried oysters were breaded too heavily. The pork belly had poor texture and no flavor and was just soaking in a salty marinade.

We didn't wait long because we went on a Tuesday night and it was only me and my boyfriend. We were seated by the bar in the corner, which isn't a bad spot to be in!  There are only a few pescatarian friendly options but we had the hamachi and jalape√±o special, babaganoush, salmon taco, shrimp skewer and a sushi roll (the only one that didn't have a fried component). The waiter said they have the best sushi, but of course they do because everything was fried!   The hamachi had good flavor but mine had a piece of bone in it.  The salmon tacos were small for the price and the fried wanton was too greasy (I like the idea but it wasn't as tasteful as I thought) The shrimp skewers were good but not spectacular. A bit too salty for my taste! The babaganoush was good but the pita chips were overbaked.  The food comes out quickly, yet there is still a 3-hour wait on weekends. I suggest meat eaters to come give this place a try but may not be so suitable for pescatarians!

Best places charlotte. Out of control good. Get the ramen, pork belly tacos, soul roll, lamb lolly pops (you really can't go wrong at this place) get the no wait app bc they don't take reservations but that really helps!
Pork belly tacos were insanely good. Original and surprisingly perfect in every bite.

Oh. My. Stars! The food is excellent. We stopped in on a Monday night around 7:00 and were seated immediately. The vibe is relax chill set to a jazz/slow jams music background. Our server Marlon was excellent. We started with he ahi tuna tacos. Let me tell that you need to order one of these per person. There are three on the plate and you will not want to share! We also ordered the chimichuri skewer, shrimp ceviche, salmonkopia, and Korean wings. For dessert, the dark chocolate cupcake!!!! You cannot go wrong with anything on he menu. Go there now.

Can't believe I've never written a review for this place and I've been eating here since 2013. Let me start by saying they have been extremely consistent since 2013 which is rare and very important at the same time.  Consistent in many POSITIVE aspects: 1. The customer service from hostess to bartenders to servers at the table. 2. The food is consistently GOOD & we've eaten all over the menu from front to back. From Tapas to full plates to sushi to sides. 3. The drinks  are very consistent in flavor and alcohol levels to ice The one NEGATIVE consistency: 1. THE WAIT & not accepting reservations  The plus to the only negative consistency I have is that they offer table places using the NoWait app which is new and a HUGE plus. Lastnight my husband and I were at a concert and was able to put our name down in line while enjoying the last two acts because it specified that we had 89 - 110 minutes before our table would be ready and showed us that there were 24 parties before us.  Let's Get down to the goodies. The food is not complex it's straight forward and GOOD. Some of our go to's are: Sashimi tacos  Fried oysters  Garlic shrimp skewers  Lamb lollipops  Beef skewer  A number of sushi rolls which we tried the Godzilla lastnight and wasn't a huge fan due to the cream cheese. I asked if they could only put 1% on and was told YES however they put 101%. It was too creamy and we ended up picking out the cream cheese per piece before eating.  Our server was super cool and he noticed all the cream cheese on our plates and once we ordered dessert Chocolate Bread pudding (which was amazing) he brought it out and informed us that he was comping it due to the mix up with the cream cheese which we Super cool as we didn't complain we just took the cream cheese out and ate the roll. This place is the perfect DateNight spot with the dim lighting and cool music. It's also a cool spot to catch up with friends and enjoy some drinks and small plates.  If you are going for the first time please note that it's not accessible friendly as you have to climb the black fire escape black cast iron stairs to enter. Don't quote me on this because maybe there is a secret elevator that no one knows about but I've never seen it or I inquired about it. I'll find out and update my review if such a thing exist.
The drinks are awesome. While the food is pretty good, It adds up since they are small plates. Don't go there hungry, but more so to enjoy drinks and an appetizer. Always prepare for an hr wait.

We went to Soul this past Saturday night for dinner for the first time.  We were impressed by our initial entrance.  The restaurant/bar is situated on the 2nd floor of an old restored brick building.  The outdoor seating offered fantastic views of the Charlotte Uptown skyline.  Inside there are a few booths (with high backs), a few tables, a bar, a DJ booth with stools, and some sofas and chairs.  All in all, it offered a great, casual, fun atmosphere.  The place was "hopping," but luckily, we were seated right away at some empty stools indoors around the DJ booth (who wasn't there at the time).    The menu offers a variety of tapas.  We had a hard time picking out which ones we would order, but finally were able to narrow it down to five to share.  We chose the (1) Sashimi Tuna Tacos, (2) Lamb Lollipops, (3) Bone Marrow, (4) Boursin Cheese Stuffed Piquillo Peppers on Bruschetta, and (5) the Sushi Crunch Roll.   The tuna tacos were very flavorful and were like very mini tacos.  The lamb was good and tender, but I probably wouldn't order them again because I'd rather try some of their other (cheaper) skewers of meat.  We were adventurous with the bone marrow, but it was our least favorite and something we wouldn't order again.  It was a little too gel-like for my taste, although one of them tasted like egg (?).  The bruschetta was creamy and rich with flavor.  I'd definitely order that again.  The sushi crunch roll was huge!  It was very wide, so we had to cut it in half before eating it.  I liked it, but I've had better crunch rolls, so I'd try a different kind of sushi roll next time.    Our server was fantastic.  She was very friendly and, being that it was our first time, she explained a little bit about the menu.  Even though she had several other tables, she kept checking on us after each tapas was brought out.    All in all, we had a fantastic time and it's a great place to hang out for a date night, with friends, or to bring out-of-town guests who like a vibrant scene.
One of my favorite places in Charlotte. The food is delicious and ambience is cozy with a sultry vibe.

Incredible small plates that delight the palate. I love the pork belly tacos!! The sushi is fantastic and the truffle fries are sinfully delicious. With amazing drinks by inspired bartenders you will have a gastronomic delight!

tl;dr: GET THE ASIAN GLAZED PORK BELLY TACOS WITH WATERMELON SALSA!!!!!  More notes: Only reason I took off a star is because they don't take reservations and seating is limited. Show up when they open (5pm) or be prepared for a long wait. We've waited 30 minutes on a Friday night before.   Made the mistake of going on a Saturday night around 7pm and they told us the wait was going to be 2-2.5 hours. That's insane. We tried to wait for a seat at the bar, but it was too packed and you'd practically have to get in a fist fight with other couples waiting for the same thing. We ended up placing our order to go- the bartender was super nice about this, gave us water with cucumber slices while we waited, and was very friendly. The menu is small plates, and I have always been with my husband and we order anywhere from 3-5 to share.   Since this review is skewing negative, let me get to the positive. ASIAN GLAZED PORK BELLY TACOS WITH WATERMELON SALSA!!!!! This is all you need to order. In fact, this may be all you need to eat again for the rest of your life. This menu item should be trademarked. As we were eating them, eyes closed in ecstasy, I wondered who the chef was behind these tacos. They cannot possibly be paying him or her enough. These tacos are seemingly simple. They are small flour tortillas topped with exactly 3 cubes of the Asian glazed pork belly and 3 cubes of watermelon "salsa", which is really just watermelon in some sort of vinegary marinade. I am seriously not doing these justice right now. I don't even love pork all that much, but I will always order these- they are life-changing. For frame of reference, That time we got the to-go order we ordered 4 orders of the pork belly tacos, 2 for each of us. Didn't give the rest of the menu a second glance.  We have eaten at Soul a handful of times now, tried various other things on the menu. We tried the sushi, it's fine. We tried the bone marrow, for fun, and that was cool and tasty. But we always come back to those tacos. They might be my death-row last meal sort of choice. The combination of sweet, salty, sour, crunchy....I am drooling just thinking about these, days later.   Oh, the cocktails are also good. :)

I'm throwing my lot in with Julia on this one. Soul is an Uptown restaurant that somehow got lost down Central Ave. Trapped on the wrong side of the tracks. It isn't comfortable here.  The food was nice enough. I was surprised at how much of the menu didn't appeal to me, but that's probably a function of them being adventurous cooks and me being a picky patron. Regardless, I found somethings I wanted, and when the food arrived (green onion hummus, salmon-o-pita, and mini-burgers) it was delicious. Not paradigm changing, but definitely worthwhile.  Yet the meal's experience was lacking. It had the loud, rowdy atmosphere of Plaza Midwood, but also the snobbery of aging Uptown frat boys. That is a weird combination. I like the Plaza Midwood energy. I can handle frats. But they don't work well together.  And vis-√†-vis music, I prefer Twenty One downstairs.

Happily surprised with this place. The interior is very cool with the original exposed brick, that said when it's 30 degrees outside (not very often in CLT) you'll need to keep your coat on inside, it was cold! When I see a menu this large and so varied I tend to cringe...there's no way they can do all of these things really well. I was wrong. Ordering is tapas style which we love, sharing a bunch of plates.  Had the tacos w watermelon, Red Dragon sushi roll, ramen bowl, and Fries. All were very well done, great playing and strong tastes. The fries were our favorites, no need for sauce or condiments, tacos were cool, different and surprising. Ramen was legit great the broth is superb. Sushi was good but not amazing in our opinion, wish we would've ordered the stuffed shells that a table next to us got, they raved and it looked awesome. For dessert we had the bread pudding which was very good. Walked out with drinks 70$ for two of us....for this kind of food and ambiance that is super cheap. We will b back to try more of the menu!!

Just go. Order the truffle fries, the pork belly tacos, & whatever sushi special on the menu that sounds good to you. It was a PARTY in my mouth! I get goose bumbs thinking about it. This was the best food experience I have had in NC thus far. Thank me later.

Soul is one of the best places to eat in Charlotte. The dirty South nachos, the shells and cheese, and the pork belly tacos (of course) are favorites. The wait is ridiculously long on the weekends, so try a visit during the week.

Probably one of my favorite little specialty restaurants in Charlotte. Located in the funky neighborhood of Plaza-Midwood, across from Fuel, this place is small, but worth the wait, which I would expect if you get there to eat after 7pm. However, this is an official PBR restaurant and waiting for me is quite enjoyable!   Menu is all small plate and has something for everyone. I'm a fan of the sushi, tuna tacos, small sandwiches and the lounge atmosphere. Come here with an appetite and an open mind to try anything and everything. I find myself coming here often and trying a little of the same and a little something different every time. That's the fun of Soul. (and the PBR of course)
Took a while to get seated, but it was worth the wait.  The service was good as well as the food and drinks.  The pork belly watermelon tacos were my favorite.

My cousin and I were in town from NY and Texas and decided to try Gastro because the reviews were decent and there were only few restuarants open pass 11pm.  At 10pm on a Friday night, the place was packed and the wait was ridiculous. A 90 minute wait for two people. We spoke to the hostess told her we were from out of town and she seemed really eager for us to stay and enjoy their food. We waited for a table for about an hour. Not horrible. I'm sure the hostess had something to do with that. She was very sweet and welcoming.  I'm glad we waited. The food is fantastic. Definitely try the Pork Belly tacos. Three perfect bites of tasty excellence. To die for! We also tried the Garlic Shrimp skewers and Korean BBQ wings. Both were delicious as well.

This is a great place for a Friday night with the ladies or a romantic date night. Get the Pork Belly Watermelon tacos and your life will change as you know it. The Brussels Sprouts are good too. The rest of the food was ok. This place is tiny, so the wait will probably be long. We waited 2.5 hours on a Friday night, but we just hopped over to Peculiar Rabbit next door and had drinks at the bar while we waited. They had a DJ and it felt very metropolitan.
Excellent restaurant to visit with outstanding small plates. Worth the short distance from D'town.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte. Perfect for girls night or a first date. Tapas plates so good for sharing. Must try Watermelon tacos absolutely amazing. I would suggest downloading no wait so that you can show up when your table is ready, only downfall is always a long wait but worth it, especially when using the no wait app.

WAIT TIME and SERVICE: Wait time even for a Monday was much longer than needed. We were told outdoor seating wait time was 15-20 minutes, however the wait ended up being about 40 minutes. The host apologized and thanked us for waiting patiently. Our waiter was fantastic and extremely polite and everything was brought out within proper time. I would give this place a 4/5 stars for my waiter if the food tasted better.  FOOD: The specials item on Monday was Red Dragon sushi (not sure of the exact name, but it had tuna) with chicken dumplings. This is more than enough for one person, especially if you're a woman and hungry :) BUT it was not mind blowing. Keep in mind you're ordering sushi at a restaurant with random menu items. I had also ordered the Midsummer Night cocktail that tasted very watered down. All in all, I would come here for the pretty lights and good music, but food and drinks were just okay.

Wow. This is, hands down, one of the best restaurants in Charlotte. After being told about it constantly, I finally made my way there. Since my first visit three weeks ago, I have been back 3 times (thats how good the Pork Belly Tacos are). Along with the pork belly tacos, the other 8 plates at my table including the ahi tuna tacos, steak skewers, the crunchy roll, lamp lollipops, and all the other items were all absolutely delicious - nothing disappointed.   While I clearly love the food, the service is attentive and the ambiance is really eclectic and comfortable also making for a great experience. However, Soul only got $ stars from me because for even such an amazing restaurant, the three hour wait was a little overkill. I got forced into waiting, because yes I like it that much, but since you can sit and eat, talk, and drink for so long, people end up hanging around forever. For not having that many tables and being permitted to sit for 4 hours, if you so choose, the place gets a bit cluttered and you end up waiting a long time.   I guess when people agree to wait for three hours to eat there, they dont really care but the amount of extra business they could be doing is unfortunate.   But if I leave you with anything...its get the pork belly tacos!!
Fantastic restaurant.  The pork belly watermelon tacos were unbelievable.  It's good to see Charlotte restaurants taking it to the next level.

WATERMELON PORK BELLY. If you only get one thing on the menu, get the Watermelon Pork Belly. It is melt in your mouth and the sweet from the watermelon is a perfect combo. It is a TAPAS place so, one dish is NOT going to fill you up. So I think the $$ is misleading. It should be $$$ due to the fact that you have to order multiple plates to be tastefully satisfied. Drinks are sky high in cost. There is limited seating and you may end up in the lounge area eating on a couch and a coffee table. Get a drink before dinner downstairs at Twenty Two (a gallery / bar) and look at some art. Actually it is a great place to go to get a drink while you wait for your table upstairs.

I am so MEHHHHH about about Soul Gastrolounge.   This was one of the places highest on my list to try after moving to Charlotte! My girlfriend and I had a weekend visit from one of our other friends who is super into food, so we saw this as the perfect chance to give it a shot.  They don't take reservations at Soul G so we went later on a Friday night (around 9:30 PM) expecting it to be a little crowded. We ended up having to wait around 10-15 minutes to be seated so we were all good there.  While waiting, we each ordered a cocktail. The only things I remember about the cocktail was that it was mezcal-based (because I love it), and that it was room temperature. It was NOT good. Not a great start.  Once we were seated, that's when it really went downhill for us. We were seated in the back corner right next to the DJ and right underneath a speaker blaring music. The music was BUMPING and not in a good way. It was crazy loud and way too much volume for a dinner. I get it was Friday night around 9:30 but we were screaming at each other from across the table. Not fun. I'm not sure exactly what vibe they were going for here. We did ask the server if it was possible to get the music turned down a tad but I'm not sure he ever got to it.  LUCKILY, the food we ordered was actually pretty good and we were able to scream approval to one another after most of the dishes.  Asian Glazed pork belly tacos - 4/5 - You might see pictures of this all over the place and rightfully so. That's not a combo I'd really think of but the pork is juicy AF and the watermelon goes great with it. I'm not a huge fan of watermelon in the first place but it worked.  Pan Con Tomate - 5/5 - THIS was just awesome. A little bit different take on pan con tomate with spanish chorizo, a rioja reduction, and whipped manchego. As a huge manchego fan, this was a really fun one for me.  Bone Marrow - 4/5 - Love me some bone marrow. Tons of flavor but didn't really have all that much to go with the toasts. Tough to split between 3 people.  Spanakopita - 3/5 - Eh. It was alright. Served fresh which helped its cause, but I'd say if you aren't craving it, go with something else.  Queen Charlotte Roll - 5/5 - YES. tempura shrimp, cucumber, capelin roe. Big time score.  Fries - 4/5 - Came with garlic-herb salt, pecorino, and truffle. Some places overdo it on the truffle when it comes to fries but these were pretty good and served fresh.  All in all, the food was good here but the rest of the experience was just kinda disappointing. If I come back, I'll do so earlier or on a different night and I suggest if you want to enjoy some conversation that you do the same.
seriously. my favorite place in charlotte. try the guacamole stack and goat cheese bruschetta. amazing!  the ambiance is perfect for a date or girls night out.  give it a whirl!

I was pleasantly surprised by Soul. Like - extremely.  Driving up, I was mortified to see that Soul was "that sketchy place I pointed out last time we went to Dish." It's in a building where the downstairs tenant is gone and has been replaced by brown paper window coverings. The building next door has chains on the windows. So it doesn't scream - this is a good idea!  HOWEVER! Once you step into Soul, it's a different world. Very cool decor and trendy crowd. A+ for the atmosphere. Booths, tables, couches, bar, outdoor.. whatever seating arrangement you please.  The wait can be long, but there is an area to sit or you can go outside and wait and they welcome you to visit the bar in the meantime.   The drinks are hit or miss. I was served some "famous martini" that I thought may end my life at any moment and didn't have even a hint of goodness to it. Since then, I have avoided what the bartender "recommends" and go with what I'm feeling.. so far, much better.  The food is not hit or miss. It's very hit. The lamp lollipops are very memorable. They were my first bite at Soul and are my first bite every other visit. Fried Meatballs - very good. Soul Grilled Cheese - delicious. Skewers - YUM YUM YUM (have had the garlic shrimp, gyro, chicken and beef). "Soul Original" suchi rolls - yes, please! And the truffle, garlic, herb, whatever fries - I can not eat enough of those. It's just not possible.   I would definitely recommend a visit to Soul. It is all-around great. I've been on a date night with the boyfriend and taken my mom for a girl's night, been with girlfriends. It's perfect for any dinner outing.

This place really impressed me. I absolutely loved every aspect of it. It's a small and cozy size and dimly lit. It's got a really cool, eclectic vibe about it. Everything we ordered was delicious except for the eggplant dip. My friend and I savored every bite. We shared the truffle fries, the trio of dips (the tzatiki was fantastic), the chimichurri kebab, and the goat cheese & honey flatbread. I highly recommend this place and will be going back soon! I wouldn't bring large groups just because there isn't much seating available. And for sure come early. If you wait till past 7 there will be a long wait.

This place had some amazing options as far as food. The ambience is very nice and they are always busy! Our server was on top of her game and extremely sweet! The drinks were good on price and so was the food! Definitely get some sushi and if you like cheese, the fried goat cheese was amazing. We will definitely be back!   My only negative was that the host had us wait and drink at the bar, but sat people before us who came in after us that waited at the front. He also had the booths available to be seated, but he sat us at the sushi bar instead.. after we said we didn't wanna be at the bar. If someone says they don't want the bar, make sure to ask them if the sushi bar is okay before seating them there. Wasn't what we wanted, especially since three different seating options opened up, but I guess since we were just two people we weren't enough to take up such space.

The food is to die for! The most original small plates, all delicious. The problem is that they don't take reservations at all and the place stays packed. We got there really early, before 5:30, and there was already a wait. And you have to stay there while you wait. Once we were seated, the music was so loud that we couldn't talk. We were right by a speaker. I asked about a solution and our great server turned our speaker off till we finished. OMG, the good is so good, it might be worth the wait at times!

Wow! Drinks & tapas are unbelievable! Pork belly tacos are a must followed by lamb skewers! Goat cheese dip and bruschetta. tuna sushi was so so fresh! Everything was amazing, knowledgable & sweet staff. Cocktails  don't miss out on this spot or the cupcake for dessert

everything is great about this place. My only wish is that they expand soon to be able to handle the crowds that come in and have better lighting on the patio for night dinners. I love that they post their daily specials on facebook and twitter. Also their brunch is awesome.  I recommend the chicken and waffle for brunch. For dinner i always get the soul roll and the wings or the cheeseplate as an appetizer. All the drinks are unique and won't disappoint you.

You've got yourself a new fan.   Forget all the cons that other reviews mentioned. No one is perfect. And based on my experience...you are totally worth it.   Why? Because the food is pretty damn amazing!   I tried a lot of menu items and my favorites of the night were the pork belly tacos (shocker...I know) and the Godzilla roll. But honestly, everything that I tasted was good! There's so much more that I look for and to trying.   And I was also impressed with the service too! Everyone from the hostess to our waitress and the severs that brought the food out...were all fantastic.  I can't wait to come back!

Definitely a 5 star experience. We had to wait 2 hours for a table (literally) but it was completely worth it! Excellent sushi, tuna tacos and white bean dip, and the drinks are unique creations worth trying. Visiting from out of town but next time we are here we will go back for another taste!

Always great. Honestly, the only reason I might not give it 5 stars is because of how hard it is to get a table.  But, I'll let that slide, can't hate just because its popular.  Solid food, great drinks, and cool vibes.  What's not to love.  The pork belly tacos are probably the best known item on the menu.  I am definitely a fan.  The tuna tacos are pretty tasty as well.  The lamb lollipops are great, but not a whole lot of food per dollar compared to some other items on the menu.  Similar with the mushrooms on toast.  I don't if I've actually had anything bad here.  Check this place out at least for a quick drink, a Moscow Mule on tap perhaps, but stay for some snacks as I think you will enjoy them.

this is one of my favorite places to go anywhere. the food is unreal. they have a wide range of different foods that are always fresh, sexy and tastey. its really packed on the weekends and very limited seating but i enjoy going there on slower nights and i love the house music that the dj's always play. it can be a very relaxing, living room type feel to the place.
Friendly awesome staff. Wonderful food options. Great view to uptown!
Good food but a little too loud for conversations. But still... good food  A little waiting is required as they are slammed. So don't come here extremely hungry.

Food was okay, but I was so completely shocked at how unprofessional the management was. Three were told 45-hour wait, and then waited an hour and a half to be seated while they continued to seat parties of two and six at 3/4 person tables who came in. I know things get hectic, I know sometimes there are reservations we're not aware of, however ANY other establishment would not have let one party wait for 1 1/2 hours (especially 30+ mins over their estimate), while that happened.  We finally got seated and my sister asked to see the manager and way too nicely explained the situation was a bit frustrating. The manager looked at her blankly and goes "uh well sometimes there are things you don't know about....i guess i can get you a glass of wine? Try to enjoy you meal though".  Completely offensive and unprofessional, however what made it so much worse is that even though he was the one delivering our food, he didn't come back once to check to make sure we were okay. And not that we were trying to get free food, but didnt take a single plate off (btw we spent well over $200 on the meal, so it wouldn't have hurt), NOTHING.   Everything aside, whether we were right or wrong, it's the the managers duty to make sure we had a good experience, and he could honestly have not been more condescending or cared less. Any other restaurant manager would have been horrified.   Definitely never coming back. There are better places to waste time for a $200 meal.

I'm new to Charlotte but this place has become one of my favorite lounge spots!! I decided to try this place out when a friend and I were looking for somewhere to go in the Charlotte area on a Friday night and we were both entirely over the typical club scene. We decided to check them out after reading some reviews online and we were not disappointed!! The food is awesome and very reasonably priced. The sushi is very popular here. The drinks aren't that strong, at least not to me, but I'm somewhat of a "drinker" so take that for what it's worth. Service was great. Our waiter took time to go over the menu with us and point out some of the more popular and highly recommended dishes. He was really patient and nice and he even brought me a free glass of wine from the bar. I have no idea why but I didn't question it! The only downside to this place is that it's really small but very popular so depending on what time you arrive, you may find yourself waiting for a long time to be seated. We arrived around 10pm and were told there would be a 45 minute wait. We were able to find a small space at the bar to hang out and ended up ordering a few drinks and some of their AMAZING Garlic fries while we waited. This place probably wouldn't be the best spot to take a large group of people but they do have group seating areas that can accommodate a small group of 5 or 6. Parking was free and close to the building so we didn't have to walk far.   If you decide to check it out it's a must you try the Garlic fries....by far the best fires I've ever had! I'd also recommend the Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos (different but awesome), the Sushi Fondu, and the Korean BBQ Soul Wings.

Yummy, unique and not pretentious! Unique, eclectic and lots of great craft drinks! One of my favs. Only thing is sitting is limited and have to do stairs so usually hard for older folks. Worth it though!

Amazing food, shitty host service. There were at least four tables open, but no one was being seated. Talk about losing the opportunity to up sell and increase profits. Just because a table gets sat doesn't mean you should leave the other 4 tables empty.

Soul is always in my top Charlotte restaurants-to-recommend list. This place is amazing. Tiny, but amazing nonetheless.   Soul is tucked away in the second floor of a brick building in the busy, hip neighborhood of Plaza Midwood. There is ALWAYS a wait for a table at night and for brunch when available. They do not take reservations so if you're smart you'll try to get there early to get your name on the list. There have been several nights I've easily waited an hour and a half for a table and just went downstairs to 22 (an art gallery that serves alcoholic beverages) to have a couple beers before they sent a text saying our table was ready.   Soul's menu consists of tapas and sushi. It's best to order 2 small plates per person and share everything. My favorites are the Soul Roll (sushi), Lamb Lollipops, Cheese Plate, Chimichuri Beef Skewers. Goat Cheese Balls and Tuna Tacos. You can't go wrong with anything at Soul. Also, ask your server for the daily specials. They're usually crazy unique and worth trying.   The atmosphere at Soul reminds me of a small hip restaurant in New York. A DJ spins while you eat dinner or sip on craft cocktails at the bar. The decor and small space make for a vibe that is inviting, warm, and eclectic.   Parking in this area of Plaza Midwood sucks so be on the lookout for tow-friendly spots. You can sometimes park at the parking lot across the street for $5. Good luck finding street parking at night.  If you're planning on making a night of it at Soul, bring some loot. For dinner and drinks for 2 people, you're likely to spend between $100-$150. Well worth it for a fun date night that's different from the usual.   Soul should definitely be on your list of Charlotte restaurants to visit if it isn't already. It's an awesome spot for a date night or with a small group of friends. FYI, large tables will wait forever to be sat, if at all so keep it small!
Very good and affordable Tapas style restaurant. Good atmosphere...different and refreshing from the balance of CLT eateries.

Fantastic. Great add to Plaza Midwood. Atmosphere is awesome, food delicious. Love the fried oysters, mini-tuna tacos and ahi. Good skewers. You will wait forever for a table, so if you go make sure you're going to make a night out of it, have a bunch of drinks and chill while you wait. If you're looking for the one hour, in and out, it's not for you.

This place is amazing! Their music is always fantastic. Dishes can run on the small side, which I think can throw off some people that don't understand the tapas concept, but if you go in understanding that then you won't be disappointed. Another thing - like a true tapas place, they serve dishes as they are made and say so on their menu, so don't expect all your food to come out together. This does mean that all their dishes are exceptionally fresh. Also, mad props to the kitchen. I've never had anything less than perfect and they have a pretty big menu for such a small kitchen. Their servers are all really helpful and charismatic. Their hostesses could use some math lessons because they say the wait is going to be an hour or longer and then we are always seated within fifteen. Signature bar drinks can seem a bit pretentious, but bartenders have no problem making the drinks you actually want. In summary, this is my favorite place in Charlotte right now.   Fav dishes: Dirty South Nachos and Pork Belly Tacos. Both phenomenal and not to be missed.

Soul is one of the most unique, yet highly recognized restaurants in Charlotte. It's located off Central Avenue, which is quite eclectic, yet boasts a variety of great restaurants and food options.  Soul is one of those places you seek to take out of towners, or "newbies" to Charlotte. The menu changes occasionally, yet there are some mainstay choices that are always available and you HAVE to try (i.e. pork belly watermelon tacos).  Soul is a very small space, which gives it a cozy, friendly and intimate setting. They have a handful of tables, or you could find yourself on stools sitting closely to other couples. There is even a lounge area with couches and comfy chairs. If you're lucky enough to snag one of few tables on the porch outside, you have a gorgeous view of the city skyline. They also have a small bar where you can have a drink while you wait. While they don't take reservations, they have started taking down your cell phone number so you can check out some other places nearby (Peculiar Rabbit, Bistro La Bon) and they will text you when your table is ready.   Soul is mostly known for their tapas style dishes, and they offer great sushi too. I've been a handful of times, though this was before I was into the phase if photographing my food. Some of my favorite dishes include the pork belly tacos (no brainer), the lam lollipops, the fried brussel sprouts, fried oysters, eggplant parm, grilled cheese, housemade gyro, and any of their current specials for dessert (They usually have outrageous combos of cupcakes that are so amazing).   Things I wouldn't recommend - dirty south nachos (the fried chicken "chips" just weren't up to soul's standard), salads. There are too many other good things at soul, so I tell people to stay away from the salads. I'm a dietitian so I'm all about some additional veggies, but take my word on this.
Best Tapas Ever. The drinks ain't cheap, but the food is reasonably priced.   The brunch menu is delicious as well  I wish I lived in Charlotte so I could eat here more often,

This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  I love everything about it, except the capacity.  It's easier to get a spot to eat when it's just me and my girlfriend or with 1 other couple. If you have more than 4 in your party, you will definitely have a good wait on the weekends.  That being said, I don't mind a wait when I'm dining here because I'll either get one of their finely crafted cocktails or go downstairs to Twenty-Two (See my review).  Once I get a table...IT'S ON.  The restaurant is a fusion of American, Greek, and Japanese (well, sushi mainly).  It's tapas style and I'll usually order 2 small plates at a time to split.  It's a pretty interesting menu when you bring all 3 of these together.  My favorite dish is hands down the sashimi tuna tacos.  My eyes usually roll into the back of my head as I savor each bite.  They just taste so fresh and smooth.  We always get the cheese plate to nibble on throughout the meal, and it's massive...a really good value.  The spanikopita is a favorite and we always get a roll of sushi.  They have great sushi.  The quality is there and you can taste it. They have a great brunch too, love the pimiento mac n' cheese.  They also have these breakfast pierogis with fried bologna and maple syrup.  That dish is out of this world.  I love the selection of music (very loungy) and the patio overlooks the skyline of Charlotte.  Soul was voted one of the city's best restaurants for a reason.

Fun, high-energy atmosphere, good drinks, delicious food. Last time, we split Babaganoush, Southern Fried Oysters and sushi (Eel Roll, Crunch Roll and Queen Charlotte Roll) and some strong, yet tasty cocktails. Sushi, seafood and tapas are three of my favorite things in the world, plus awesome music + DJs... so much love.

Went here a little while back and not really sure about the hype... Maybe I'm missing something... The food is okay at best and the service is...well...terrible... I guess terrible is not even appropriate since we barely got any service. We sat outside since inside is incredibly loud and you can barely hear the person sitting next to you. Our server came and brought us 1 menu... We we asked for another one he said he didn't have any, even though one was sitting right behind him; so we helped ourselves... We ordered drinks which took about 25 minutes to come... After this he didn't even take our order... It took another 25 minutes for us to be able to order... and I should mention the outside sitting area was maybe half full, so not like he was terribly busy... When the food came it was just ok... The white bean and goat cheese dip is not a dip no natter what they say... It's merely cooked white beans with some goat cheese mixed in.... Overall the place is not very good... Lots of hype but nothing special... Probably won't be coming back...

Atmosphere is trendy and fun. Good wait staff.   Parking is terrible and to be expected.  Over priced for the food.   We ordered at least 8 different dishes and only 2 were good.  Probably would not come back for food.  Just drinks and the atmosphere. Somebody needs to check their taste buds in the kitchen. Nothing tasted the way it was supposed to.
Great cocktails and the lamp Popsicles are AMAZING!!!  Warm atmosphere rounds out this excellent establishment.

Let me start by saying, you will spend a lot of money if you go here. The small plates are $6-15 each but we ended up needing 3ish per person. Additionally, the cheapest wine bottles run in the 30's. With that being said, I am not complaining. Just be aware that you're not going to be filled up after 1 plate. Its best to go with a group of 3-4 so you can order more dishes and try out a lot! The atmosphere is awesome! Just make sure to get here early because the wait will be long. We got the cabernet and it was great! Here is a break down of the food....  Dirty South Nachos- 5/5 Chicken skins fried and topped with melted pimento cheese. I have always been a fan of the skin of the chicken and this was heavenly for someone who loves fried food... just not very healthy   Sashimi Tuna Tacos- 5/5 They were perfect especially the sriracha mayo  Flatbread 3/5- It was average to us  Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos- 5/5 They don't look like what you expect tacos to look like but they are really tasty. The watermelon is a unique twist  Sticky Veal Short Ribs-4/5 Solid choice!  Pan Con Tomate- 5/5- Recommended by our waitress and the ultimate favorite of the table  Spanakopita- 4/5 Good but you don't get as much as you expect and it can't beat traditional Greek made   Bone Marrow- 2/5 We were being adventurous and probably just don't like bone marrow. I won't hold it against them.  The service was EXCELLENT!

You know, we came here for the tapas dishes which were phenomenal. BUT, we were shocked at how good their sushi rolls are too! Some of the best I've had! This place is now near the top of of our "go to" list for Charlotte.

I love the vibe at Soul. It is intimate and quirky. The dishes are generally good and they are adventurous. But, don't call a dish ramen just because it has Ramen-style noodles. For now, stick to the classics, but always order dessert!

A couple things to know about Soul is that they don't take reservations, the place is small, and there inevitably is a long wait unless you come at opening time. It's got a hip cool vibe and service in general is good. I've been a couple of times and every time love love love their ramen bowl. It certainly is NOT traditional ramen but kind of an american/italian fusion on ramen with a cheese based sauce rather than the typical pork broth. The noodles are always cooked well and the overall dish is bursting with flavor. Most people like the pork belly tacos which is good but I definitely wasn't wowed like most people. Have tried a variety of other things such as their brussel sprouts, mac and cheese, mussels, and bone marrow. Everything was good but again, it's the ramen bowl that keeps me coming back.

Really wanted to go to this place for a while now. Today was finally the day. First and foremost, I have to say, that this was the most non-family friendly place ever. No high chairs or booster seats, also, we got a tiny table for 3 people (me, my husband, and our toddler). Even though our server was otherwise great, he only served the table for 2, and only brought a third glass for water upon request. We ordered two small plates: Rocky Mountain oysters (pretty good, too much cornmeal, which took away from the delicate flavor, in my opinion), and Shells stuffed with pulled pork in cheese sauce (the pork filling was on the dry side and overall underwhelming, even though the cheese sauce was delicious). My husband also had a steak and eggs sandwich, which was for some reason was served open-faced and pretty much impossible to eat as a sandwich. I tried a few bites - it was very under seasoned, although the quality of steak was top-notch. I ordered a chicken pita wrap - absolutely delicious, no complaints there.  For dessert we had the chocolate brioche bread pudding, which tasted more like a dry brownie; and banana turnovers, which were decent, but not more than that.  A few other tables around us ordered food that looked and smelled much better. And the tables are so close together that you could really really see and smell what the other people are eating)) and hear their conversations, and occasionally rub elbows.  I'm considering coming back in a solely grown up company, to try some of the cocktails, bone marrow, noodle bowl and the Korean bbq chicken wings.  It wasn't a terrible experience, but definitely a bit of a let down.

Apparently we were lucky to be seated at the bar, the restaurant filled Saturday when they opened and stayed that way our entire visit.  Despite this, our order was filled quickly.  Fantastic beer selection, we shared garlic truffled fries, and Muy Beueno Roll (sushi).  Our server was awesome, we will definitely be back!!
Great service, ask for Fletcher. I encourage you to ask questions about the menu. The meatballs are he best you will ever have.
Loved the drinks, the food (we had many things last night not one was less than wonderful).drink menus was unique. Great place highly recommend.  Love this place.

In previous experiences here, the food has been great. Service is not the best. The hostess was rude tonight and we ended up leaving before being seated. I can say we will never come back because there are too many other great places in Charlotte with better service.

I must be the only one who had a problem with this place.  I will preface this review by saying that I prefer the dives over the hip and trendy so my opinion my be biased.  I recently met a friend here to partake in their dinner menu.  I must say that first off, I was very unimpressed by their beer selection. They only had your standard Domestics on tap/bottle (Budweiser, Michelob and Miller).  I don't understand how this is possible given that Twenty-Two is right below them with a laundry list of great beers.  However, their wine selection looked admirable but alas, I'm not a wine drinker so that's were a star is lost for me.    The Food:  Overpriced but delicious.  My order of Hummus was more filling than my entree of the Pork Belly tacos.  I will say that the Pork Belly was amazing especially when paired with Watermelon, which I wasn't expecting at all.  My friend ordered the shrimp tacos and enjoyed them much the same.   The Environment:  Trendy with various ambient, trip-hop music.   I think that this would be a great meet up place after dinner with non beer drinkers.  There are definitely more affordable places to congregate with a better alcohol content.  Just don't come here hungry and on a budget because you'll just end up somewhere else an hour later.

On a work trip and thought I'd give it a shot. Cool atmosphere and vibe, good looking crowd, unique food options and drink menu. Good ended up being really good, had bone barrow and tuna tacos along with an off the menu sushi. Service was a little slow, but worth the wait. Drop in
Food took a bit longer, the bar staff, two gentlemen; were very accommodating! A fantastic mix of sushi and tapas. It is even open late, a great addition to the culinary scene, in Charlotte!!

Great atmosphere, good for date night or a small group. The bacon Brussel sprouts and pork belly watermelon tacos are a must if you go! Amazing service, went on a Saturday night and surprisingly the wait was only a little over an hour. Typically weekends you'll want to get there early to get in.
One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! Love the tapas style and atmosphere. Great drinks too! Pork belly tacos are a must.

Not sure what all the fuss is about. It has a cool interior and I wouldn't say it was not nice because it was. But the tables are so close together that you feel like you are on a group date. For some reason they did not have nearly enough menus and people were asked to share and people were asking tables next to them to borrow theirs so it was weird. Service was good, no complaints there. Food was OK but I thought it was overpriced and not that great. If you want small plates, Good Food on Montford, Dandelion Market and Heist Brewery are all better. This place is very popular with hipsters and yuppies alike, so maybe this is the kind of place where people like to go just to say they did. Or maybe I'm just too old and lame to understand the hype. But either way, we enjoyed our evening but not enough to go back again. There are better options.

Warning: Awesome Place for a Date!!!   Honestly, if you have an adventurous pallet and don't want the normal fair one night then you HAVE to try Soul.  Anyone that gives this place less than 4 stars is downright out of their mind!  I am extremely picky about the freshness of food, ambiance, pleasantness of staff, and pricing of food.  Soul's staff is always a pleasure to speak with and of the 5-6x I have been there, each meal has been nothing short of excellent!  If you do not try Soul Gastrolounge then you are really missing out!

all of the tapas we ordered were great. the highlights were the veal shortribs, lamb chops and tuna tacos. and don't miss their desserts, especially their pistachio and goat cheese ice cream. definitely a must-go restaurant when in charlotte.
Over promise and under deliver. They're resting on their laurels. Save your money and eat at somewhere with better food.

A true hidden gem... Well, hidden as far as its location but a DEFINITE staple and favorite of Charlotte's locals!  Picture this: 1) Dimmed lighting that sets a classy-casual vibe mixed with random eclectic decor, such as a giant peacock embracing the brick walls with its luscious feathers  2) Hungry Charlotte-ans filled with laughter as they line up by the bar, drinking and chit-chattering away as they WILLINGLY wait hours for a table 3) Visiting guests who are embodied with anticipation as their minds are brainwashed by locals about how amazing the food is 4) Eager faces and watering mouths as tapas are slowly brought out to their owners  yummm.. makes me drool just reminiscing about the experience and especially my meal! Absolutely everything we ordered had an extra kick or zing that took me by surprise. Every "normal" dish offered, or so it was described, had an unexpected twist of flavors.  We ordered Wild Mushrooms On Toast (Panini), Ahi Tuna with Sesame & Soy Drizzle (Skewers), Sashimi Tuna Tacos (Tapas-Meze-Small Plates), Sticky Veal Short Ribs (Tapas-Meze-Small Plates), Soul Roll (Sushi: Soul Originals), Goat Cheese Ice Cream and Pistachio Ice Cream (Soul Made Ice Cream). All this for two little girls who, by the way, finished every last bite! In parentheses are the categories of each item. I would recommend any and all of these dishes, but my absolute favorite is the Sticky Veal Short Ribs! These were the most amazing short ribs I have ever had! The meat was so tender and the flavors oh so rich. The meat slid off the bone with ease and every bite was drenched with flavors!  Aside from the amazing short ribs, I have to say that Soul houses the best Pistachio Ice Cream.. IN THE WORLD! The entire meal was absolutely divine. I can't wait to come back!  TIP: It's located upstairs, above a boutique, and can easily be missed if it's your first time. Be on the look out!

Most unique restaurant in Charlotte! I came here last night and had an excellent experience. There is a long wait but we used the app the staff recommended and overall the experience was worth it. Great service from the moment we walked into the building. We had the tuna tacos, a mixed vegetable salad, watermelon pork belly tacos, bone marrow, lamb lollipops, and the cupcake. We witnessed a family waiting next to us react very rudely to the staff over waiting a long time for their table... . I think the trick to this place is to put your name on the wait list and go explore other places like the new brewery Resident Culture. We will return again like always because we are never disappointed by Soul Gastrolounge!

The shrimp ceviche in coconut milk was AMAZING. I was not a fan of the fried meatballs or the fried oysters BUT the pork belly tacos were SO good it made up for it. Server was nice too. Cool little spot.
One of the best foodie restaurants in Charlotte. Relaxing atmosphere and outstanding eats. Extremely skilled kitchen.

Willing to give it another shot, but not impressed with the sushi.  I like the vibe, small but trendy. Great drinks.  Just was less than impressed with the roll and I had the soul special. I admit, I'm a bit of a sushi snobb.....but that doesn't mean I believe a good roll has to burn a hole in my pocket. No, I love the dive sushi joints that are actually good.  Overall not impressed.

Ohhhhhh, ScottWeaver, I believe you can get me through the night.... ohhhhhScottWeaver, I believe we can reach the morning light...  I was out running around and my friend called me, brinnnnng, brinnnnng, (that's my cell phone ringing, but really when she calls me it's Another One Bites the Dust) do you want to meet me at Customshop?  Why yes..  We meet there and she is out in the street telling me they are out of vodka.  Sunday brunch, out of vodka, what a travesty.   So we head to Soul, I have heard great things about Soul, but I wondered if the hipsters would kick us out of their club or would the servers be hipper than thou, boy, did I have them pegged all wrong.  Everyone was really nice, food was spectacular and they have great hand made cocktails.  We had bloody marys, my friend ordered chicken and waffles and I ordered an egg and bacon biscuit.  The hit of the day was the cast iron skillet of pimento cheese mac & cheese and of course,  the DJ,Scott Weaver playing great music.

The food here is amazing!! Service was great as well. The waiting time is ridiculous, but you can wait downstairs and get some wine. Do not order the bottle as I learned a small bottle(3 glasses) will cost more than buying 3 glasses separately. Check the size first. Pork with watermelon, coconut shrimp and flat bread were my favorites.

Awesome place! I love the unusual things about this place! It could be bigger because they are becoming more popular! Only thing is I was in the middle of writing this review and noticed everyone around us received their food before us when we say down before everyone. The food here is awesome but I do not like the inconsistency of the delivery!
