Every time my girls come down from the east coast, this is a place on the list that we never skip. The ambience at night is like NYC restaurant, funky music, live dj and all kinds of food - sushi to steak. The wait is also similar to hopping restaurant in NYC. Seriously you can go in at 10 PM and still have to wait 30 mins for a table (this did happen btw) But the wait is worth it. Make sure to always get the truffle fries! The kabobs are damn good and so are sliders. But their lamb chops certainly are my fav. We have even done brunch there and the menu is almos tthe same and so is the wait lol. Bt the bloody mary's make up for it!! Definitely a fun place to take your friends...be prepared for a wait, make sure to take in some drinks and just enjoy it all.

When I walked into to Soul Gastrolounge, one word came to mind... Asheville. It felt just like I was in downtown Asheville eating at one of the fun and laid back restaurants that makes that city so different from Charlotte. I love going to a restaurant where you know it will not be replicated literally 20 miles away, no chain feeling here. Soul has a unique menu with lots to choose from. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are fun so that you can order a variety with friends when you go. I would highly recommend the Tuna Taco, that was my favorite. There were so many tasty items I had trouble narrowing it down which often times I have trouble finding anything on the menu. Try this place out and you won't be disappointed! If you love dining in Asheville's restaurants you will feel right at home.
Awesome atmosphere and delicious food and cocktails. I really don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. The sushi is so fresh and the truffle fries were bangin!

Yes, there is a wait.  And there is a major reason there is a wait.  BECAUSE THE FOOD HERE IS FREAKING DELICIOUS!!  I went here with a group, and we decided to devour everything in our path.  Here are some of the must haves:  1.) The Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos.....are you kidding me??  These were some of the most delicious things I have ever put in my mouth.  I could take a bath in that glaze.  And topped with watermelon....who was the genius who came up with that?  I want to marry that person.  2. Sashimi Tuna Tacos.  Prior to eating here, I wanted nothing to do with raw anything.  I am a changed woman after having had these tacos.  Between these and the Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos, this could have been my whole meal and I would have gone home happy.  But there is more.....  3. Fried Brussel Sprouts..... fan-freaking-tastic.  Maybe not the most exciting thing to order, but so delicious all the same.  4. The dips.  Oh yum, the dips.  We had tzatziki, babaganoush, and white bean dip.  With crisp pita chips.  No, I don't weigh 500 pounds.  But after having to physically sit on my hands so I wouldn't lick these dips from my fingers, I probably should.  5. I was told that this place has some of the best sushi in the city.  So of course I had to order a roll.  And I was not disappointed.  I got the Red Dragon Roll, and one of the others in my group got the Dancing Tuna Roll.  Orgasm in my belly.     6. Various members of my group got different types of skewers.  Chicken, chimchurri beef, and gyros.  Now while I didn't try all of these personally, the fact that these skewers disappeared into various bellies within minutes of hitting the table likely speaks volumes as to how good they were.    7.  OH MY GOD, THE TRUFFLE FRIES.  THE MOTHER-FREAKING TRUFFLE FRIES.   My only caveat is that we were so full by the end that we could not possibly fit in another bite and so did not get to try dessert.  But it's okay because I will be back very very soon to eat my way through the rest of the menu.    This place is absolutely, 100% worth waiting for a table.  Spend the wait by going to the bar for one of their cocktails, the Nude Beach and the Cucumber Mule are so delicious and refreshing that you may just forget that you went there to eat......though I wouldn't recommend that.  Ask for Matt as a server, if nothing I mentioned above sounds appealing (and if it doesn't, just forget about going, because you obviously have no taste), then Matt will definitely recommend something on the menu that will have you licking your plate, he knows his stuff for sure.
The best food in Charlotte. The most common complaints are seating and waiting. I have gone there four times. If u want a nice calm dining experience get there at five.

In my global travels and foodie adventures, This is one of my favorite places I have ever stumbled upon. We came here on a Sunday night after a mediocre dinner elsewhere and wanted some yummy dessert and post-dinner drinks. Our server was attentive and very passionate about describing her drink recommendations. As a big city girl, I was shocked and couldn't have  been more impressed with the amazing cocktail they served me and how well it complimented my bread pudding. I will absolutely be back here if I ever get back to Charlotte. The place was hopping for a Sunday night so I am obviously not the only person who loves this place!

Seating is nice for a coffee shop but not a bar, only a few traditional tables, otherwise you end up eating at a cramped bar or off a coffee table.   We went here hoping for good Mediterranean food - evidently sushi is the way to go.   We had the dip trio and while the tzatziki and babaghanouge were above par the hummus was flat and flavorless.   Also ordered the spanokopitia which was disappointing.   The phyllo was dry and not buttery and there was a scant amount of feta to balance the spinach.   The linguini special was very good as was the grilled ceaser salad.   The sushi looked amazing and some of the other small plates looked worthy of a second try.  But it may be time to jettison the Mediterranean aspects of the menu which lack the same quality.
Good atmosphere for a relaxed lounge night with the ladies. I am exploring the Charlotte area and I  will be returning

Ate dinner at the Peculiar Rabbit on a friend's suggestion, but wish I ate here instead. We popped in for a drink and were welcomed very warmly by the hostess. The DJ was playing some very cool lounge music. The bartenders-awesome! The guys gave my friends and I great recommendations and were very fun to chill with. I WILL be back for sushi and their brunch sometime in the near future!!

There isn't a thing on the menu I haven't enjoyed! Even the cupcakes!! You can always trust that the staff will help you choose what's new and fantastic. I'm not a picky eater, so I even let my server pick all of the tapas on our last visit! I want to say we had at least 8 or 9-Every item she chose was amazing! The cocktails are incredibly delicious (I'm a St. Germain lover) and they have a wonderful wine list. Love how cozy it is inside, too!

Went to Soul for this year's birthday dinner. I had heard so much about it and I was very excited. Soul didn't disappoint but I can't say that it was the best meal I've ever had. We ordered all the recommended items. I can say that the cocktails were pretty fantastic. I had the Winter Mule (fantastic!). The pork belly was perfectly tender and had a nice crispy exterior. The only disappointing part was there was a slight taste of something else (maybe fishy). Perhaps it was time to change the oil that they finish the pork belly in. The fish on the Soul Roll was fantastic but the roll could have used some more flavor. The Dirty South nachos were over the top indulgent and I loved them. I could feel my arteries tighten LOL.   Overall, I'll stop in to Soul again and I'll deem in Charlotte good :)

Came here for dinner on a Friday night, we got there early in an attempt to beat the wait and we just barely did. We got there at 5 and starting at 5:30 the place began to fill up. The tables are very small and very close together so just prepare yourself for that.  I wasn't able to eat the sushi but my husband did and he said it was excellent, can't wait until I am able to give it a try myself!  We also had the pesto arugula flatbread and that was probably my favorite item. The goat cheese with the honey garlic was perfect. We also sampled the shrimp skewers which were good but nothing super amazing. We had the southern fried oysters which I quite enjoyed and the dipping sauce was very delicious, spicy but not overwhelming. We had the serrano and manchego cheese on toast which was delicious. Overall everything we had was good and we will def go back. I will def. be trying their sushi personally as I hear it is the best in the city!

this place is adorable. I went on valentines day. the wait was an hour and a half but I got seated really quick. I had the sushi, and tuna tacos. it was soooooo good. to bad I'm not from Charlotte or live there, but if I do I will visit this establishment again.

This place is so fun! Went on a weekday night around 10pm. The place was pretty busy, but we only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated.  There was a DJ playing some tunes.. Delightful atmosphere...  I ordered the sushi and it was delish! It came served with this sauce, not sure what it was, but it was so good!!   There were so many things I wanted to try on the menu that I'm gonna have to keep coming back for more!   I definitely will bring friends/family here when they come visit.

I have been here three times and if they were open for lunch this number would be higher.  I have ordered a wide variety of items and have found each and every one of them to be quite enjoyable.  I rarely order drinks when I am out because I have an extensive bar at home and work at the best liquor store in the carolinas, but I did order drinks here and they were as good as the food!  The place is small and crowded, but it is worth the wait for the excellent food and drink that are available.  This is just one of those places that everyone needs to try at least once.  The menu is a lot of fun and you should have no trouble finding something that you will enjoy a great deal on it.

During my visit to Charlotte my friend chose Soul as our first stop for a fun Friday night and a bite to eat. Upon walking in, I noticed it was jam packed and that reservations may have been needed. We went ahead and put our name in and the hostess said it would only be about twenty minutes. Nice, thats a drink at the bar first!  The bar had a spacious standing area that I was happy about. (I hate lurking over peoples shoulders so that our feet are in the "bar area"). About a drink in and another on the way, we began talking to the group beside us and found out a few went to the same college as my friend which spurred more chat. It must have been twenty minutes later...(although I was now 3 drinks complete hhmm), when the hostess signaled us to a large table nearby. Our new friends were still waiting so we invited them as well.   The place had such a great energy that everyone was feeling the buzz. We ordered more drinks which was when I was introduced to the Firefly Peach cocktail. Things were fuzzy after that drink made it's appearance, but damn it was good!  In the haze, I do recall having a few tapas passed around and thinking they were tasty morsels of goodness...I just can't recall what in the world they were....

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants, however after multiple bad experiences I can't say that I will be dining here again. My most recent experience was definitely the last.   It's always a rough time trying to get a table so I'm always prepared for a lengthy wait. My party of 3 was quoted a wait time of 45 mins to an hour, however after over an hour of waiting we started to notice party after party walking in and getting seated right away, including a party of 6. We spoke with the hostess who informed us she can't seat a party of 3 in a 6 person booth. Even if we've been waiting so long? They'll keep it empty until the required number of people show up? Doesn't make sense.   Once we got seated I spoke with a manager and let me tell you I have never had worse customer service coming from a MANAGER. He completely dismissed my concerns by simply saying there were things I didn't understand. He made it perfectly clear that my experience was none of his concern and I was not valued as a customer.  It is clear Soul Gastrolounge only cares about one thing, and that is the money, and not customer service. Needless to say, an hour and a half wait and $200+ tab is not worth it to be treated so unwelcoming.  I might add that, despite running food to our table several times, this manager never once checked in to see how the rest of our experience was.

Completely and utterly blown away.  Soul has always been on my list of to-dos, but I think I always found myself going somewhere else because I couldn't find anything super special about this place ... but boy, was I wrong.  We came in around 8:30 p.m. on Monday and didn't have to wait, but the place was packed. Seated and greeted immediately, we took a minute to look over the menu and decided on starting with the dip trio; we chose hummus (which I believe was Tahini that day), tzatziki, and some caviar sauce. Despite loving all three of them, the dips lasted us all our courses, and there was still so much leftover at the end.  With guidance from our server, we ordered the Korean BBQ wings, dirty nachos and pork belly tacos.  The wings were super tender, and the sauce wasn't anything I expected. Honestly, I could've done without the dirty nachos; the chicken skins tasted almost burnt and the pimento cheese seemed to be just melted American. The pork belly tacos were by far my favorite, and they are reasonably hyped. Sweetness of the pork belly was perfectly balanced with the sourness of the watermelon.  For dessert, we had the chocolate brioche bread pudding with a miso caramel ice cream. I loved the ice cream because the caramel wasn't too overpowering. The bread pudding itself wasn't too chocolatey either, and the perfect size.  Needless to say, will be back, and I can't wait.

After reading several reviews re: wait times, we decided to try this place right at 5 p.m. when it opened for an early birthday dinner. Overall it was a lovely experience. The cocktails tasted great. The food was delicious and the host and waitress were very friendly. As it got busier, the service was a little slower and I do wish the prices were more reasonable considering how small the portions are (even for tapas). But overall, if you'd like to indulge on a special night out, this place was great.
If you love good music, atmosphere and tapas this is the place to be! The steak and egg is the greatest! I would eat 10 of them if I could.

Hipsters... hipsters EVERYWHERE!!  Seems like this spot is where all the cool pigeons flock. Gross.  BUT THE  Pork Belly Tacos. Sweet, salty, crunchy and juicy in one bite! And the Red Dragon Roll (sub all tuna for more salmon) is right behind it!!! Frikking derricious!  Other than that the dry, dry truffle fries is not worth ordering. And the meatballs is.... O.O bleghhhh. I hated it. It reminded me of American meatloaf. I hate meatloaf.

This place has got soul! Too cheesy? It's okay just keep reading it gets better I promise. I just had to! Originally this was going to be a 5 star review but after a prompt return visit the hostess's bitchiness and ineptitude caused me to take away a star. More on that later. Buckle up kids this is going to be a long review.  I probably have to give Soul the award for some of the most creative and tastiest cuisine I've ever had in Charlotte. Yes it's that good. Even when you order something that sounds fairly normal, they managed to give it a creative twist. I'm so appreciative of that! The interior is very small, crowded and very loud. So be prepared for a long wait sometimes, especially since they don't take reservations. But the staff is nice without being over the top, and water refills are kept up. I especially like that they serve it with cucumber instead of the usual lemon. I never like the taste of lemon in water, but I do love the flavor a slice of cucumber can infuse!  My first trip here I went with tuna sashimi tacos, an amazing duck confit pasta topped with crispy sweetbreads and foie gras, and grilled toast topped with wild mushrooms and a fried egg with a Dijon vinaigrette. Finished with last but not least goat cheese ice cream. This meal contained probably some of the best things I've ever eaten anywhere in Charlotte.   Lets start with the tuna tacos, I've had something similar to this dish while I was in Cali, it was a deconstructed fish taco and so I was excited to find it here! It did not disappoint at all! The guacamole was flavorful and added dimension and fattiness to the tuna while the fried wonton wrapper gave it a lovely crunch, yum.  Next up came the duck confit pasta, now if the last dish was awesome this would qualify as a masterpiece. The duck confit paired with the delivered such amazing flavors that this dish could have easily fit into a high class restaurant. The foie gras' earthiness and richness complemented the pasta and gave it amazing depth of flavor, while the crispy sweetbreads brought the whole dish together some much needed texture. This dish is best eaten in small amounts though because it had such a rich, luxurious mouthfeel I felt quite sated after finishing half of the plate.  The last savory course of the evening was grilled wild mushrooms with a dijon vinaigrette over charred toast and topped with a fried egg. I wasn't even going to get this dish because I was quite full but I saw the table next to us get it and I had to have it. I thought this dish was the most balanced of the night with complex flavors and textures melding together in glorious harmony. Just get the thing and you'll be singing it's praises too.  Feeling like an overstuffed plush at this point, I decided to go all in and order the goat cheese ice cream. You could taste the grassiness of the goat cheese and the ice cream felt surprisingly low fat which surprised me. I think I'd prefer it if the flavor kicked me in the face next time like *WHAM* that's goat cheese alright! and maybe make the ice cream a bit more decadent? I just feel like you want to go all out for dessert and this let me down a bit.  The music here is very very very loud. I couldn't hear what my dining partner about a foot away was saying, I almost contemplated just texting each other across the table. The hostess the first time was perfectly nice, but my second time was so rude, unfriendly, and nasty that I just took my business elsewhere. For such excellent food though I'll brave all these missteps and take my chances.

Extremely experienced sushi chef. He uses his skill set on providing the best quality and presentation of the fresh fish he uses. The taste is phenomenal and it is definitely one of the best sushi places in Charlotte for sure. He always tries to bring something new each week with a specialty item which keeps the menu interesting. The ambiance is great and definitely a great place to grab a drink.   Everyone should definetly give it a visit!!!
A really good tapas place that has a somewhat late night menu as well. They also have some decent beer available.

Came in last night for a girl's night and we were told the wait would be at least two hours. Normally, that would result in me trying someplace else but soul uses an app that allows you to monitor how many tables are ahead of you. So we went to common market for drinks while we waited. When we got back everything was awesome! They had a mussel feature that was delish. The guacamole stack is great with crispy bits of garlic. We also had the gyro skewers that we loved and a fantastic flatbread with pistachio pesto. Atmosphere is great and I highly recommend Jamie as a server. Very attentive and they have a great support staff. The fact that we could walk away made it feel like two hours was nothing. The experience made it even better!

Walk with me up a long staircase to the 2nd floor to opens up to a covered deck lined with tables that are packed then turn left and walk the restaurant that is also packed...this alone let's you know you are in THE popular place. If you come alone like I did they will tell you that the tables are for couples or groups but the bar is first come first serve which you will wait over 20mins to sit down if not longer.   While I am waiting I see the bartenders making craft cocktails like the mixologists  that i love going to bars to see. But the first drink I order came out of a premix tap which was disappointing as it tastes like a margarita over ice. I told the bartender I would like something different and they gladly made me a drink that tasted like a Negroni and Sazerac had a baby and it was lovely. Then later I had a Cucumber Mule off of premix tab and it was really.   Now let's eat... I had the pork belly watermelon tacos and the lobster grilled cheese sandwich which was so yummy that I am going back for that alone. I wanna try other things on the menu like the bone marrow.   I really enjoyed it...the only down side was trying to find a place to park and the people that keep insisting on ordering drinks over me and my food without a single excuse me.

I came here for my 28th birthday with a mixed group of friends. Two very different friends both like this spot so I was intrigued. I was even more intrigued by their eclectic menu of sushi, Asian fusion, tacos, and burgers.  Everything was amazing, except this weird pork belly taco. I had a special salmon ramen with cream cheese sauce that was probably the most filling item on the menu. My roommate had a burger that he raved about and this guy eats more burgers than anyone else I've ever seen. A couple friends liked the sushi, although I'm sure there are better places for sushi.  Beers and drinks weren't as great. Most of it was served by the can, which was shocking considering Soul looks pretty fancy.  The booths are large and tall so you don't really even see other people. The space is dimly lit too.  Come for food not for drinks.
Easily my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. From the food to the views of the city, it's the best!

I love a good tapas bar because it means the portions are small, prices are decent and I can try many different things! Well, that's just what my date and I did! The place is upstairs and you walk in through the patio which is covered in the winter time, heated though. You walk in and the lighting is low, music is energetic and are greeted right away! We used the Yelp application to get on the wait-list and was sat almost right when we walked in. The exposed brick of the restaurant combined with the unique lighting was very appealing. Marlon was our server and he was INCREDIBLE. Well-spoken, knew the menu, made great suggestions and held great conversation. My date and I started off with the Godzilla Roll and Cheese Panini. Both very tasty. I then ordered the Lamb Skewer and she ordered the Mini Burgers. 3rd round consisted of Piquillo Pepper Toasts and Gyro Skewer. Everything was so good, my least favorite was the Gyro Skewer... it was just meat on a stick and a bit dry. My favorite... oh man. Those Lamb Skewers were incredible. I'd order like 30 of them as appetizer, meal AND dessert. They were so juicy and flavorful. I will definitely come back here!
This is a Charlotte original. The best chill atmosphere, tunes, small bites and custom cocktails along with genuine service. Thank you everyone working at Soul!
Snotty, pretentious, rude. Both the hostesses so rude and snotty. This place is not worth the wait or the pretentiousness! Service is awful, food was basic. Don't waste your time!

I really enjoyed the food. My party tried a good spread of the tapas and sushi rolls and none of them were anything close to disappointing.  The lamb lollipops were fantastic, as was the ceviche. I ordered one of the house cocktails(not impressed) and then switched to beer (solid selection). The service was good and friendly. The interior was a touch loud but welcoming.

Finally got here at a time that had no wait!  5:30 pm on Saturday.  Of course we had to sit on the small patio, but the food made it all worthwhile!  And our server, Hailey - best server for sure!  She took the time to explain the whole menu to help my date with her gluten-free choices.  Plus she had recommendations that were awesome!    We had the garlic shrimp skewers (totally tasty!), shrimp ceviche ( in coconut milk!), Dancing Tuna Roll (taste was so good, I wanted to just keep it in my mouth!) and the Guacamole Stack (great concept that really works!).    Can't say much for the decor on the patio, but at least it was warm.  Hopefully next time I'll get to eat inside!  Thanks to all my Yelp friends who have recommend this place so strongly!

Soul is by far my in my top three restaurants from Charlotte to Los Angeles.  Never have I had a bad experience.  The food is inventive, delicious and decadent.  The atmosphere is intimate and has a very cool vibe.  Be prepared to watch your neighbors expressions as their food is brought out - you will start having discussions about the intricate flavors and presentation and find yourself sharing with complete strangers.  I absolutely cannot go here without ordering at least two of the Pork Belly Watermelon Tacos.  Those alone are worth the trip.  This evening, we tried one of the specials - tempura asparagus with garlic aioli...yes, please!  We did ask for some extra aioli on the side and continued to sample it throughout the entire meal.  Next up was the Soul Roll - spicy salmon, cukes, jalape√±o, sliced white tuna, wasabi aioli, spicy mayo sauce  - just enough kick to finish off the delicate white tuna.    We followed the roll with the Pan Con Tomate  - Spanish chorizo, whipped manchego, rioja reduction - the fresh garlic and whipped manchego literally made me want to scrap the plate clean.  And don't miss out on the Flatbread with truffle whipped goat cheese, pistachio pesto, honey braised garlic and fresh arugula - one of my favorites to start the meal.  Just enough sweet with fresh arugla and how can you go wrong with goat cheese?!  If you care to partake in a drink - try the pink sake - tastes like a light, crisp sweet champagne.  The cucumber martini is perfect for Summer.  If you haven't tried Soul, run don't walk - you have no idea what you have been missing!

What a cozy little cool joint up on the second floor of this corner building in Plaza-Midwood. I have been here three times and continue to be impressed with this place and it is quickly becoming my go to to just hang out with friends and have a drink. The tapas selection is great and you can't go wrong with any of them (ok, well maybe the rocky mountain oysters - which I tried and they were ok) but the goat cheese apps, the lamb lollipops, bruschetta - it's all great.   My dad would call this a "yuppie joint" but I give it two thumbs up for it's warm cozy atmosphere and great food. People watching is cool two.

This is hands down my favorite place in Charlotte! Absolutely everything I have had here is amazing, from the sushi to the goat cheese bruchetta, to the drinks on the menu. I love love love the art gallery downstairs as well, definitely a great addition to an already fantastic establishment. Each time I have been here every staff member I encounter has been very kind and helpful which I think just completes every visit! The only downside is the wait, as with every great place, however with my last visit the host had me download an app called no wait where I was able to make a reservation and watch how many people were ahead of me, so my friend and I were able to go hang out with a few coworkers while we waited.

I tried Soul a while ago, and there's a reason I haven't been back. Hubs really wants to go for a date night, but I really wasn't that impressed. It's really cute inside, but if you go at a popular time, you won't really get to see it. There is always a really long wait; 90 minutes to 2 1/2 hours - which is way too long for me to wait for food! I will say the cocktails and food are good, but go at an off-time to have a nicer experience.

not bad i guess... the wait was crazy but the place isn't so big. The pork belly tacos were good but it seems like everybody's making them now and nothing stood out about theirs. This is a place that makes everyone look cooler than they are though, the lights were super low and there was a DJ. The fries were salty and the drinks were amazing but way too expensive. I also tried the korean bbq wings which were spicy and decent. I'm not dying to get back there though. If i'm invited to join a group of friends, and I have nothing to do, I might join em.
Quite possibly my favorite Charlotte restaurant. Love the food and the atmosphere, try pork belly tacos, white bean dip, the cheese plate and the sushi.

We live just under three blocks away from Soul, we mostly have enjoyed the food, and we are pretty laid back people, so we gave this place several chances. Unfortunately, we have decided never to go back due to the consistently and rather shockingly nasty attitudes of the host staff. We have experienced it ourselves, as well as seeing it directed at other guests. On almost every visit, we have seen at least one party take their name off the list due to the rudeness of the hostess. Normally, when I read a review like this one, I take it with a grain of salt because I have worked in the restaurant business and I know how rude the customers themselves can be, but I assure you that neither we nor the others we have observed being treated rudely have done anything to bring it on ourselves. There is simply no food that is good enough to be worth this kind of disrespect. For good food AND friendly staff, walk a block in either direction to go to The Diamond or to Dish or, for sushi, take a quick drive to Niko. All of these places have food that is just as good and staff that DON'T treat you like the pile of dog poo they just stepped in.

I went a few months ago and still remember the tuna tacos I got here- definitely the way to go! The side salad was respectable but the lava cake was a bit much for me. Get the tacos! The atmosphere is great and seats open up a bit as the night goes on. I recommend sitting at the bar if you don't want to wait. Definitely worth the Uber trip on a layover in Charlotte.

This was the last stop while I was in the Charlotte area and it was the perfect ending to a great trip. Loved the cool vibe of the place. Didn't wait too long and got the best table in the place big comfy chairs and a couch with a nice long table aaah bliss! Started off with a Tito's winter mule, I'm really into ginger so I knew this was the drink for me, it was really really good. The menu is very extensive it was hard to narrow it down to a reasonable level of what we could actually eat. So here goes. Bone marrow, fried brussel sprouts, chicken skewers, serrano ham & manchego on toast,I know there was something else can't remember what and I was so into the meal I didn't get pics of everything...that alone let's you know how good it was...giggle. the bone marrow was a little too gamey for me, could be the type of meat it was from, have had it before & loved it, not so much here. Loooved the brussel sprouts the BEST i've had anywhere and I've had a lot of them :) the ham & cheese was also really good, didn't try the chicken as this was a day filled with food & drink but my dinner companions loved them. The service was great too. Would like to come back next time!

Great cucumber mule seriously best mule I've had but was on the Yelp waiting list and waited over 21 minutes over my expected time and still wasn't seated. The worst part is we were so excited to try this place out we came to the front and the host literally passed us 3 times never said anything and once my husband said hey we have been standing here can you greet us she said oh I didn't know if you were taken care of. Wait what? So you thought to yourself oh they're good without throwing out the hey guys u been taken care of?? Disappointing to say the least.

OMG, this place was flippin' amazing! We had the Brussel Sprouts, Steak & Gryo Skewers, Guac Stack, Spanikopita, Veal Short Ribs, and Huckleberry Ice Cream to top it off.  All of it was simply delicious!! I'm a total Foodie from out of town and stumbled upon this Gem on Yelp. Thank you Yelp, you never let me down!! We can't wait to go back to try more things on the menu, heard the Pork Belly Tacos are a must.

So we went back for dinner....understanding they don't take reservations.  So our party of three was told it would be about 45 minutes for a table.  Fine no worries, an hour came and went and we had show tickets so we went into ask what the hold up was...only to be told another 45 minutes.  WTF?  Hipster host who couldn't give a flip told us 'well we never can estimate a wait time,'  our response was Olive Garden seems to have no problem so surely Soul could manage to figure it out.  We looked inside and saw a four topper open and three two toppers....when asked why we can't have one of those tables we were told that 'well we had three people and there's only one table in the whole restaurant that they can seat three people at'  Cue the what the hell looks on our faces.  I mean seriously Soul.  You are trying way too hard and running off customers.  So evidently they refuse to seat a party of three at a four topper, or to push two, two top tables together.  So after wasting all of this time we went over to PIzza Peel and wolfed down our food.  Luckily we still made it to the Brian Regan show on time!  I am never ever stepping foot into Soul again.

Delish!  We are already planning our next trip bc after cleaning our plates we looked to our neighbors and thought "we did this all wrong."  There was so much more to try and we were trying to being well thought out orderers. Should have just gone for it all.   The eggplant skewers, pork belly tacos, fries and the stuffed peppers were all great.  Is it crazy out of all that I loved the truffle fries the most? Pro tip: get that spicy ranch for dipping!  My BF liked the stuffed peppers the best.  All pleasing dishes and we left happy and ready to come back for the steak skewers and bone marrow!  Great dinner!  Second pro tip: plan to arrive right at 5 for no crowd or wait.  Make it an early date night. :)

I was super excited to try this place. Ordered pork belly tacos, shrimp ceviche, shells n cheese, Brussels sprouts, short ribs, and chicken skin nachos. I didn't like any of the food. Chicken skins tasted burnt. We had a 2 hour wait. We were sat outside by the stairs where people waiting smoked cigarettes the entire time we were eating. Also a patron charged his cell phone directly behind my sister's chair and yelled to someone on the phone pushing against her chair the entire time to reach the plug. We were scared to say anything to him because he was yelling at his friends and large wads of cash were being exchanged. We did not feel safe during our meal. We read it was on the top 50 charlotte restaurants. It should not have even made the list.

Okay so we tried Soul Gastro...AMAZING food and signature cocktails!  You MUST have their Cucumber Mule...a delicious summertime drink!  The food is what we were there for though!  We started out with the short ribs and Korean BBQ...perfectly done!  Moved on to the porkbelly with watermelon tacos...also done to perfection!  The spicy with cool watermelon works well together.  We then ordered sushi and had Gidzilla roll and dragon roll...five stars!  I highly recommend this place for adults...not a kid place for sure...is very small and not reall suitable for strollers and whatnot. We will be back for sure!!!

This is one of my favorite Charlotte restaurants.  A great place to take out of town guests that enjoy a hip atmosphere in a cool part of town (Plaza Midwood).   I LOVE small plates where you can taste a number of different dishes and that is exactly what SOUL offers up.  On my last visit I must have tasted ten different dishes on our table and all of them were amazing!     TIP: Be prepared to wait.  This place is small, and there isn't much room for large parties.

I absolutely love this place! I've only been here twice but it's practically perfect every time. I kinda want to give it 5 stars but I rarely do that unless something extraordinary happened. As for Sol, it's good. Very good. The food, cocktails, atmosphere and music are on point. The vibe is very cosmopolitan and I love that. I feel like I'm at a spot in New York when I'm there. I wish there were more places in CLT with this cosmo vibe.  My second visit was recent. I ate at the bar and the bartenders while cordial weren't very talkative so I pulled a member of the staff who was just walking by and asked him for recommendations. He wasn't even my server but he eagerly stopped and spent a good bit of time with me to offer several suggestions. His name is Drew and he was fantastic!  I had their version of the Moscow Mule to drink. They have a different name for it. I can't remember what they call it but it's damn good. I also had the pork belly tacos, goat cheese balls, and chocolate bread pudding for dessert. Every item was cooked to perfection. Literally mouthwatering.  My only con is that the place is really small. Apparently the wait can be off the chain. I went 30 mins after they opened and there was already a wait but I was by myself so I snagged the one open seat at the bar and it was perfect.   Also it's pricey. All the items are tapas. By the time you order a few plates and drinks, you will have already racked up a hefty tab but it's well worth it.  Love love love this place and highly recommend it, especially if you have friends in town. That way, you can show them what a cool kid you are :) I can't wait to go back....but it will need to be for a special occasion or a splurge.

The food at Soul is outstanding!  The atmosphere is definitely an upscale casual.  I am comfortable going in a skirt or jeans.  It's a great place for a friend outing or a date night.  The Pork Belly Tacos are by far my favorite thing on the menu, but I have ventured out from the norm and have loved everything I ordered.......Dirty South Nachos (so bad, yet so good.)  If you have not yet been to Soul, you must try it.  Be prepared for a wait because this is a very small, quaint establishment, but it is definitely worth it!
Can get pretty crowded at night but it's still a fun, cool vibe with great music food and drinks!

The menu is very limited for someone with a gluten allergy to begin with. I ordered the duck panini without the bread and the chef refused. Flat out refused due to the effect on presentation. So much for customer service. Apparently how food looks is Far more important than providing food a patron can eat while taking into consideration medical issues.
#1 place in plaza midwood. Will take some time to sit down most days, but for me that speaks for how bomb the food is. Once you eat it you will understand. A+

If there's anything you should try, try the Asian glazed pork belly tacos! This was by far the most unique dish of the night - sweet and savory with rich and refreshing all combined in one. By appearance, three little cubes of watermelon sitting on top of three little chunks of pork belly don't look like a lot, but these small tacos sure pack a punch.   The shrimp ceviche in coconut milk was also a fun and different interpretation on ceviche - sweet, creamy, and not at all acidic.  Be sure to arrive early or expect a looong wait.
Everything was incredible!! Food, drinks, music, atmosphere, service. Can't go wrong with the pork belly and watermelon tacos.

The food was GREAT! Highly recommend the fries and the Korean BBQ wings! The facility is small so be prepared to wait for a seat. We opted to sit outside last night under the heat lamps it was perfect and much quieter! What you waiting for check this place out!

Gotta get the pork belly tacos, seriously, MIND BLOWING amazing. Sushi is always fresh and delicious and presentation beautifully done. Last visit, my friend ordered the lamb lollipops and raved about it. Moscow mule was on point. Definitely one of my top three favorite restaurants in Charlotte. The only downside is the wait time to get a table. I usually end up sitting at the bar (which is still great and full service).

One of my favorite spot to hang out with my bf! Lots of selections to choose from but my absolute favorite is their bone marrow (huge fan!) and pork belly tacooooosssssss OMG to die for and a must try when you go here! Loves!!!!!!?

Don't believe the hype. After reading the reviews I finally decided to go. I attempted to go a couple of times on a week night and it was always a 2 hour wait. Finally I decided to go on a Sunday night and no wait. My bf and I were seated in the corner under the speakers.  I love music in the background while eating out but it was a challenge ending a sentence with Huh.lol. our waiter african American with locs was pleasant and patient when it came to explaining the menu.   Being a foodie from NY I tasted all kinds of food and open to trying various foods. We wanted to keep it simple and ordered the teriyaki wings which were not the greatest. The sauce had a strange taste I never tasted before. I also had the spinach pockets. Not what I expected. B had the gyro which had a strange taste. So not like him to leave food on his plate.   Conclusion: we will not be returning. Everything is not good for everybody.
Soul is overrated, in my opinion. The food isn't bad, but nothing to write home about. The neighborhood is cool, though.
Some of the best tapas in the Queen city. Pork belly tacos and grilled caesar salad are two of my favorites. Sushi is also excellent
I recommend the goat cheese flatbread, wings and avocado stack but we didn't care for the hummus or the short ribs.

When somebody is visiting me in town..this is my spot to take them!! Ambience, food, vibe, drinks. Amazing place. Haven't had a chance to go in a couple months...I need to make a trip back I'm craving it....

GREAT food, atmosphere, menu, and service! Been trying to go here for a while now but the wait was always 2 hrs! But that's how you know it must be good! So o kept trying. Finally a friend and I went earlier in the evening, around 5:30 on a Saturday and sat right down, although still pretty busy. Laid back atmosphere with bar seating, table/booth, and even couches and chairs. Being tapas you can tell people hang out for hours casually and munch. Probably why the wait is so long. However, great place for dates! Unique menu would allow for great conversation. And our server was a delight as well.

Our favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Tuna Tacos are the stuff dreams are made of. Pork Belly Tacos, Soul Roll, Shrimp Ceviche, Wild Mushrooms on Toast, Fried Oysters = Yes. And the cocktails are even better if that's possible. Their version of a Moscow Mule is deadly good. PLAN TO WAIT for a table -- this way you won't be disappointed. If you go at any time that people would consider having dinner, there WILL be a wait. No matter what day. Just give them your cell number and head downstairs to Twenty-Two for a beer or glass of wine. Done and done.

I love love love the ambience. The music definitely played a huge role in the experience. The DJ is a master of mixing and he proves it in his  set. I came one evening to have the infamous pork belly tacos. I expected them to be great. What I got was way more amazing. They're so simple, pieces of pork belly and watermelon salsa wrapped in a tortilla. Looking at them, you think "seriously, what's the hype all about?" But as soon as you take a bite, it all makes sense. It's pure art. A flavor that you dream about but have never tasted- until now. I loved the experience. I definitely plan to come back.
Super small Portions! Sushi is awesome but some of the appetizers were so so. It's defiantly the place to go if u wanna be in the scene.
Great atmosphere Great food only down fall is wait time but well worth it! The drinks are on time and keep you occupied why you wait

I want to give this place more stars because the food and drinks that I enjoy here are absolutely delicious...the sashimi tacos make me dance... The bacony Brussels sprout are perfection... Don't get me started on their spin on "nachos". Fried chicken skin smothered in pimento cheese and speckled with pickled okra?!  Who is the evil genius behind this??? While there are a few misses the food is good! They lose two stars for spotty service unfortunately On more than two occasions I have visited and been treated like a peasant.  One instance it was super busy and I had eventually ordered drinks at the bar.  The bartender handed me a receipt and pen to sign but there was literally no where to rest the paper to sign with two drinks in my hand and several people just leaning along the bar I found a clear spot at the end of the bar to get it done. I put the drinks down and not even two seconds later I am scolded by some dude organizing receipts or something at the end of the bar saying I can't use the space.  I told him I was just trying to sign and pay and he gave me the Kanye shrug... Another time we my group of four was told we had to wait about an hour for seating at midnight and there were several open tables...we eventually and rebelliously just sat down and were served (surprise surprise no one came to claim the 'reserved' tables) I have a few other similar stories.  Why do I return?  Because the food and drinks are good(and usually I get outvoted). But please work on the service

The glazed pork belly and cucumber Moscow mule is why I come to Soul Gastro! It's unbelievably Scrumptious!!! They also have sushi with poke which is amaaaaazzing! Anytime I need quick bites or a drink, this is my go to.

If you ask yourself what you want for dinner and think "I would really like some good fusion food, but slightly overpriced in a cramped dark hipster-ish setting with mediocre service." This is your place.  Be ready to wait! When I say wait I mean wait like 4 hours for a table! They don't take reservations which is a pain, but if your party is small and you get there early it can be tolerable. If you get there on a Saturday night with more than 2 people you will be waiting forever. My suggestion is put your name down and go to whiskey warehouse or common market and have a drink where you are not so cramped, then walkover when your table is ready.   Went on a Saturday once and put our name down for a table for 8 at 6:30, we were not seated until 11:15.   Food overall its good, however I don't get what all the hype is about...they put watermelon on some pork belly and you would think they invented the PB&J, it's good don't get me wrong, but common people it's not that good.  Place is great if you and the significant other want a date night, but I wouldn't come here with a group of friends it's just way too tiny and cramped. Not to mention the food comes out when it's ready not all at once, and in a group its strange when some people have food and some people don't.

What a great find this place is Located in the hot trending Uptown area of Charlotte  The walk up the staircase to the second floor balcony reminded me of the French quarter in New Orleans. It was about 9:30 pm on a Tuesday and the place was packed! I liked the dimly lit and dark wood ambience. A well stocked bar, decent wine and sake list  We sat and dined at the bar. The menu is very gastro pub eclectic with things from sushi to a Korean take on wings to ramen with goat cheese balls to ahi tacos to pork belly with watermelon tacos.   The thing is everything is really good  It was now about 11 pm and the place was getting even busier and the music playing from the DJ was getting a little louder and better.   I kept thinking how much I was enjoying this place and the food and if I lived in Charlotte I would be here quite often  Time for another drink!

I LOVE Soul!  If your are looking for a fun place to eat with friends ( and the best it gets for the price), there is no place I would rather go in Charlotte.  I went their for my birthday dinner this past Friday.  The Soul Roll was amazing, the sushi was so fresh.  There is always a good dj spinning in the background.  Yes, i waited an hour for a table, but who cares?  I was sipping cava on the porch with my friends, nobody was complaining.  I am pretty sure by now, I have tried everything on the menu at least once.  Some favs:  Sashimi tuna tacos, shrimp ceviche, sticky veal short ribs, the Soul roll, and if you have room for sweets: red velvet cup cake   I think the sushi keeps getting better, I do want to try the cheese plate though, looked really good at the table next to me,( I usually get the ham plate).  The prices are more than reasonable; I always leave good and full and without buyers remorse...  We need more places like this in Charlotte

Tried the avocado salad and pork belly watermelon tacos.  The tacos were pretty good and so was the avocado salad, but not good enough to come back.  The avocado had to much brown on it, that kinda turned my stomach.  The environment was horrible, some drunk girl was making out with her boyfriend blocking the way out in the middle of the stair case.  She became very aggressive making me feel like she was gonna push me down the stairs when I was trying to get past them. They need security working that area, it's a long way down the stairs if you were to get pushed.  At the very least the management should have the aggressive behavior from their drunk customers under control. Things could have escalated very quickly to a major injury leading to a law suit.    Soul Gastro you might wanna address this issue with your management team before something serious happens to someone here.  Not a safe environment. To many angry drunk people  with no one monitoring their behavior.

Stopped by for a work dinner on a slow Monday night - luckily we got there early and had plenty of seating options.   Ordered the dip trio, the jalepeno sushi roll, the pork belly taco's and the salmon in filo. All top-notch, especially the pork belly taco's (very addictive and the watermelon on top is perfect).  Only gripe is that most of the beer specials were by the bottle versus on-tap. As usual atmosphere was cool - funky, dark and loud.   Great option for a dinner with friends.

Update time! We finally made it back for dinner last night and suffered only an hour wait. Soul is a busy place, let me tell you. While it IS very small, I can see why it takes so long to be seated: it's not a normal restaurant where one would order their meal, have it delivered, eat it, and then leave. No, not at Soul. Once we were seated we ordered a round of tapas... which did come out rather quickly... ate them... decided we wanted to order more... and more. This is a process in itself. Our group of 4 agreed on 3-4 dishes at a time, probably totalling 8-10 tapas and 2 cupcakes during our visit. Soul is known for their sushi, but I personally thought the lamb skewers, brussel sprouts, pork tacos and fried clams (the special) were my personal favorites. Sadly I woke up in the middle of the night with a HORRIBLE stomach ache- a lot of fried food, and while it comes in small portions, it is deceiving. Beware. We have been eating a lot of meatless/healthy/raw lately, so don't let the size of the tapas fool you. That stuff is heavy. Ah- and how can I forget the fried goat cheese? It was divine. No wonder my stomach hated me last night. :)

Tonight was my first experience at Soul.  I've heard nothing but great things about this place so I was really excited to try it.  We had a party of 4 and all of ordered a variety of dishes to try.  The food and service was outstanding (thanks Marlon)!

Super hip resto near boring uptown. Alison was super cool and all her suggestions were on point. We tried the bone marrow, the Brussel sprouts, and the hamachi, hands down the best hamachi dish I ever had! The ponzu sauce was the best one, too. Will be back for more!
Minus the long wait time, the food and drinks were great! Service was good as well. The atmosphere is on point. Too bad I'm not from here otherwise I'd be at this spot quite often.
Lamb lollipops yum Tuna tacos were delish Loved the truffled fries

First time in the little town of Charlotte and a friend brought me here for drinks.  She knows how profound my desire for craft cocktails runs, so this was our first stop for the evening.  It did not disappoint.    First off I love the comfy darkness of this place.  Reminds me of stepping into a speakeasy where you kick your shitty sunny ass day off at the door and melt into a bar stool or cozy chair and sip into a blissful state of relaxation.  I loved the exposed brick, the well thought out lighting and the art.   The bartender that evening was courteous and prompt.  She answered all of our questions without hesitation or any notable sense of annoyance.  She whipped us up some fabulous drinks as well.  We ordered the Flip'n Branca and Flamed Martin off the spring 15 cocktail menu.  Both so scrumptious!!    Though this review is only for a two drink experience - the food coming out of the kitchen looked amazing and I'd certainly give this place a go again!

Great food and.the servers are total pros but... dont expect to.be seated by any priority except profit.  If you come at a busy hour be prepared to watch as parties who arrive long after you are seated before you, based on their profitability.

Always fantastic. If you can deal with the wait to get a table, you'll love the craft cocktails, small plates and out of this world sushi. Soul roll, lamb lolly pops, fried chicken wings, truffle fries, avocado stack and are a few of my favorites!  Beware you must walk up some metal stairs on the side of the building to get into Soul and I am not aware of a good option if climbing those stairs is unrealistic for you.   The funky atmosphere with exposed brick and vintage wood floors, live DJ at night, great service with fun servers and consistently great food bring me back over and over for repeated delight.

I want to start out by stating that I've actually been here a handful of times but it was before my time on ye ol' Yelp. This isn't some one night five star fling review ;) Soul consistently delivers when it comes to food and drink.  Soul is a cozy, hip restaurant that has an upstairs entrance. It also boasts a patio (that's heated during the winter months) which provides an abbreviated view of the skyline. They have a beautiful bar that's pretty much the centerpiece of the space. Ladies: there's an added bonus for bar seating. They have purse hooks!! As for restaurant seating? well...I'm not lying when I say it's cozy. There are about two-three booths and then rest of the seating consists of tables that can be grouped together or broken a part for two person seating. Trust me, you'll be so focused enjoying every bite of your food that you won't be worried about your proximity to your neighbor(s).  Back to the bar....the bartenders make THE BEST DRINKS. I've enjoyed their  summer version of the moscow mule which includes cucumber - yum - and their winter version called the winter's mule. The winter's mule is hands down my favorite drink and I was that person sucking down every last drop of the drink through her straw.  As for the food....there is so much to say. The place covers Asian, Greek, Spanish, American cuisines with such understated flair and sophistication. Clearly there's a reason why the pork belly tacos are so well-documented because THEY ARE DELICIOUS. Simply put, you absolutely must get those if/when you go there. It's like a rule. Every time I've been to Soul, I always get a sushi roll of some sort. They are very creative with the flavors and I'm always pleased.   Soul does not have a designated parking lot. Don't even bother thinking about parking in the CVS lot because they will either tow your car or yell at you when you walk back to your car (mentioning this from past experience). If you're lucky, grab a spot in the lot that's across Pizza Peel/The Dish and walk over or park in the Bistro La Bon/Healthy Home Market lot. Also, don't even think about not having to wait on a weekend night. If you're like me and don't enjoy waiting long periods of time for food (although this place is worth it), come on a Tuesday/Wednesday evening.  Being that the place serves tapas-style plates, be prepared to spend a little more $$$. It's by no means a cheap place (well...depending on your appetite) and it's worth every penny.

Came here on the recommendation of my friend and it did not disappoint. Monday night so we were able to walk right in at 7pm. Usually it's a long wait to be seated. It's a quaint place and a little loud but that just adds to the ambience. Service was great. Love how more than one person takes care of each table. Drinks were always full and the tapas style allowed us to try a huge variety of delicious food. Don't go and not get the pork belly tacos or the brussel sprouts!

Besides the fact that its hard to get a table some nights (which is good for Soul) this place is a must go for a sexy date, sushi craving, late night cocktail, hipster watching, sunset photographing, and soul music. The place just has a buzz about it and the staff is phenomenal. Some of the bartenders are without a doubt the best in charlotte. Try the veal fries....they're balls.

Since I'm review #615, I'll keep it short!  - Get there a few minutes before 5:00 to make sure you get a seat. At 4:55 on a Saturday, we were the 4th group in line. - Get the pork belly tacos (the watermelon slice makes it), pan con tomate (our waiter suggested it, we were leery, absolutely delicious), mini burgers (mmm, onion ring on top), duck bahn fit (literally the best thing we put in our mouths). - Skip the fried meatballs (pretty dry without the tzatziki sauce) - My friend is Greek, and she said the Greek salad was spot on like her mom makes. I tried some of the feta with oregano, and it was deeelicious. - For dessert, we got the cupcake of the day (goat cheese with raspberry topping), and it was just ok. Thankfully, we also got the banana phyllo turnovers, which was basically warm chocolate and salted caramel in phyllo dough with a frozen banana on the side. Magical.
Awesome.   Fish Tacos, meatballs, lamb, and definately the pork belly tacos.   YUM.

Recommended to me for a long time, finally visited. Worth the wait.  Will be back.    Highlights: Pork belly tacos Sushi Skewers Mussels Wine Cocktails  Lowlights: After the sushi, the tuna tacos were underwhelming.   Brussel sprouts

Love love love this place. Every time I'm back in Charlotte, this is the place to go to. Items on the menu always come out amazing - guacamole stack, lemon chicken skewers, white bean and goat cheese dip, hummus dip, fried goat cheese on bruschetta, herb cheese stuffed piquillo peppers, pork belly tacos, fried meatballs, any of the sushi options. Amazing.  Downfall - Doesn't take reservations, so expect a long wait for nights. Also, have to find street parking in the area. If you park at Sherwin Williams after it closes, then you're fine - but during business hours, same as CVS, beware of getting towed.

LOVED this place! I had the best time at Soul, and the food was to die for. Our waitress was very nice, the wine was delicious, and although it was small and we had to sit at the bar to wait for a table for about 30 minutes, the bartenders were attentive and the time flew by. I can't wait to go again!
Awesome experience from the moment we walked in the door , service was great , food was delicious !

When my friends told me about this place in Charlotte that had a large variety of food and they started listing out the food, I thought they were just pulling my leg. Literally they were talking about tacos, wings, sushi, ramen, mac and cheese, paninis, and the list goes on. When I heard of all the choices, I thought it must be one of those spots that don't do anything really well so they just go for pure diversity so while I was apprehensive about heading to this joint as my last meal for my final work trip to Charlotte, I decided to be open minded and give it a shot. This joint is located in an area which has apparently gone through a lot of modifications/upgrades over the recent years according to my friend. The spot itself is up a flight of stairs and there are some patio seats outside and the moment you step inside, you see a bar along with a few booths and tables around.   The spot has a policy of only seating tables when your entire party has arrived so something to keep in mind if you are going with a large group. We were seated quickly given our group was present and we were given menus quickly after. Sure enough this place has a ton of options and while we had a tough time narrowing it down, we went with Asian Glazed pork belly tacos, lamb lollipops, Dirty South Nachos, Shells and Cheese, Korean Chicken Wings, the Cuban panini, and the Red Dragon Roll. We also ordered off the drink menu as the bar had an extensive menu so should be a lot of options for any type of drinker. The Asian Glazed pork belly tacos were out first and they were good. The pork belly was tender and while the watermelon chunks were a bit big, it actually was not overwhelming. A solid fusion starter for sure. The Dirty south Nachos were out next and these were really good although the presentation of it was quite interesting. The pimento cheese fondue was good but it wasn't as spicy as I was hoping for and ended up being just a bit too much cheese for me. The lamb lollipops were by far my least favorite and I would recommend staying away from it. The meat was a bit tough to eat and there wasn't a ton of flavor on this but we ended up ordering enough food to not be starving. The Shells and cheese were good and while I did not think the BBQ pork would go well, it ended up being a solid dish and I was pleasantly surprised. The Korean chicken wings were Good and I bet they are probably considered very good given the lack of Korean restaurants in Charlotte. A good dish for the local market so props to them for it. The Cuban panini was very solid and definitely a crowd pleaser. The meats were tender and it was the right balance of all the ingredients to make it a tasty panini. The roll that we ordered ended up being solid for rolls. I don't eat too many rolls anymore but it tasted like a solid roll and the fish quality was good surprisingly. A hidden surprise and I think something that would do well in the CLT market.  All in all, I think the food was good at this joint. I actually want to give this joint a lot of props for trying a lot of different fusion combinations that while sound weird, actually ended up being Good in the end. I certainly think that it's a solid spot in the CLT dining scene and want to give them props for the risks they are taking for these unique recipes.
Awesome sushi, tasty shrimp ceviche and their winter mule is my fave. Awesome ambience also!

Let me start off by saying this place blew my mind. Came here with friends on a late night Friday for some drinks and small plates. We were seated at the outdoor balcony within 5 minutes of walking up and the view of the Charlotte skyline was pretty cool at night. Our server was super chill and gave some great recommendations on items to try since it was our first time. We ate about everything on the menu haha. Never in my life could I have thought to order hummus, Korean bbq wings, pecan seared trout, sushi rolls, flatbreads, or aioli french fries and been so impressed with the quality or the inventiveness of the kitchen. I even pitched in and invented my own plate- a cheese grilled cheese stuffed with marinated baby portobello mushrooms. Everything was spectacular! I highly recommend checking this place out of you're in town and want to break away from a typical sit down restaurant. You won't be disappointed.

Pretty sure the hubs and I have found our new favorite date spot! We had an awesome experience at Soul this past Friday night. We took the advice of others on here and put our names on the wait list online. By the time we made it over to Soul, we only had to wait about 10 minutes for our table. Now, I will agree with others that they squeeze you in there tight (which is typically not my cup of tea). BUT after a few delicious cocktails, my husband and I suddenly didn't care what the couple at the table next to us was chatting about.   The food OH the food! Almost everything we had was superb. We of course ordered the Asian pork belly tacos (which I dream about now, thanks Soul), a sushi roll (I can't remember the name), the fried goat cheese bruschetta, the fried Brussels sprouts (not a fan, I thought they were a little too charred), and stuffed shells with pork BBQ (!!!). Our waiter was fantastic (I can't remember his name, unfortunately) and we liked the fact that the tapas came out one right after the other (instead of feeling overwhelmed by all of them at the same time). We thoroughly enjoyed gorging ourselves and can't wait to go back!

I want to call this place an amazing hidden gem but I am afraid the word is out. Very rarely can you find a place like this that has it all. Great service, great food and reasonable "tapas" pricing. This, for me, is one of those places you go to and then want to go again the next day. Although I am not from Charlotte, I will make it a point to get me some Soul every time I am in town!

We just came for the Packers game, we from Cali. I was craving for sushi and pitas, found this gem! Food was amazing, we had fire pita, mini burgers, tuna tacos, lamb pita, Cali roll and the chocolate  bread pudding. The ambience is excellent, great music!  I did my reservation using yelp. No waiting at all. Service was phenomenal and friendly !!! Luv this place!

I came here based on the BuzzFeed article & the reviews for their pork belly "taco". While I knew this was a hipster tapa joint, I honestly expected more from a highly regarded pork belly taco. Isn't North Carolina known for it's BBQ & hence amazing meat preparation?  The pork belly was chewy vs melt in your mouth tastiness. Plus it was really just a pork belly tapa vs a taco because there was no way the measly flour shell could wrap around the large pork + watermelon layers.  It was decently busy, but Sunday busy so I expected better service. Honestly it nailed all the hipster bar cliches. Busy with loud music, over priced attempts at fusion food & prohibition style cocktails & stand offish people.   I'd come here with friends for a drink on a weekday, but not worth the hype IMO.

I cannot rave about this place enough! This restaurant is super popular -- with its unique cocktails, modern romantic decor, and tapas style menu this place is sure to hit the spot for dinner. It gets very popular though so I recommend trying to get there before 6 o'clock. They also do not take reservations and will not seat you unless your whole party is there. But back to the food: ordering a bunch of different tapas (and even sushi rolls) is the way to go. I love the Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos -- the pork is cooked to such perfection that it literally does melt in your mouth, a very popular tapa among customers. The Lamb Pops are also really good, which are smothered in rosemary, pecorino and pepper. Soul also has good sushi, in which I recommend the Charlotte roll, with tempura shrimp inside. Just order a little bit of everything and enjoy!

We walked in here and got bar seats. We were taken Extremely good care of by the bar tenders. We ordered the special cup cake of the day ( soco lime) but were disappointed. The bar tender noticed the unfinished cup cake and offered to replace it- he then got me the red velvet which was Yumm. We weren't charged for the soco lime cupcake. This is what I call service. Highly recommend this place. Great music good people.

Really excellent! Great service, delicious cocktails, good date night or girls night atmosphere. Shrimp ceviche with plantains and pan con tomate were mind-blowing. The house cocktails are very well crafted; not too sweet and lots of flavor. Soul roll was a little bland, as was the baba ganoush. Next time we are saving room for pork belly tacos and bone marrow. I think this will become one of our go-to date night places!

My friends and I probably come here far too often, but with good reason. We have never had a less than stellar experience here. From the food, drinks, ambient music, and staff, it truly is an experience from start to finish. When I first moved to plaza midwood, my roommate and I came here to celebrate. I was in love with the seasonal mules, and other unique cocktails. It's a rite of passage to get the pork belly tacos, but there are so many other delicious options! The dirty south nachos sound odd (especially to a northerner like me), but they are just too good to pass up. It bothers some people that they don't take reservations, but as with any special or luxury experience, they don't offer them because they don't have to. They know the value of their venue and truthfully, I don't mind sitting at the bar for 2 hours prior to my meal and loading up on cocktails. Go, as fast as you can.

I loved this place!  I definitely recommend downloading the "nowait" app to make sure that you don't have to wait for a table for two hours.  We got a few plates - the dirty south nachos, fried meatballs, shells & cheese, and the Ki roll.  My favorites were the Ki roll and the shells & cheese (which were PHENOMINAL!!).  The dirty south nachos were good but different, and the fried meatballs were good but a little dry.  I got an amazing cucumber vodka mojito to drink, which was a perfect pallet refresher!  The interior is super cute and very intimate.

I have no idea where to start. One of my favorite places ever. Fun experience for small groups or couples. LONG wait, just expect it. Favorites were the winter mule and hibachi jalape√±o sashimi. Dynamic roll was good too but then again everything we tried was.

Favorite Tapas spot in Charlotte!!  Pork Belly tacos is the most surprising enjoyable dish that I order every time.  Lamb Lollypops are also amazing. Can't go wrong with with any order.  Love the neighborhood and environment, always work the wait.   Disclaimer: I love Pimento Cheese but the Dirty South Nachos wasn't for me....still not enough for me to feel this place wasn't worth 5 stars!!

If you are the type of person who enjoys appetizers more than meals and appreciates variety, then head to Charlottes hipster neighborhood, Plaza Midwood, and try a few tapas from this restaurant. Soul Gastrolounge caters to a unique crowd and is located on the second floor of a building. There is outdoor and indoor seating. I tried the ramen noodle bowl with veil meet and portebello mushrooms, alongside the chicken pita and mini burgers which were all delicious!! They also serve cucumber water which is rather refreshing. I'll definitely be making a few more stops to try out other delicious tapas like the Korean BBQ and avocado salad.

Love this eclectic hot spot. Indoor and outdoor seating. DJ spinning the tunes. We ate at the bar where we enjoyed great service. They even stock my favorite EFFEN Black Cherry Vodka! Started with an order of the boursin cheese stuffed piquillo peppers on bruscetta...to die for! Heard that the sushi was the best in town so being a non-sushi eater, I decided on the vegetable roll. I'll go back now for that alone now! Finished with a red velvet cupcake and also homemade pistachio ice cream. A great experience....

Vegetarian options here are limited but delicious. Here's a list of what we ordered with a review:  1. Hummus if the day (tahini honey) - This was good but not great! Would've been better if it had a flavourful hit of garlic to it. Not the best. The pita chips that came with it we nice and healthy (since they were baked not fried).  2. Eggplant Parmesan skewers - This was the best dish I tried in soul! The eggplant and cheese was cut into perfect chunks and breaded and crisped to perfection. The marinara sauce (which I hope was made in the house and not store bought) was great to accompany the dish. All in all perfect! Must try for everyone.  3. Flatbread - Was good. The pesto was delicious although, the honey braised garlic made it somewhat sweet (which is the point) but didn't do anything. If you love cheese and pesto on bread, go for it!  Pita sandwich with falafel - Again, a great dish. Nothing innovative here, but a good soft pita with tomatoes and tender tasty falafels. I liked it! Vegetarians will definitely love this one.   Dessert - chocolate brioche cake with ice cream - Good warm cake with nuts and tasty caramel syrup to moisten it while the ice cream melts! Good dessert!  And after so much food, what we paid was unbelievably reasonable (just $38) ! That's the best part.. it's gourmet food at cheap pricing!   I've been waiting to go to this place since forever. Will definitely go back to try other vegetarian options (and the eggplant parmesan skewers as well) :D

Myself and several friends went to Soul for a girls night out  today! The first thing i must  mention is this place is tiny! I now understand why most reviews state there is typically a wait. Myself and two other members of my party arrived around 6:10pm. At this time, there was no wait. We did have to wait for the majority of our party to arrive prior to us  being seated. We were placed in a booth, that was suppose to accommodate 8 people. It's a great that  only 7 of us were present- we were packed in the booth like sardines. Regarding the food- it was everything the reviews mentioned. I had the guacamole stack- try it if you are a fan of avocado, the flatbread- my favorite, and the truffle fries, my second favorite. I also tried the Korean wings- too spicy for my taste, fried meatballs- just ok, nothing special, lemon chicken skewer-they were ok, I would not order them again, and a host of other items. The last thing I tried was the pistachio ice cream. It was no bueno!!! It was completely tasteless. The server was nice enough to remove it from my tab. I am a foodie, and have to give credit when credit is due. The presentation of the food is good but more importantly the taste  is what works for Soul. I would record this for a smaller group due to the size being so small!

The wait here is incredibly long on weekends, they do not take reservations but use an App called NoWait. Even using the App to get a seat we had to wait about an hour and a half.   But, it was well worth the wait! The food here is amazing, its predominantly a seafood/Asian cuisine menu that includes: multiple sushi's, bone marrow plates, rocky mountain oysters ;) and a variety of craft cocktails. The atmosphere is very trendy/hipster with a nice combination of mild electronic music playing. I would highly recommend this place for dates, dinner parties or a casual drink.
Everything we had was GREAT! but the Pork belly tacos and Lamb lollipops were AMAZING!  A really fun place to go, but get there early...the secrets out and the place fills up fast!

Cocktails & tapas! Whether you are with friends or on a date this place is fabulous. The staff are friendly, atmosphere is fun, and the food.... YES PLEASE! I may as well list the entire menu because there is not one bad thing on it!

Soul is a fantastic Gastrolounge, really cool ambiance like an Old Irish Pub.  Bartender Billy is really knowledgeable and takes care of you.  The Food:  Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos, Very flavorful and the watermelon cube packs a bite.  Duck Bahn Fit, Hello Foie Gras & Duck Confit...just eat it

Highly recommend this place. Very busy the night we went but we were able to grab a few seats at the bar. My friends and I ordered a variety of tapas, including hummus, chimichurri beef skewers, grilled cheese, fried meatballs and another I can't recall. It was all good but of all things, it was the grilled cheese that I enjoyed the most. It included provolone, mozzarella and kasseri cheeses. The kasseri made all the difference. It added a saltiness to the sandwich which really gave it great flavor.  The carrot cupcake was also quite tasty.   The service was friendly and very attentive, especially since the bartender was extremely busy. Cool atmosphere. I'll definitely return when I visit Charlotte again.

Pork belly tacos. That's all you need to know.   I think once a year or so, however rich or poor you are, you need to try to find a restaurant with good reviews and just buy whatever the heck you want. This was my 2014 restaurant I did that with. You'll spend a bit because the plates are small, but it's worth it.

I'm obsessed with this place -- the food, the atmosphere, everything (well, except the wait)! The watermelon pork belly tacos are to die for! I highly recommend ordering those. Once again, a small plate/tapas style restaurant (my fav)! Great ambiance for a group of friends or even date night.

I looove this place  if you haven't been to Soul and you want a chill, trendy yet amazingly delicious dinner then you got to come here. They have a wide range of food options but I always get their sushi because it's so delicious and fresh. I love the dark atmosphere and the type of music they play. I would recommend reserving a seat ahead of time because they wait can be a little lengthy.

I've lived in SF and Paris, I spent some time in NYC. I also had very high expectations of this place, since everyone in Charlotte keeps talking about it. The verdict? It's GOOD. It's VERY good. Get Red Dragon Roll and Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos (amazing).  P.S. It's not cheap. A cocktail will cost you the same amount of money as if it was Paris. It's worth it though.

This is a place I would imagine Anthony Bourdain would visit if he came to Charlotte.  It's fine dining without the stuffy feel, the vibe is chill with a live dj and unique seating options. They serve mainly tapas/small plates so you have the opportunity to sample a wide variety of food.  The food is incredible. Top favorites include the ceviche, bone marrow, and sushi. If nothing else, try those 3, you won't be disappointed.   The prices are also reasonable. We were a party of 3 and wound up paying around $50 per person, including cocktails and all of the tapas we ordered.

Big fan of Soul!  Went on a date on a Tuesday night.  A bit tight for a date- tables are close together.  We quickly realized the couple next to us was also on a date by the awkward convos haha!!  We did antipasti salad and a bunch of different skewers, all awesome.  My fav was the chimichurri beef.  Yummmmmm!!!!  Service was good, very hipster crowd as far as employees.  Mixed crowd as far as customers.  Excited to try it again!

You're going to wait for a table for a looooong time. Kill the time by grabbing some wine or beer at 22 or getting a small bite to eat at Fuel (their garlic knots are to die for). Once you get your table, you'll soon realize the wait was worth it! Order 2-3 plates/person and share!

One of Charlotte's best hidden gems!  The menu is a cross among American, Greek, Spanish & Japanese cuisines.  The music is excellent (mostly lounge/house music.)  Great view of uptown....my only complaint would be that it always gets packed especially on the weekends and a couple of times me and some friends actually waited over an hour for a table.
