There aren't letters in the human language that can be compiled to translate the amount of incredible this place is.  I travel nonstop for work and make it a mission to find cool, unique places everywhere I go, and this place is by far the best food stuffery I've ever been too.  Food Atmosphere Service View  All in one package. Soul, you win. Everything.  Oh! And get the Pork Belly Tacos. Like stop reading this right now and just yell, "Pork Belly!" Do it. Right now.  Seriously. Right now.

Soul Gastrolounge is awesome and has very good food. The menu has something for everyone - there's sushi, mac n cheese, tacos, flatbreads etc. Everything we ate was delicious but it wasn't unique enough that I would wait two hours again (there is always a wait for a table at this restaurant)

is it fair to review a place if you've never eaten there?   i will probably never go back based on how the hostess acted upon our arrival. i've never encountered such a rude person in the hospitality industry. as a hostess, your job is to greet people, welcome them and make them feel at home. i was appalled by the way she treated us and will probably never return due to how unpleasent she was. customer service is key.

This was an incredible and worth-while gem of Charlotte. It's small and eclectic and wouldn't be out of place in a hipster-Brooklyn setting (including the 2-hour wait time). We especially liked their style of serving the dishes as they were prepared rather than being overwhelmed with all the food all at once (it also meant that we could start eating fairly quickly since we were super hungry!).  Here's a helpful outline of how to do Soul Gastrolounge right:  First, download and use the NoWait app to secure your place in line at this restaurant. It saved us over an hour of waiting.   Second, you'll need to find parking as there's no parking lot. We went on a Saturday night around 7:30pm and we're only *just* lucky to have found a spot on the same street.   Third, it's helpful to know that the gastrolounge is on the second story - not street level. This confused us at first when we were looking for it. When you get there, order some drinks as the wait will still be a few more minutes. Their original cocktails are both unique and fantastic.  Finally, the food! Since it's tapas-style you'll want to order several dishes per person. The server was incredibly helpful to recommend dishes that were perfectly paired and balanced so that we didn't order too many heavy items or too many light dishes. The highlight was the dragon sushi and the berry-cupcake with red-wine cream frosting. We also had flatbreads, fried goat-cheese bruschetta, and Asian-glazed pork-with-watermelon tacos. It was out of this world delicious! My partner also ordered the skewers with chimichanga and enjoyed them, but I thought they were just a bit too fatty and chewy.   All-in-all we had a great time here. The servers were knowledgeable, the staff was friendly and attentive, the ambiance was relaxed Southern hipster-chic. We would most definitely return here!

Finally got to try this little spot , and I enjoyed myself. This visit I had cocktails and sushi and it was quite tasty. The ambiance is everything, small, quaint , a sense of exclusivity. The drink and food menu is a little pricy so if I had to choose, I'd choose the drinks. However, know that if all you're going to do is drink, you have to sit at the bar. This is definitely a great spot for a date , or a classy night out with friends.

This is our favorite place in Charlotte! Everything we have tried on the menu has been great and the waiters are all very friendly and helpful. Our go to's are the tuna tacos and the dynamite and red dragon rolls. Their daily specials and cocktails are always special and delish.   The first time we went on a Saturday and waited more than 2 hours but we learned a trick that if you go right after work during the week you won't have to wait at all. It might be worth waiting on your first visit but after that you just want to be able to get seated right away. If you do wait, the place downstairs (twenty two) always has great exhibitions and reasonable drinks.   Although we are young, we are not typically into the hipster scene but this place is really a great environment for all.

Great food. Cupcakes are to die for! Portions and prices just right. I also appreciated the fact that my drink actually seemed to have alcohol in it. So many places jip you on the alcohol but Sol did not. We'll be back !

Cute little spot! Crowded, but didn't take long to be seated.  We sat in the little area with the sofas; very relaxed atmosphere.  Great sushi - had the Queen Charlotte Roll and it didn't disappoint.  Also tried the Southern Fried Wings and the Mini Burgers.  Everything was great and the service was as well.  Definitely will add this to my list of spots to frequent in the Queen City!

Obsessed and can't wait to go back.  Fried goat cheese bruschetta - amazing  Sliders with blue cheese and onion strings- how can you go wrong? Southern Nachos (not on their online menu) - instead of chips it's served with thinly sliced, fried chicken.  I don't remember what else was on them because we ate them so fast.  Grilled cheese -  yum Steak kabobs with chimi churi - just ok, I wouldn't order again.  The steak was too well done.  Plan to wait and don't go with a group of more than 6 or you may wait until midnight.    When I go back I'm going to have a hard time ordering....I want to try everything!    P.S. Although the menu has a a lot of unique items even the pickiest of eaters will find something,

Cool joint. Great atmosphere. A little cramped when it came to seating because it is smaller on the inside. But, don't let that hold you back. They do Tapas plates, so be prepared for small plates. They suggest you order several and I agree. Overall good experience. The food was very good, but not great.

Take the stairs on the outside of the building to the hopping gastro pub on the second floor. Sushi, small plates, some southern-inspired dishes, everything freshly made in the kitchen that you can see if you look across the bar. This place is busy any night of the week, which is usually a good thing. The food has some great flavors, but the portion size is a little small for what you pay for. I got the pork belly tacos, for which they are known. You get 6 1" cubes of pork belly with the same size and amount of pickled watermelon on two small tortillas.  The cocktails are also tasty, some of which are batch-made and are thus on-tap. They have some interesting twists on classic combinations, using bitters and cordials for for extra punches of flavor.

Interesting!  Came back finally for New Years Eve party. Different feel this time, because of the music was catered to the event. All in all, definitely a place worth visiting!  The servers were nice and attentive. One bartender was able to catch a bottle of amaretto with one hand, without it hitting the ground. Good reflex!  Was not able to try the food, again this time -- boo! We seem to come at the wrong time. So hint! It will take a while to get your food after 10pm. So come early!   Will update more, with food in my belly from this place!

Super friendly bar staff and fun neighborhood lounge. Definitely more a spot for cocktails - very limited beer and wine offerings. But if craft cocktails are your thing look no further. Small menu of bar food with some great selections (couple sushi selections, skewers of assorted meats/fish) - and some not so healthy options (various fried foods). Thought the skewers were an especially great option for small bites while enjoying the great drinks. A note of personal thanks to the staff for safe keeping my credit card that I accidentally left behind - was relieved to retrieve it there the next day!
One of my favorite places to eat and enjoy the urban scene. Great music, djs, and great dishes. A very eclectic menu and seasonal variations that keep you intrigued! No complaints.

Food was incredible but the music was waaaaaayyyyyyy too loud.  The DJ was playing techno as loud as it would go. People were leaving because it was too loud. The waitress even told him to turn it down 5 times but he wouldn't. Impossible to talk to each other or enjoy the food.  Really too bad because I won't go back though the food was the best in charlotte.

The food is great, but their big ticket item is the cocktails. I can not find a better Old Fashion anywhere else in Charlotte. They have so many more drinks to boot. It's definitely worth checking out. It is one of the highlights of Plaza Midwood.

I said before that they fry everything in the south. Well so far everything I've tried has been good so I wasn't complaining. Ok it gets better... this is phenomenal. Fried Brussel sprouts & Rocky Mountain Oysters (veal). Thank you Soul Gastrolounge!

A fairly interesting joint with a good beer selection and wide range of food items, with my favorite being the eel roll! Wasn't too keen on the Korean wings though as the sauce was too rich and overwhelming. Sashimi was surprisingly fresh.

Soul!  Love the cozy beatnik-meets-diva decor.  I have been here a few times over the years but didnt try the sushi until last night.  I had the Soul Roll (Warning!!!  A little spicy!!!!) and my friend had the Queen Roll (tempura whatever how can you go wrong?)  The food came out on separate plates which is different, usually if there are just two rolls ordered they would put it on one.  But it was faster this way and we were able to dive right in!  We sat at the table by the door and when our tiny table got too full of stuff the waitress neatly opened the drawer on the vintage table and promptly lined up the soy sauce and extra things on the table in the drawer - hilarious! And genius!  The rolls were about $10 a piece...very reasonable.    The lamb lollipops are also a favorite with the spanakopita - if you want to get several small plates to share.  Cant wait to be back Soul!  :-D

Nice food n atmosphere. Great service, hip crowd n ambiance. Had to wait a bit to get seated but it was worth it. Food had distinct flavors although the quantity/price ratio sucks. Moscow Mules were perfect. All in all a must visit joint.
Over priced and overly loud.  Ok food but epic snarky hipster douche-baggery wait staff and crowd.

This place has all the character in the world, we dined here a while back and our "table" consisted of arm chairs and a quaint little table. The food is so on point and the "tapas" style provides you with enough wiggle room to try as many items as you desire! Service was a little off, received an "I don't want to be here vibe from the waitress", but other than that quite the experience.

You get a 4 star. This is a good place to have a basic salty dinner and cocktails. I mean, it feels good but I'm not sure what else is exceptional here. Mule on tap, do you even know what that means? No time for bartenders to make my drink.

I'm not sure what the hype is about this place. Husband and I went in last night to have some dinner and drinks while in town and the wait was an hour and 45 minutes. With all the great reviews they got we decided to have some drinks and wait it out. When we finally were seated, we ordered a few of the plates and needless to say the wait was not worth it. The only thing we both really enjoyed was the pan con tomate....we ordered the Ramen hoping it would taste exceptional and my husband said it tasted like a Ramen concoction he's mad himself in the past. I'm giving it 3 stars because the staff was friendly, the winter mule was delicious and the food came out pretty darn fast but we won't be returning.
Hip. Loud. Good but inconsistent food. Drinks were pricey.

I love this place. Seriously love this place. Which can be a little dangerous when you live 3 blocks away.  The ambiance is groovy in a refreshingly alternative way and could easily be at home in San Francisco. The music is usually really good, but can be a bit loud at times making conversation difficult. Still, a respectable first funky date location if I do say so myself.  On to the food, there are a few must haves: the truffle fries and the pork belly tacos. The fries go without saying on account of the truffle, while the pork belly tacos consist of simple ingredients that I would never expect to have worked together: tortilla, 3 cubes of fatty pork belly, an Asian glaze, and watermelon. Yes, watermelon. At $9 for two small tacos I could rightfully call it highway robbery. But you'll be paying for seconds and thirds (as I have been known to do) when these flavors combine to elicit tears of ecstasy as you fall to your quivering knees in a euphoric culinary-induced coma. I may have to clear my schedule tonight.  Honestly, I've never really had anything bad here--although I can say that the bone marrow challenged me a little. All aside, there is a reason that there is often 2 hour+ waits to get inside for dinner. They are amazing.   TIP: If there is a huge line, try stalking the patrons in bar stools until you can swoop in. I reduced my 2 hour wait to 5 minutes this way.

I am obsessed with this place! Amazing, creative food, intimate atmosphere, and servers are crazy attentive! Diverse menu with everything from Asian Pork Belly Tacos and creative sushi, to pork stuffed Mac n cheese, lamb lollypops, meat skewers, and the incredible cupcake of the day! Omg. I have to get back here ASAP! It's worth the 2 hour ride from Greenville.

If you are a Tapas fan like we are this is a must. I love that they have sushi as well as Greek inspired tapas along with other types of tapas cuisine. You have to get the pork belly watermelon it will be the best thing you ever put into your mouth. They are on the App no wait  so it makes the waiting in line soooo much easier.  Its a great date night.
Best food I've had in Charlotte so far.  Creative, imaginative menu....mouth watering!!

As visitors to Charlotte, we knew we wanted to eat somewhere exciting so we turned to Yelp for suggestions.  The #1 option was Soul Gastrolounge and I'm so excited we decided on this place!  I wasn't craving a huge meal and love tapas so I thought this place had the right set up for us.  The vibe is very cool, hangout with your friends while you drink and snack.  Kind of hipster but not over the top.  We chose to sit at the bar which was fun to kind of people watch and really take in the place, but they also have tables and couch/chair areas you can sit at also.  It is located in a area with a few other busy restaurants so you may have to park elsewhere and walk over.   We chose the gyro skewers, french fries and the special that night which was a smoked cod on a potato cake.  The skewers were great and the sauce was a nice compliment with its cool/fresh taste.  The fries were to die for and I had to tell my husband to stop hogging them all.  I didn't try the special, but my husband was a fan.  Overall everything we tried was great!  They bring out your table's item whenever they ready so it wasn't so much a "ok now we can eat our meal" situation.  The food is a little on the expensive side (which I've learned is kind of standard at tapas places) so this would be more ideal for a special occasion (date night, night out with friends, etc) rather than a regular night.  I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for something delicious with a nice atmosphere.
Love Love Love. Wonderful tapas and small plates. Perfect for a social dinner with drinks. The Deep South Nachos are an absolute must!

I wanted to come here for a while. Glad I did as I enjoyed the food. The place was rather small and the seating arrangements were kinda awkward.  I understand the "lounge" title in the name now, but  I wasn't in the mood to converse with any one new that would have been seated inches on either side of me.  Charlotte peeps aren't into meeting strangers this way I find (I grew up in New Orleans where meeting new people while dining is the norm). We enjoyed sitting at the counter near the DJ.  Music was ok, but typical house music gets old quick. Variety is the spice of life - kinda like their menu.   The mixed dips where rather dull though (baba ganoush, humus, tziki) and were served with stale, I mean toasted, pita chips. Asked for warm pita which satisfied me and was worth the extra $1.  My wife had the steak skewer and she didn't likey.  We enjoyed their french fries very much. My highlight was their sushi. I loved the Soul Roll and their hamachi sashimi dish. Great presentation and fresh tasting. I'll try more sushi next time.  I'll be back but not in a huge, crazy, tremendous hurry.

My friends invited me here and I was so confused by the name. It makes me think of Gastro intestinal issues. Anywhoo...once I got over that it wasn't so bad. I feel that they are a bit over priced but at least the food is good. We all had sushi. I was looking forward to dessert. Our waiter talked up this "lemon vanilla ice-cream" so we ordered it but she came back to with a sad face to tell us that they had run out. I'm not gonna lie, my heart was a little bit broken. I still want to try it so I guess I have to go back.  I liked the atmosphere, its kind of hipster/trendy...great place for small plates and delicious drinks.

Plza can easily be one of my favorite places in Charlotte aside from now southend. The food and libations are creative and consistently pushing the culinary reform here in CLT. I wish they would open another bigger location. The music is always great, vibe is great...the wait to sit down because it's so small and it's first come , first serve, not so much. If you are a late diner, great! The later in the evening it gets, your chances of scoring a table is good and the music gets better (either the DJ has had a few or I have, still trying to figure that out)!
My husband and I stumbled across this place and are definitely  going back. We only grabbed a drink and dessert, but the vibe and the food looked amazing. Really cool hole-in-the-wall.

This is among my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. The Queen Charlotte roll is my personal favourite. It does get extremely crowded at nights so If you're at the bar, ask for Stephanie. She is a solid bar tender who will make you smashing special cocktails that aren't on the menu. Enjoy.   But be prepared to buy more than 3 tapas per person or you will spend a lot and leave hungry.
Great atmosphere with a really exciting menu, delicious food and a great bar staff, can't go wrong, been in the business 20 years and I was extremely satisfied

Holy mother of Noms.   I had gone to meet Michael G's sister (Lauren G) for dinner in the historic neighborhood of Plaza Midwood.   It's quite a hard place to find, as it's on the second floor of an old building.   For starters we had got the , Goat Cheese bruschetta, and some preposterous Sushi Tempura.   Non sequitur... I don't usually say these kind of things, but Soul is one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten in my life.  I mean there was a party in my mouth.  Ok..back to the food.  Round 2.  Lamb lollipops inappropriately named (in a good way), cuz we ate them in one chomp.  Pork Belly Tacos...Let me tell you, that pig lived a good life.  So tender.   To top it off for dessert, we had the Vietnamese Coffee ice cream.  Overall one of the best culinary experiences EVER.

This has been and continues to be one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  The incredible amount of options available is enough to visit Soul but the fact that each is prepared to perfection every single time takes this place to the next level.  It would be an incredible sushi restaurant if that's all they served! But they have some incredible small plate options (lamb lollipops...) along with great sides and desserts.  The cocktail menu is excellent as well.
Great food and drinks, awesome vibe, good place to take friends from out of town. Pork belly tacos and the peanut butter cupcake are the best thing I've ever had!

Can't say much that has not been said. So, I'll make this easy.   1) Very hip place-make sure you look jazzy!  2) Expect to wait. Very small...think like 15 tables max and then the bar area.  2) Goat cheese balls are the BEST!  4) Oh, its kinda hard to find...it's upstairs, sign is on the corner of the building,  5) Parking is a nightmare.  6) It's not cheap, but worth it.

Found this place on a site saying it was a top 25 place to eat in Charlotte so I went.  It is located upstairs in a building and has a very trendy atmosphere.   I took my family and ordered so many things off the menu!  Our waitress was fun and friendly and helped recommend things for us to order. My favorite by far were the Asian Glazed Pork Belly Tacos.  I don't even like watermelon but the pork with it was truly amazing! My only complaint is the order comes with two small tacos so a bit pricey for what you get. The French Fries With Garlic-herb Salt, Pecorino & Truffle Oilwere truly something to behold I honestly have never had fries like them!  The Korean Bbq wings had great flavor sweet with a good amount of spice to them.  The Fried Brussel Sprouts also had good flavor and were worth ordering. The only bad thing I had was the Dirty South Nachos are basically fried crust in a sauce and they were basically nasty!  So all in all this place is worth going great food even if it is a little pricey for what you get.

I've heard so many people in Charlotte rave about this place and after checking it out last night - I now see why. The size of the space makes it feel cozy- both perfect for a date night or an evening with friends the small plates make for wonderful sharing experience.   The Greek salad is the best I have ever had. No lettuce but stuffed with marinated veggies and a healthy block of feta right on top. The pork belly tacos are an absolute staple - big chunks of pork belly with a square of juicy watermelon creates an amazing flavor combination. We also tried the shells and cheese. Wow. Again the flavors were insane...goey melted cheese with a crispy top layer over three shells stuffed with BBQ pork belly. The last thing that really sticks out were the fried goat cheese on bruschetta - an amazing ball of fried goat cheese on top of perfectly seasoned bruschetta and a crispy baguette.   Even on a Monday this place was packed so make sure to do the Yelp check in feature to lock down a table.

I never tire of this place! Really great atmosphere (even though it tends to get loud sometimes), food never disappoints and the specialty cocktails are great! On the first weekend of the month, they have Drag Queen brunch...haven't been yet but trying it next month and I can't wait! Love, Love, Love you Soul Gastrolounge! Don't ever change :)

Hipster restaurant / bar that serves great food in a cozy, warehouse type space with a DJ spinning tunes. We ordered spanakopita, saganaki, tzatziki, and chimichurri beef skewers. Food and service was excellent, but the hostess was so rude I would hesitate to go back. I understand that this place is hip and super popular right now, to the point where you're constantly busy with waits for tables over 2 hours. This does not mean that you don't have to be welcoming to your guests and can expect people to keep coming back for more regardless of how they're greeted when entering your restaurant. I'm not very familiar with Charlotte, but there seem to be many options available for dining and drinking, so I don't think you can afford to have someone working the hostess stand to be that rude to your guests. Wow.

I'm a foodie and I am a firm believer that home cooked food is still the best. With that being said, this is one of the best meals I've had in a really long time. Ever tapa dish I had was absolutely delectable with unique flavors, garnishes, presentation. Most importantly all of the meats were cooked at the right temperature!  I would recommend everything I had  1. Fried Brussel Sprouts (lick the sauce off the plate good) 2. Pork Belly Tacos (I think I shed a tear because of how the flavors come together and melts in your mouth) 3. Roasted Duck w/ rice grits (Grits that will change your life) 4. Lamb Skewers (cooked perfectly and every bite was seasoned to perfection)  5. Smash and Grab Cocktail - refreshing drink with Bourbon and Basil   My only knock on the spot is the high price of the drinks/cocktails. After ordering a few rounds, I wasn't expecting a phone bill.   The wait can be a little long so get there early and get your reservations in.  I wild definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that comes to Charlotte.

This is my favorite spot in Charlotte!! LOVE IT! Great food, great atmosphere. My husband and I love to go and sit at the bar and eat there. $6 champagne- in a cool glass- can't beat it! Get the pork belly tacos, you won't be sorry. Also love the lamb/gyro kabobs. I love it all!

Ordered the house special sushi dish. Loved it despite the excess cream cheese! They had spicy tuna sashimi in the middle that was also awesome! Ordered the spiced rum, it really warmed me up on the cold winter day. The open brick walls and wood beam ceilings and bar made for a cozy hangout!

Came here spontaneously with my little sissy. There was a wait around 6-7 so we sat at the bar as soon as a couple got up. Hop on the bar stool, ordered my sparkling wine with the trio dip, pork belly tacos and soul roll. MMmm, spectaculish!! Plates were well presented and food made me wanting more!   Btw, I could probably finish all of that all by myself! Just too bad that I had to share :(

The minute I walked in I was on sensory overload!  I'm gonna get this out of the way....the food....one word....stupendous! My favorite thus far, the lamb lollipops....nom...nom...nom.  Ok, now the more interesting details.  First off, the joint is small...really small and the layout is much like a galley kitchen, you know straight and fairly narrow.  So one side of the place = bar, the other = dinner seating.  Easy peasy.   There was a DJ there when I went so I'm assuming that is the norm.  Strange collection of music the night I was there but it was so loud didn't really matter.  And crowded it was, a little over an hour wait even at 7:45pm.  Keep that in mind and get there early to obtain solid bar real estate while you wait.  The decor is trendy chic and seriously had me pondering for over 30-45 minutes trying to figure out..."Am I at a bar or a restaurant?" Hahaha....didn't matter really the spot was fun, full of energy and the food was more than worth the wait :)  My only suggestion would be go during the week when it's not packed, I think I would have enjoyed it even more.
Perfect date night restaurant. Best Damn food and drinks in town. Small bites enough to share and have a taste. Definitely recommend the Cheese and Shell with sweet pork. Go try it out!!!

This place is a little gem. The food is unique and fun. It's a super eclectic mix of cultures and flavors. It's pretty small and seating is limited, they don't take reservations so there is always a wait!!! Not bad when there's two or four of you but If 6 girls show up for a birthday dinner you might be waiting for-eva!  They are on the no-wait app so that helps a little. I highly recommend you get on that before you arrive to help move you along.   So once/if you get a seat (possibly a 2 hour wait) they have such great small plates!!! Well they only have small plates.  Spanakopita  Tuna tacos  Best grilled Caesar salad I've EVER had Hamachi with jalape√±o  Queen Charlotte roll Mushroom on toast Avocado stack  Are a few of my favorites. I don't eat lamb but a friend raved over the lamb lollipops. And another girl enjoyed the watermelon and pork belly taco.   Stay away from the Rocky Mountain oysters. There are no oysters in the mountains so that my friend will be an order of sheep, maybe goat balls! Can you say gross. I don't care how good someone says they are, those things aren't coming close to my mouth!   I love this place. It's a fun loud artsy atmosphere, all the staff is super casual and a little hippy. Lots of tattoos and patchouli.  It's great. Just go on a night that's not a 2 hour wait, or plan for it so you aren't starving as you stand and sip on their delicious cocktails

This. Place. Is. Awesome. For a couple on date night would say 3-4 tapas would be enough to share depending on your appetite (it was my bday so we did 3 tapas a sushi roll and dessert).  If your doing tapas no doubt go with the Pork Belly Tacos. Pro tip, cut the tortilla into thirds and eat each bit as a mini taco.  The saganaki was awesome and the red dragon sushi roll was absolutely on point but I will say left thinking that it didn't matter what I ordered beverything on the menu would be good.   2¬¢- don't do what I did and wait four years to finally try this place!

I came to Soul on a Wednesday night and luckily we got there early (around 6:30pm) and only had to wait 20 minutes or so (for two people). This place is extremely popular so get there early or expect a long wait! The food is definitely worth the wait. We tried the shells with pork belly and a sushi roll and both were incredible. I can't wait to go back and try more things on the menu. This place is also not outrageously expensive and even the drinks are reasonably priced unless you order the fancy cocktails. This is my favorite restaurant so far in Charlotte.

You can NEVER go wrong with soul, the only thing I dislike the most about souls is the awful wait time. I swear you can wait up to an hour and a half getting there at 6pm just a little after they open. But they are that good and worth the wait TRUST ME!!! And if you go with friends my suggestion would be for everyone one to order two or three things they want to try so everyone can taste.   DON'T BE STINGY!!!  Enjoy your dinner and night cap at SOUL!

Great place. The flatbread was amazing, the Korean BBQ wings were good. Keep in mind it's tapas so get several to share with the table. Loved the set up of this restaurant, nice hipster vibe. Will go back, will recommend. Definitley a great date spot.
The wait is crazy so use the No Wait app to get in line without being there. But the food is AMAZING! must get the pork tacos

I'm claustrophobic and loud music bugs me. Yet I'm still willing to give Soul 5 stars because it's just that good.   I've been here several times and have not yet gotten past my menu indecisiveness. At other restaurants, I will narrow it down to 2, maybe 3 things, and then just go on gut instinct when the server arrives. However, at a recent dinner with a friend, we both found ourselves flipping pages back and forth, almost unable to make up our minds. (Indecisiveness loves company, it would seem.)  Though I tried to resist the temptation, I ended up going with my usual, the Mini Burgers. Holy pickle on a stick, that is a good burger. I also got a Spider Roll, and at the last minute, I threw on an order of eel Nigiri, just in case. My server double checked to make sure I was hungry enough for all that food, and indeed, I was.   All of the food was, as always, spectacular, but I have never seen such slices of eel in all my life. They were like salmon filets, they were so big, and the minuscule seaweed strip couldn't even hold them onto their tiny rice beds. As soon as they arrived I understood my servers skepticism. Still, I found room.   My friend enjoyed his falafel pita immensely, and we made good on the trio of spreads.  His cupcake (the night's special, Kahlua cake with Bailey's icing and chocolate chips) was divine, though I was a little full to steal as much of it as I could have.  Oh how I wish the space were bigger, but Spring will soon be here and the patio will add more seating. And while loud DJ tunes may not be best for 2 friends who haven't talked in awhile, it did make it easier for us to talk about the people next to us without them getting suspicious. Yep, I'm sticking with my 5 stars, and I'll be back again, music and all.

My friends & I spent the evening out at Common Market South End when we realized none of us have eaten dinner yet! Being only a week into my relocation to Charlotte, my native friends took me out for a treat: Soul Gastrolounge.  It was about 10:30 at night, and the place was packed. We were originally told that the wait would be about 40 minutes. Ugh! About five minutes later, the hostess came back and explained that if we'd like to 'lounge,' the three of us could sit down right away. Sign us up! We were greeted by a selection of comfy chairs and a small coffee table. The setting was intimate, not too loud, and yet plenty of opportunities for people watching. I absolutely loved the eclectic decor, exposed brick, and dim lighting. With waters all around, we made our game plan by ordering four tapas: ahi tuna tacos, the dip trio, scallops, and fig arugula flatbread. Oh my lord. Not kidding when I say these were to die for! I think my favorite was the ahi tuna tacos; quite possibly the perfect mix of sushi meets mexican. The best taco shell I've ever had. Light, crunchy, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I'd be happy to go into detail about all of the dishes we had, but I'm afraid we'd be here all night.  The service was great. Very accomodating. Our drinks were always filled, and she even brought us more pita chips (3 times, mind you!) for our dips. And at the end of the night, pricing wasn't too bad. Four tapas, three friends, $13 each + tip. Not too shabby. I'll definitely will be back. Great place to take friends, and this new Charlottean is hooked!

This is a hidden gem. Came in on a week night following the holiday season it's on the corner and upstairs. They have limited seating. I didn't take many pictures, but the food is exotic and good. The lamb was nice and tender loved the sliders they had a spicy sauce on them and the spiced drink I had really warmed me up. The lemon ice cub gave it a zing. The staff were attentive and friendly. I suggest making a reservation in advance or you may be left standing. There was a large crowd that accumulated as we dinned. The food came out quick when you order despite the crowd. Overall I recommend and will return to try more of there tapas.

My gf and I are straight up food snobs, I would not dole out high praise to a place I was not truly impressed with. I'm giving Soul Gastrolounge 5 stars for their variety of creative, tasty cocktails and the fact that some of the small plates were literally among the best things I've ever eaten (looking at you, pork belly taco). Plus, maybe it's because I'm from New York, but I found the prices to be more than reasonable.

Everything here was.... the best i EVER had.  Sticky veal short ribs Lamb lollipops (are you kidding me???) Sashimi tuna tacos Bone Marrow Saganaki  Very cool oldschool looking spot, dj and/or live music depending on the day. Big cozy booths.... makes me wish i lived in Charlotte.
Hayley was awesome..drinks tasty and very attentive staff.   Recommend the cucumber mule and pork belly.
PORK BELLY TACOS. Amazing! You have to get them - probably my favorite food in Charlotte

Wow. And wow. On a work visit, this was recommended by Jonathan at the Omni, spot on! A quick cab ride away from the downtown area. Brian and Kelly our bartenders super meticulous about their craft. Cucumber mule awesome fresh. They will make you your fav, but this is the one time it was better to go with their specialties..ps..no sour mix in their drinks, its a sin, I agree.. Both pork and tuna tacos amazing..pan con tomate..wow..even spanakopita full of flavor. Save room for chocolate bread pudding and banana chocolate in phyllo. Every staff member so welcoming and the DJ nice funky touch...you sit, chill, he spins, we drink, we munch...it blew any NJ small plates away by far. Thx guys! Might do a repeat tomorrow...why dismiss a good thing!

Had pretty high expectations of the place after some friends raved about it. I honestly thought it was just okay. Sure some of the tapas were inventive and good, but I've had much better. I'm also not crazy about the setting. The place doesn't seem to have found the right mix between bar and restaurant and we were sitting in what seemed like a bar lounge area and served tapas. It just didn't really feel right and it was a bit cramped with our big group. Still, worth a try and there are some good choices on the menu.
Yes, you are going to have to wait to eat here. Yes, it is going to be worth the wait. The tapas are awesome. Specifically, check out the pork belly and watermelon tacos.

I came here for dinner with two friends because I saw decent reviews. It's location is in a pretty hipsterish area in Charlotte--but not the NoDa kind of hipster lol. I called for a reservation and they said they didn't take reservations so we just went but when we got there we had to have the entire party for them to seat us--understandable. I honestly wanted to sit inside but they said they don't seat parties of 3's in booths and that there was a party of 10 taking up all of the  3-seaters. I asked if we could sit at the perfectly open seats in the back but the host said those are strictly for two people, even though ten seats were literally wide open...didn't really understand their logic but just went with it. The host was kind of rude though to be honest, in a passive way.  When we were finally seated we actually sat outside, but it was a nice view and the weather was nice so we didn't mind. We ordered two orders of pork belly tacos with watermelon salsa, the surf and turf special, and curried lamb at first. It took a good 20-ish minute wait for our food to come out, and I was a bit surprised actually at the portion sizes. They were so small. Especially for the price ($12~$18 range). There were only two pork belly tacos on a plate, so essentially we were paying $6 per taco. I won't complain about the taste though--it was delectable! But because the portions were so small, we ended up ordering southern style and Korean style wings as well, and to no surprise, there were only like 5-6 wings. The wings weren't anything special, and the Korean style wings were too burnt because they used gochujang (red pepper paste), which burns easily. To wrap up, we ordered two cocktails which were crazily overpriced..they were seriously the same price as the food (at least $12). I don't think I'd go drinking there again.  Overall, the atmosphere and food is great, but they could step up their game with service and pricing and/or portion sizes. I might go there on a pay day or something if I want to be a bit more fancy, but I don't find myself coming here often.

From the name I would not expect the place to have an asian fusion vibe to it but one glance at the Yelp pictures and that's what it is!  I just happened to be there earlier and there was already a line at the door before it opened!  Definitely is a good sign.    It is a pretty small space with dark lighting and definitely a hipster vibe.  I snagged a seat at the bar.  The waiter told me the Pork Belly tacos were the most popular so I had to order that and I also got the Veal Short Ribs.  The pork belly tacos I thought was just ok, I did love the watermelon salsa on top but the pork belly itself was a bit tougher.  The veal short ribs though, sooo tender and had so much flavor.  It definitely made up for the tacos!  I wish I had more room to try things.    The ambiance of the place and the ribs definitely made it a nice appetizer stop for me.  Wish I had room for a drink since their drink menu looked phenomenal and interesting.

This place is AWESOME!! Loved every dish we tried especially the hamachi with the jalape√±o dipping sauce. The bone marrow was soooo good also the beef skewer with chimichurri is delicious!! This place nailed it with every dish we tried. Highly recommend it if you like small plates.

I came here for my birthday one year. It was just my husband and I. This place is always busy! There's always a wait. I think the food was tasty but nothing memorable that really stood out to me. Maybe we should give it another go. The parking situation isn't really the greatest either. The place is quite small. I think the concept would work a lot better in a place that was just a smidgen bigger with more seating.
Delicious food and great service! The cucumber mules were so good we could have sat around all evening and drank them. Chicken skin nachos were EPIC!!

Soul is always crowded. For good reason. But I have avoided Soul because of that. I do not however, avoid this fine place. Recently I have gone to Soul for food before concerts at Midwood Guitars. The early crowd is not so bad. The service is always great early. But tonight I hit it at prime big crowd time. I hovered at the first come bar for a while. I ordered wine (Chardonnay not so great) and told the bartender I really wanted to just get a stool and order dinner. Next thing I knew he spotted a couple who was about to leave and he asked them to make sure they gave a seat to me. Way cool. So my take = service is great whenever you come. Just be patient. Oh and BTW when I started enjoying my sushi the sushi chef looked over at me. We made eye contact and I gave her the thumbs up.

Located in my favorite part of Charlotte, NoDa, the line at this restaurant is consistently outrageous. Unfortunately, you can't reserve a table in advance, but whatever you do, I beg you to stay put. Order a drink from the bar while you wait on the terrace, where there's a beautiful view of the Charlotte skyline. The food, drinks, and overall atmosphere are incredible. Like many people on here, the pork belly tacos are to die for...in fact, you're guaranteed to experience a foodgasm. Whether you're here with friends, on a date, or even solo, you're bound to fall in love.

As a bar = good.  As a restaurant = not so good.  This review is based on my "dining" experience... Love that this place opened in the neighborhood, but based on my experience, I will only go for drinks from now on.   Yes - it is very cool inside, and love the balcony looking over the city.  The menu looks great on paper but the execution and service needs to have some kinks worked out.  Hoping it is just the newness factor.   The staff kept bringing us the wrong table's food.  Most times we knew it - except the one time.... We ordered "spicy tuna" rolls - It looked like a mess when it came out (like I would have rolled it.) but had some avocado and extras in it.... After my date and I finished it, the waiter brought out the "spicy tuna rolls" and we realized we just finished the people next to us rolls.  The other stuff we ordered (grilled cheese panini, fries) tasted good - but how could you screw that up?  You can tell that the waitress was working hard and was still friendly to us, but it just seems like there was some execution issues going on.  Hope they get things worked out.

I love the atmosphere, don't get me wrong.  The food is 3/5 stars (the fried stuff is on the greasy side).  Unfortunately I've given up trying to get into Soul after being quoted a one hour wait at 8:00 on a Wednesday in September.

Why don't more people hang out here? I'm yelping as I'm sitting by the DJ booth. Love the vibe, the music, but I wish at least few folks would groove on the "dance floor". This is a really good soul spot if you just want to do a couple of two steps and do a few spins. I will for sure be back.

First-rate, interesting food! We ate at the Soul Gastrolounge on a Sunday night -- we were lucky to get seated quickly, as this otherwise admirable place doesn't accept reservations -- and had a fine meal.  Nothing was bad, and several of the dished were truely outstanding.  We did five small plate/tapas and had a comfortable amount of food for two.  The top item we had was a shrimp cheviche made with coconut milk. It was sweet, of all things, with a touch of heat and was remarkable in a very good way.  The Salmon-O-Pitas were also wponderful (though I would have liked more a of a salmon flavor).  Likewise the goat cheese flatbreads. Definietly worth a return visit -- if only we could.

Probably one of my favorite restaurants ever. It's a shame they don't have one in Atlanta! Great vibe, live DJ spins hip, chill mixes of fresh beats and slow jams. The bar was great and bartender made me a really unique cocktail after hearing that I'm a fan of Deaths Door. He used DD Gin, St.  Germaine, celery bitters, lemon and cracked black pepper garnish. It wasn't my kind of drink but I really loved it! Very inventive and flavorful. The food was excellent. Sushi that was super fresh, awesome ponzu. The pork belly watermelon tacos were stupid delicious and I tried Foie Gras for the first time. It was very buttery and extremely fatty but I enjoyed the tapas portion on a flakey mini roll. The avocado stack was my favorite. Elements of guacamole were present but it was a sliced avocado with minimal extras a super flavorful thin citrus dressing. Our table of 6 ordered an obscene amount of small plates and I cannot remember everything we ordered but I can say absolutely everything was amazing. Inventive, fresh, creative, executed well-- the wait staff and bartender were all super cool and chill. Not overly expensive and accommodating. What's not to love about this place?
Fabulous bar. Great cocktails, food and music. Shane at the bar was amazing. Try the Black Lace cocktail!

I went to soul gastrolounge on a ladies night out. The wait was long but we finally got seated. The two of us each had a cocktail. I had the rosemary gin cocktail which was ver good. Others were less impressed. For dinner we shared the ceviche, flatbread, and Brussel Sprouts. The Brussel sprouts were amazing! The ceviche was bland and lacking something special. The rest was ok but for the price and all the hype I wasn't that impressed. Maybe we got the wrong things... I will try again however because it has a cool, fun atmosphere and there are plenty of other things to try.

Soul is one of the very few places in Charlotte at which I'll wait 2 hours for a table.  The food and experience is just that good (plus you can kill time by getting a drink downstairs -- they'll text you when your table is ready).  In my opinion, sharing small plates is the best format for a dinner.  Favorites on the menu include Asian-glazed pork belly tacos; all the sushi; braised veal cheek ramen in garlic cream sauce.

I went to Soul on a Friday night for dinner. Had heard many good things and was excited to try it out! The wait for a table inside was 90 minutes but for a table on their balcony we were seated immediately (it was hot out!).   I ordered their version of a Pisco sour to start. It was okay but probably not worth the $12 price tag. We ordered the white bean hummus dip, smoked salmon spanakopita and the bone marrow which were all fine but nothing to write home about. The pork belly and pickled watermelon tacos, however, were phenomenal. We would go back for those tacos alone.  The dessert menu was surprisingly limited for a gastrolounge -- kept only to cupcakes and ice cream -- so we passed.  All in all, we had a nice evening at Soul but don't think it lived up to the hype.

So, the BEST was the DJ and the food! KUDOS to the DJ and the Chefs!!! For sure, the DJ was ON POINT with his entire set; not one foul song!! Obviously, I can't stop talking about him; he was rockin it (and on a TUESDAY)!!!! The food was delicious! I had sushi and it was ON POINT!!!   The only thing I didn't like was that we asked for a booth but was told booths were for larger parties as was a table in the corner, however, we were allowed to sit in the corner table! That was NO BUENO! Any paying patron should have the option to sit where they want to sit especially if the seating is available - to tell someone that they can't sit anywhere, almost put me in a mind set that there was an underlying reason behind that. It was a Tuesday night....surely they weren't expecting a huge crowd, but I digress.   Altogether, if the seating situation had been better, I would have rated it a 5. For the DJ and bomb food I give it 4 stars and will be back for those two reasons!!!  Revised:  I went there a second time and again the manager seemed nonchalant towards myself and my companion plus I noticed the same type of attitude towards another African American patron; for this reason I changed my rating to below par. If I did not feel such a prejudice undertone it would be much better but because of this reason I will not ever return to this establishment even if the DJ was one of the best I've ever heard...He's not there all the time anyway.

My favorite restaurant on Earth. I would want my last meal to be pork belly tacos from Soul.... We eat here for every special occasion. There isn't really anything on the menu that isn't amazing. The brunch is fantastic! The bloody Marys and mimosas are awesome as well.

This restaurant got the most tastiest food ever since I've been in Charlotte. The food is so unique. I just can't explain how delicious it is. I highly recommend anyone to try their food. The alcohol is a bit pricey though.   The DJ is very talented! He plays very good beats. Our waitress Collette she is very friendly too. I like her style as a waitress with dreads and cool nail designs.Much better than the uptight all black dress code. This place is very comfortable.   It just makes you feel like you are home.

This palce is really neat down the street from my work and never get the chance ot stop in and eat there since they are only open at dinner time.    However ate there with a my friend Kevin and we sat outside on their balcony watching the cars go by and it was relaxing.  Now let me remind you this is a Tapas Bar.    Great finger foods and a mix of Greek, sushi, and all american finger foods.  Didnt try their drinks only had beer.  But overall great service and great food.  This is a must stop by at least once type of place.

Happy with everything! Price, service, quality... we went as a group of 6 and ordered a lot. Glad we had a chance to try a lot of things. I personally loved the sushi rolls and banana pudding dessert the best but all the others were so good to! Will come back again!
The waiter was exceptional but food-wise I don't see the hype. Most definitely not worth the crazy wait time (or any time).

This restaurant has great feel. Super laid back & mellow atmosphere. Sophisticated drinks with a reasonable price. Dinner was comprised of a rich assortment of tastes from various tapas dishes including Sashimi Fish Tacos, Pork belly shells and cheese, spicy tuna rolls, saganaki... all of which were fantastic. Staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

I'd like to believe I maybe the queen of all things delicious.  While living in the Queen city, I had a Charlotte restaurant bucket list, and leaving Charlotte, was the reason I had to kick said bucket.  Soul Gastrolounge was on the top of it. If you haven't been to Soul yet, here's 5 delicious reasons why you should.  - Guacamole Stack: Simplicity is king with this healthy and appetizing take on Guacamole. Yum! - Ahi Tuna Tacos: A great ways to serve up Ahi Tuna- they're not just for Tuesdays. - Lamb Lollipops: Incredibly rich and succulent. - Ramen Bowl: Mouthwatering slurpable noodles. Slurp, nom, Soul.  - Cucumber Mule: On tap!  Just do Charlotte a favor and don't eat everything on Soul's menu at one time.  Four and Three Quarters Yelp.

Went for the first time for my birthday and sat at the bar. Bartender was great! Made me a special cocktail that contains the alcohols I enjoy. And the food was amazing! I've been back three times in the last month 1/2!!! I've had just about everything on the menu now and have yet to be disappointed! Lamb lollipops, duck sandwich, avocado salad, scallops and shrimp (was a special that day), even the sushi!!! It's a must try in plaza midwood for tapas !!

My husband and I are die-hard foodies, and we've eaten some amazing dishes all over the world. I have to say though, Soul is easily one of my FAVORITE Top 3 restaurants of all time!  The food is flawlessly and consistently executed (so rare these days), and the environment is laid back and unpretentious.  Must orders: pork belly tacos, dirty south nachos (trust me on this), salmon 'o pita, Charlotte roll, the foie gras, and the pierogies on the brunch menu.  Can't say enough great things about this place!!

Whenever I have family or friends visiting me in Charlotte this is one spot I always take them.    You must get there early enough to get a table outside to watch the sunset in order to get the full effect! Seriously incredible to watch from this spot! The city view adds so much to this amazing place!   Where do I even start with the food! You must get the truffle fries I always ask for sirracha to dip them in. It adds a great spice! You can't go wrong with any of the small plates or sushi. I love the spider roll! If you go here often they have a specials menu so there is always something new to try.   This is highly recommended if you want to impress your guest!

A great place to get together with people. I'm glad I took photos to remember all the great things we had. Food was reasonably priced as well as the drinks. Some of the highlights were the pork-belly and watermelon tacos and the ramen with mushrooms and veal cheek. Sushi was good, but a bit over-sauced for my preference.
Awesome! Been to Soul several times. Grill Greek cheese, bone marrow and lamb chops are a favorite.

Literally my favorite place in plaza. All the bartenders , servers, and host are really awesome! The menu is tapa style which enables you to try multiple items in one sitting. The cocktail menu changes seasonally and never seizes to amaze me! One thing that's a must for me is consistency and they have it with their service,food, and the cocktails doesn't matter who prepares it!

We came here on a Sunday night for dinner and were lucky enough to get a table right away. The food was absolutely amazing!!! We ordered a bunch of small plates to share and each one was incredibly delicious. Since we sat outside on the deck, we were able to catch the sunset.

Kickin tapas with some top notch sushi and open late? Killer bar too! We sampled the oysters which were perfectly fried. The ham plate was filled with tasty choices and the truffle fries and baconed Brussel sprouts were exceptional. Minor note would be toasts are dry and too many of them are a downer as is the pounding techno beat. Achieve hipster haven at a lower decibel

I took some friends to Soul last night to celebrate a good friends 26th birthday. I haven't been in a while and it use to be a favorite hangout for me. As always it met my expectations in the highest way. Staff, Bar, Hostess, and Server...Top notch. The food was as it always was, interesting and Delicious. (Try the bone marrow). Andy, whatever you are doing don't change a thing. On and did I mention that we has a beautiful table outside on the patio? It sealed the evening as perfect for everyone at my table.

This place never disappoints! It's the perfect spot to enjoy modern food. It's the perfect atmosphere. Lastly, you can't come here and not order the french fries, I swear they were made with angel tears!

It doesn't get better than this, never disappoints, always top notch. If you're looking for tapas in Charlotte you have found the place- look no further.   p.s. No Reservations here- get your name on the list EARLY and bar hop for drinks elsewhere while you wait. Expect a wait, it's packed for a reason. :)
A little pricey, but delicious! Ahi Tuna Tacos, fried oysters and special foie gras meatballs were amazing!

Came for a conference, stayed for the fried chicken nachos. I met up with an old friend who suggested that we grab some Tapas at this trendy little gastropub. We skipped the line and snagged two seats at the bar. I swear, I must've had 4 orders of the fried chicken skin nachos. These were BOMB. We all secretly only like the skin on fried chicken..and they serve it to you on a plate covered in nacho topping goodness. We tried a few other tapas, all which were tastey. But really, get the nachos.   If I ever find myself back in Charlotte, I'll be here.

I'm weak willed and went back.  The last few times they have redeemed themselves.  Great food and service (can't beat small plates in my book) and the music is pretty stellar. All around, usually have a pretty darn good time here.

I can't even begin to describe how good this place is. Trust the reviews and do yourself a favor ...go try it out!  While your there...try the pork belly tacos. They are sinfully good. You cannot go wrong with Soul Gastrolounge.

A friend and I stopped by for late night eats. The service was just as good as if we came for an earlier  dinner. I had the tuna tartar tacos. They were delicious! What I most liked about this place is the option of lighter and heavier meals. You can't really go wrong with what you order. Everything that came to our table, I'd order a second time.

Dropped in for a late night dinner and some drinks and the place was packed but we didn't have to wait longer than a beer by the bar before being able to sit and order some grub.  We went with sushi since is was such a warm night and neither of us was could commit to downing anything that warmer than the weather.  Between the two of us we got the vegetable roll, ki roll, spicy tuna roll, and salmon nigiri.  The rolls came out fast and disappeared equally as quickly.  They were delicious!  Fresh and wonderful.  Between the food, frosty beverages, and awesome tunes the DJ was spinning I left feeling full, tipsy, refreshed, and completely satisfied!

Soul Gastrolounge is a fabulous place to go for the best drinks and tapas plates in town! They are always busy after dinner on the weekends and there usually is a very long wait. But that only speaks to how great this place is. We went around 7:30 hoping to have a few drinks and bites before heading uptown. Until we were told the wait was about 3 hours! So we went uptown and had dinner first and came back after 10:30pm on Saturday. We had drinks and dessert. I had the The Secretary. What a wonderful drink. Somewhat spicy and strong with grapefruit bitters and basil. A VERY nice combination. The wife had the chocolate bread pudding. I'm not a fan of bread pudding but I must say, it was delish. It was very loud so we could hardly hear each speak. After 10 the dj begins playing the flavor of the night. Frankly, We are fans of the earlier hours. But still, what a great place for drinks and food!

I'm so in love with this spot. I have the no wait app so I don't have to wait in line. It's very busy on Friday nights. Small inside but does have outside seating. Decent drinks and there is a bar there. Servers are great! The food is the bomb.com!!!! Pork belly tacos my fav and I always try new items. I love everything, even the cucumber water!

No stranger to this place, I have been here multiple times and I love the vibe and the atmosphere! Food is great and so are the drinks, which is a plus. Have the pork belly tacos w/watermelon. Thank me later.  DJ is great even during the week, which I can appreciate on a Thursday eve around 10:00. Always a pleasure and it does not disappoint.
Reallly great food and drink at this one!! Well worth visiting!! Try the pork belly macaroni!!

So, I finally made it over here after hearing about it since before I even moved to Charlotte. I love the space and the vibe; it's even cool that it's only accessible via what is essentially a fire-escape ladder. I love the bar that it hovers above (even though I can never remember if it's called Twenty Two or Twenty Three) and I love. Love. LOVE. Plaza Midwood in general. My hopes were high for Soul.  My ONE gripe - it's easily the restaurant I've had the toughest time finding gluten-free options in since I've been in Charlotte. I never want to be that person, so I didn't even ask the waiter for suggestions, but I'm not sure I would have been able to hear her anyway - place is LOUD. Boyfriend and I were there on a Wednesday night at 7pm and we could barely hear each other across the small table. Side note: there was about a 45-minute wait. On a random Wednesday night. It's a popular spot.  And still, you say, Soul deserves 4 stars? Really, Amy? Well, everything we had was absolutely incredible. As mentioned before, I'm an annoying gluten-free bitch. Even though I didn't eat 1/3 of the ingredients in the pork belly tacos (flour tortilla), the other 2/3 (pork belly and watermelon) were delicious enough that I'm still salivating over them 3 weeks later. Holy eff, that combination is deadly. Sweet, salty, indescribably amazing.  Brussel sprouts were some of the best I've ever had. Fries were BANGING. Sushi was decent, but we probably ordered the wrong roll (crunch roll) - some other rolls floating around the restaurant looked better. We only spent about $45 due to the fact that most of the other items had unavoidable gluten. But I can still safely say that I get it, Charlotte. This place is something special.

Hipster central. While the food is good, I don't think I'm nearly cool enough to ever step foot in this place again. Everyone from the hostesses whispering to each other (who needs 2 hostesses in a restaurant with less than 15 tables anyhow??) to our haughty waitress made me feel judged. I'm willing to admit it's totally a personal problem, but I just felt uneasy and uncomfortable all night.   As I mentioned, the food was good -- and surprisingly affordable -- but I'm not convinced it's worth the wait and attitude you have to deal with. We had the dirty south nachos (great), shells and cheese (good), brussel sprouts (good) and Korean wings (tasted burnt, below average). I'm not sure I want to dissuade anyone from trying Soul if you're curious but I doubt I'll ever be back. So, by all means, if you want to test your cool quotient, pay them a visit. ;) There's just way too many great, non-hipster restaurants nearby -- Bistro La Bon, Dish, Fern -- for me to give them another chance.

Cool atmosphere. Great food.  Must have the pork belly tacos. Out of this world! Everything we had was great, although I wasn't crazy about the Bone Marrow.  Dirty South Nachos, veal short ribs, chimchurri beef skewers, spider-roll sushi.  It was all great, even the Rocky Mountain Oysters (which were a first for me).  I would definitely go back again.  In fact, I'm ready now.

I've been wanting to visit Soul for years and hadn't had a chance to make it. I'm sooooooo glad I made the time. Which led me to visiting twice in a weeks time!!! Oh how I love the Pork Belly tacos with the watermelon salsa. It's a must try! The Lobster Ramen special was amazing. The burgers were awesome! The shrimp skewers and the chimichurri beef skewers. Oh and the Korean wings! Oh and the feta pimento cheese dip. All amazing. I would've skipped the truffle fries, needs some type of dipping sauce in my opinion and the Brussels weren't amazing. And although it doesn't seem like a lot of food, trust me it will be more than enough to share. Everyone order a couple of things and then if it's not enough order some more. You won't be disappointed!

There's a bit of a wait when you go, but it is well worth it. Here's what I ordered with a friend:   Shrimp Ceviche (my favorite thing here!) - It had coconut milk and lime with a little red onion and fried plantains. It was phenomenal.   Ham and manchego cheese on toast - they give you a whole slice of cheese, wrapped in ham, on a crostini - it was wonderful   Lamb Lollipops - good, a little pricey, but worth it if you enjoy lamb.   Beef skewers with chimichurri sauce - the chimichurri sauce tasted like blended parsley - t wasn't very flavorful but the beef was marinated well.   Dip trio - hummus, baba ganoush, and tzaziki sauce. The tzaziki sauce was great, the hummus was well prepared, and the baba ganoush was okay. Will not order again.   They ran out of a lamb lollipop (since they are supposed to come in threes) so we received the cupcake of the day. I couldn't figure out what the flavor was, but it was great! This needs to be eaten right away, since the frosting melted by the time I ate the meal.

Oh man, the line is long but worth the wait. We waited 2 hours (small party of 3) on a Friday evening. The drinks were good, ambience fun and inviting. The food was delicious. I'd recommend going an off daytime/evening to avoid the wait. Will be returning!
What can you say that others haven't? Always amazing. Music bumpin and awesome atmosphere with consistently exceptional food.

I was in Charlotte for business and knowing NC was home to badass BBQ, I did serious research only to throw all of the pork BBQ joints out the window when I discovered that NC was host to an impressive array of home-grown chefs doing some amazing work with local ingredients.  Soul Gastrolounge seemed like such a funky place -- a hip lounge off the beaten path with sushi and Greek classics on the same menu. The space is small, but that's not a bad thing. Dark and intimate, I saddled up to an empty bar (I ate solo on the early side on a weeknight), ordered a PBR and decided to go to to work on some bone marrow, anchovy fries and saganaki. Obviously, I wasn't planning on hooking up wiht anyone later (which was very much appreciated by my wife back home).   The bone marrow was served alongside some pickled red onion, parsley and thin, toasted bread. I love that bone marrow is making a foodie comeback -- poor people's food now finding its way onto respectable menus and savored for the deliciousness it's always been. The acidity of the red onion/parsley cut the richness of the beef butter just right. The only complaint I have is that the toast points were too thin and too crispy to properly soak up the richness once it melted into the bread.  The anchovy fries were true rockstar food as I don't have many friends that would join me in this adventure. I love the saltiness of a fresh anchovy. Dredging them in flour (cornstarch, perhaps) and flash-frying them made an already good thing amazing. The lemon aioli that came accompanied it was proper -- those little fishy fishes vanished quickly in between bites of bone marrow slathered toast and...  So I had never had saganaki - this beauty of fried, then ouzo-flambed cheese that Greeks have enjoyed for generations -- until this fateful night. And wow -- worth the wait. Perhaps, I didn't need the extra dose of saltiness given my anchovy fries and pickled red onions, but the salty cheese was incredibly satisfying -- especially when washed down by a cold, domestic brew.   Soul Gastrolounge boasted quite an impressive menu of small plates and if I was a local, I'd make a point to hit them all. The bar was a perfect place to perch as it allowed me to watch the team of cooks prepare my meal. Given the size of the kitchen, which is about the size of my coat closet, these guys and girls really know what they're doing and are so intentional in what they serve their loyal fans. Charlotte is lucky to have them around.

The prices remain the same but the portion sizes are even smaller. I remember back when you could get 3 pork belly tacos for $12, now it's only 2 tacos. We got Brussel sprouts as well thinking that would be a decent portion but there were about 10 making it $1 per sprout! We also got the shells and cheese (super rich) and the hoisin glazed shortribs (again super rich). The best thing we got were probably the truffle fries. The sushi will always be my fav here but everything else just got so much more expensive!
An amazing place for tapas/drinks/dinner. Really fun place to try new and different foods. Love the atmosphere of the bar and sitting outside with a view of the skyline. Will be back soon!

The food was great but I think it's a little overpriced for the portion. I understand it's a tapas restaurant. I found everything more appealing because it was very posh environment. I would go back again but I'm not necessarily in a rush. Their pastry smoked salmon tapas was my favorite.
I always take guests here when they're in the town... specifically for the pork belly tacos!  and it gives me a great excuse to stop in! Love everything I've had there!

This place hit me square in the face, in a good way!  Ended up here pretty spontaneously on a Wednesday night.  There was a 20-30min wait, but they were super busy (for good reason!).  I was a bit hungry and annoyed that we are waiting for a table this long on a weekday, but the wait was well worth it!  Our server was great, she recognized that it was our first time here and explained the menu and how it all worked with tapas and her recommendations.  She recommended that each of us (there were 3 of us in our group) order two plates.  We put in an order of edamame and we were off to the races!  I chose the Sashimi Tuna Tacos (heaven in 2 bites) and Shrimp Ceviche which was an awesome way to end the meal since it came out last.  My cohorts chose the special:  fried shrimp with alfreado linguine and a crunch roll;  and the other two plates were soul wings and sticky veal shortribs.  Everything was excellent.  It was fun having all the small plates and being able to try everything.  We were lucky enough to get an outside table and halfway through the meal it started raining, but they have covers that rolled down to keep the splashing to a minimum.  The inside looked pretty cool and loungy - not many tables inside (hence the wait), but overall I am definitely coming back here to try some more tapas!

I went here with some people I met through one of my dinner groups.  Having only driven by and never stopped it was time to experience another place I've heard such rave reviews on.  First off, it's not a place that is good for the differently abled as it is on the 2nd floor and access is via the steps outside.    Up the steps, you see a few tables outside on a metal catwalk.  Inside it's fairly dark with mood lighting.  There's a bar that extends to the small kitchen and sushi prep station.  To the left if a DJ area and more comfortable seating.  To the right are 3 booths with high backs so you cannot see the tables next to you.   Our group of 5 was seated here.   There is an interesting selection of wines.  One of my friends and I were intrigued by the Velvet Devil Merlot so we both ordered this.  Good stuff.   Now for ordering.  We ordered in spurts.  Tried a few plates and then added more 2 times, trying everything from a sampler to a cheese platter, then moving on to proteins with the ham plate, the shrimp ceviche, the shrimp sashimi tuna tacos, the spanish chorizo,   Everything was tasty but I think my favorite was the sashimi tacos which is way outside of my comfort zone.  The spanish chorizo almost had the texture of beef jerky,  There's nothing wrong with that, I just wasn't expecting it.  Same with the Shrimp saviche.  I wasn't expecting it to be so saucy with the coconut milk.  This is definitely a good place to go with a group because you get to sample everything,  And it does fill you up.  None of us had room for dessert.    The place is relatively inexpensive.  After 2 drinks each, and about 10 different tapas, we decided to split everything evenly 5-ways and it only ended up being $26 each.    The only flaw was with our server.  When we wanted to order more food, we didn't see her for about 15 minutes and had to flag her down.  This cost the 5 star rating.

one of the best places I've eaten in a long, long time.  the pork belly/watermelon is life-changing. coconut milk in ceviche revolutionary. and the friend goat's cheese wonderful.  add in a fabulous staff and killer drinks/views and it's no wonder why this is the place to be in Charlotte.   I could not be more impressed.
This is the best place to come for costumer service. Stephanie was an amazing bartender as well as Alison as server. I will definitely come back!

Great drinks and tapas. Our party of 3 ordered a little of everything which worked great as each item came with three servings. Everything was amazing. The pork belly tacos and ahi tuna  skewers were unreal. We didn't try the ramen bowl but the table next to us raved about it. We would definitely come back the next time we are in charlotte.

This is one of my very favorite restaurants in Charlotte. It is not a secret. This place is known for being delicious- and it is. You can't make reservations. I do not recommend this place with a big group of friends. Try to avoid the crowds on Friday and Saturday. Some of my favorite dinners at Soul have been during the work week when it is a little quieter.  This is the sort of place where you can dress up at. You don't have to- but no one will look at you strange if you decided to go all out.  The food is delicious. The Soul Roll is my favorite sushi in town. The fries are INCREDIBLE. The Lamb Lollipop will make you forget about lambs being cute and instead you will find lambs tasty.   Ideally- go here with 4 friends. Share food together.   The cocktails are always incredible. Adam is a creative bartender. If you see him- ask him to make you something unique- he usually tries to use local ingredients and it is not always on the menu.

First time dissatisfied at the lounge! Tuna tacos were horrible couldn't eat them, service was a joke. But all is well I'm sure it was just a fluke and I will be back soon.    Update: favorite lounge on the easy coast! I'm in Hawaii now and miss it terribly.
Soul is the best spot in charlotte to have drinks and eats. The atmosphere and service is one of a kind.

It's tiny, and they don't take reservations.    I went with a friend on a Monday evening about 7ish and it was very busy.  We were glad to find a couple of seats at the side bar.    They have a patio, but they could do more with it and should.  If you've got a view like that, I'd splurge on a better quality winter enclosure so you could seat that space.  We tried several things, Ramen Bowl, Pork Skewer, Salad, Fried Oysters, Salmon-kopita, and maybe something I've forgotten.  The Salmon-kopita was in the lightest, crispiest wrapping ever, but they should give your a warning - I bit into one and blistered the roof of my mouth immediately, it was boiling hot inside.  It didn't taste like salmon at all, though, but it was crispy and creamy and had a good flavor.  So I guess not being salmon-y would be a good thing for some people.  The Pork, Oysters and something else were good, but the Ramen Bowl with Braised Veal and Fried Goat Cheese stuffed Mushroom Balls with Garlic Cream Sauce was phenomenal!  I like that so much I went back the next night and got it again.  I think this is a fun place with interesting options and I will go again.
Hat's off to the chef, and staff, but especially the chef, all of the food here is amazing, and to top it off the music and ambiance is great as well!

Not a fan. The wait times are usually absurdly long, so I delayed trying Soul for a long time. When I finally did eat there, I found the menu was hit-or-miss. Only about half the tapas we tried were any good. The meatballs were unremarkable and the shells and cheese were a no-go: the intense sweetness of the BBQ pork belly in it didn't pair well with the heavy cheesiness...just an overwhelming dish, and far too sweet. Portions were also pretty small, given the quality of the food. Service was pretty good, as was my cocktail, but I don't think the food was good enough to warrant coming back.

We knew we wanted to take our friends from out of town somewhere delicious and unique, and I had this spot recommended to me time and time again. So we decided to try it out.  We were not disappointed.  We chose to sit inside, which was definitely the best choice. The atmosphere, the couches, and the lighting make the inside the better choice. Soul has a great lounge-feel with interesting music and amazing food & drinks to compliment.  I had a glass of champagne, while others tried local beers. The champagne complimented the food well.  For four of us, we ordered six tapas and all felt full afterwards (two men & two women in our group). I think when you're all snacking for an extended period of time, you tend to fill up and not feel like you need a full meal.  We ordered:  Porkbelly Watermelon Salsa Tacos: This was as incredible as everyone on Yelp says it is. It didn't look like much when we got it, but every bite was incredible. Two tacos come with this.  French Fries with Truffle Oil: Could. Not. Stop. Eating.  Dip Trio: Pretty good. I will probably forgo next time.  Lamb Gyros on a Skewer: Yes, yes, yes.  Soul Roll: Not nearly as spicy as I expected, but I can't really eat spicy foods so I thought it was perfect.  Queen Charlotte: Seemed like one of the less adventurous rolls, but it was one of the best sushi rolls I've EVER had.  I would bring anyone back to Soul and can't wait to go back myself. I love this place!

So in love with this place!  The vibe inside is super laid back with cool urban beats in the backround.  The bartenders were making actual cocktails...they were muddling, mixing and shaking like crazy.  But the food was the best surprise.  We had the greek salad, saganaki, sushi and the short ribs and all of them were freaking awesome!  The short ribs were so tender and flavorful, my mouth is watering just remembering it.  I have been back many times and its great every time.

One of our absolute favorites in Plaza Midwood. The brussel sprouts, pork belly tacos, and guacamole stack are our favorites. The sushi is good. Ceviche was very spicy, hotter than we like. Great atmosphere.

The food in this place is simply delicious and will have you coming back for more. This is my third time coming to this place (I was there on 05/02/2015) and truthfully I never had any complaints because the food is just downright good. Their french fries are a must and also, I ordered a mai thai and it was well done. Not too much alcohol and not too sweet, it was simply just on point. My steak and egg sandwich was oozing with extreme juicyness of delight and my company had the soul grilled cheese sandwich and just eating a tiny little piece I just wanted to snatch it off her plate and eat it all. Anyway, my waiter was simply the best. She was not only helpful and patient... she definitely did her best even when I wasn't happy. The only reason I'm giving this score a 4 is simply because the kitchen was moving extremely slow and I had to wait for my original order of fries for a very long time. One thing I do have to say to anyone that likes to eat big... this might not be the place for you. The portions are small, so if you don't like to eat small this is not the place to go. Highly recommendable and I will be back.

I absolutely adore Soul. For our first date my now boyfriend said I could pick anywhere in the city so I turned to a seasoned local for suggestions and Soul was the perfect choice. I love the concept of the tapas bar where everything comes out as it is ready. You can linger over plates and rest assured they are as fresh as possible and haven't been sitting under a light while the rest of the meal cooks. If you particularly enjoyed a plate, or are still hungry you can easily order more. As a first date spot it is trendy with delicious and very strong cocktails, and allows you to review important sharing attitudes. Does he give you the last sashimi taco? These things are important in a potential mate!   Next time I go I think I am just going to order several plates of the sashimi tacos.
