Each tapas or sushi dish runs about $7-8.  The inside of the restaurant is dark, stylish, trendy, etc.  Candle-lit tables, comfy booths and chairs, nice atmosphere, and a good spot to take a date.  In fact, one of the people I ate with like it so much, he decided to take his date here the following Saturday.  Additional notes: water here is optionally served with a slice of cucumber, the bathrooms are unisex, you have to walk up/down a set of stairs outside of the building to get in/out of the restaurant, and service was good.

Meh, coming from the NY area not sure what the hype is all about.  Long lines, service OK, but most importantly the food was nothing to write home about.  I think there are much better restaurants in Charlotte.

Came here for a friend's birthday and it did not disappoint. The fried chicken skin nachos were soooo delicious that we ordered two and do yourself a favor and try the pickled okra that comes as a garnish. Simply fabulous! The veal, pork belly mac n cheese, steak and chimichurri, lamb were all delicious. We did not care for the fried meatballs (a bit dry and flavorless) or the saganaki (it was very unpleasant). Our waitress Allison was awesome. Good food. Good company. Good service. It was a fantastic Saturday night!

Let's see....pork belly tacos, fried Brussel sprouts, dirty south nachos, the flat bread, are all amazing & a must try!! I've had better bone marrow & the Rocky Mountain oysters would be better with a better dipping sauce...maybe a lemon based aioli. The drinks are fun also & with cocktails on tap you just can't beat the fun ideas presented here! It's worth the wait!

This place is one of my favorites Charlotte!  Whether it's a Saturday night or a Wednesday Happy Hour, the food is always amazing and the drinks always cold.  Try the Soul Roll and the Pork Belly Tacos- neither will disappoint.

Fun girls night. We tried so many small plates and all were tasty! I also enjoyed my cucumber mule, which they have on tap. While there are no reservations, we arrived early, got our name in and were seated in about 30 minutes. It's definitely a later crowd, standing room only when we left. Only draw back service was a little spotty.
Went with a group. A longer than desired wait time. Drinks were great. Got the cheesy shells with pork belly bbq inside. Best thing Ive eaten in a very long time!  Will definately be back!

This is my favourite restaurant in Charlotte, if you go on the weekends the waiting list could be 1+ hours.  All food is great and there are many options in the menu. The atmosphere with the DJ and nice decoration makes it a very funky place.

This place is a solid 4. I love places that serve tapas generally because the food isn't boring and that's exactly why I love this place!   There is a great variety of things on the menu. These tapas are pretty pricey, but if you want to treat yourself once in a while, then go for it. Everyone usually suggests the pork belly tacos. Pork belly is getting more and more common these days, but they use a watermelon salsa and surprisingly...it's awesome. I also recommend the sashimi tuna tacos and the veal short ribs. They were all pretty worth it.   **I think the lamb lollipops are NOT worth it. It's one of the more pricier options on the menu and there's nothing that special about them. The lamb lollipops at Davidson St. Public House are better in my opinion.  Besides the food, I love the environment of this place. Great place to meet up and grab drinks after work or late at night. There's usually always a wait though so that's a downside.  note: Kitchen isn't opened til closing time.

Me and my wife's favorite after hours bar in Charlotte. And even though we've always had dinner before coming to Soul, we somehow always seem to manage saving just enough room for some delicious food and drinks. Our favorites are the Replay roll and Pork Souvlaki skewers. Also, don't expect to get right in on the weekend as it gets crowded inside but squeeze by people at the bar and grab a drink. It's worth it.

Always have a great time here! Great food, great vibe, just all around good time! But what can you expect from Greeks :-) I can honestly say though the only thing I have not tried is the sushi. I have heard good things about it just have not had it myself. It really is just the way I enjoy eating with friends and just snacking on so many different plates, just like home.  My only complaint would have to be that it just gets so packed, but hey that can also be a good thing!
The food was amazing, but portions were small.  Great fun atmosphere, but it got really loud as the place packed out.  Not sure i would go back.

I was very lucky to find this on yelp.  However I did not know it was upstairs so I did look like a fool as I walked around for a bit.    The bar saved me from a long wait!  The food was expertly executed. The beer knowledge was above expectations and I hope to have the chance to go back.

We had an unexpected add to our party was rudely told that we couldn't have 9 at the table and they had to leave. Never ever again will I go back to soul. Hostess was rude, server was rude, manager was rude.

Probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Food is delicious. You can go here when you're in the mood for sushi, meats or cheeses. Suits a lot of different tastes.   Be forewarned it's served tapas style, meaning food comes out when it's ready. This only ever bothered me once when more food came out than could fit on the table...like, at least try to plan it out!   When you go, try to get a table rather than a booth. The booths, unfortunately, are tall, cutting off your view of the restaurant and killing the ambiance. I want to chop the tops off! If the weather permits, sitting outside gets you a killer view of the city.
Had 6 of us. All filled to the max for under $25 a person. Great food, well executed and a wide variety. Servers not the best. But the food is worth it

I was excited to try this place after hearing all of the hoopla about it. If I could rate the ambiance alone I would have definitely given it 5 stars. The food is really just quite average and was unimpressed with everything that I tried. The pork belly tacos seem to be a favorite of the majority of reviewers. I thought the flavors of the pork belly with the chunks of watermelon was really just a muddy mess of flavors in my mouth. The sushi was just fair. I have had much fresher sushi and sashimi from other places in the Charlotte area. Frankly I've given this a rating of 2 stars for an average over the ambience of 5 stars and the decent tasting brussel sprouts and edamame. This place is just overpriced and over rated however if you're looking for a romantic type of ambiance for decent cocktails alone I highly recommend it .
This place is one of my favorite in charlotte. They have great food and the service is really good. Everyone should try the watermelon tacos and their sushi.

Long wait, a lot of uncomfortable seating, crowded, loud, dark dining room, hit or miss service......but the food....the food.  I am in love with the food here.   The drinks are pricey..tasty...but expensive for what you are getting.  All in all it seems like my review is pretty negative.  BUT--I'm serious, the food is worth it.  I will wait in that line and put up with whatever to get some pork belly tacos.  Most everything on the menu is good, a few exceptions to that rule (meatballs, steak & egg, some of the sushi) but for the most part, the dishes are creative and delicious.   Use the no wait app to put yourself in line and eliminate your wait.  It's way worth it it.  The patio is cold in the winter, the heaters do help some, though.  Hot in the summer...deal with & sweat away while sipping your crafty wallet cinching cocktail!!!! But please, make sure you get the pork belly tacos!!! Did I mention they are my fav??!!
Share meals tapas style. Bring a date or a group and check this spot out. Seating is limited and no reservations all for a reason. This is a must try in clt.

Incredible food. Service is hit or miss.  Hostess was pretty rude which obviously didn't set the tone for the evening right. The atmosphere here is unique, but never come here hungry or in a hurry. Even with open tables you will have to wait. I'd suggest making a reservation.  Bottom line, there are too many great places to eat in Charlotte to make me hurry back to a place where the 1st person that greets you is unpleasant.

I was here this past Monday night and must say I was truly impressed. This place is really laid back. The wait staff was nice and the DJ was awesome. This place is definitely going to be a regular spot for me now. It seems to be a good intimate place for you to hang with friends or that special someone. I only had drinks this first time, but the tapas plates I saw around the room looked really great. The menu looks diverse and I'll be eating for sure the next time I come by.

I still suffer from that "want to hate this place" thing, because seriously, how many Forever 21 tank-dresses and half-finished brand new trad sleeves can I handle seeing in one night? But I'm making an effort, here, to see past the fringe-fratty crowd that fills this place, because it's trying to be good and carve a niche for itself in a nabe that doesn't take to Fancy Tapas Pants. And who doesn't like good beer and well-paired nibbles.  It's odd to me how extreme the differences in service and quality can be on any given night. Even from the same server, the same night, the next week. And that's rough - I have no idea what to expect when I walk in (and like I said in my last review - the prices here are above average, for moi, anyways, so I have some expectations). Sometimes, it takes 20 minutes just to get a glass of water - others, as soon as you sit, you've got menus, a nibble, agua, todos.   So when you're hungry, and need a beer, please, peering around the way-too-tall booth backs can get annoying, quick. If you've got claustraphobic pals, sit at the bar.   The music improves on off nights - they have DJs that don't care as much about crowd-pleasing as they do about, say, a history lesson in 70s Soul or Surf. Getting an education in Sly while eating Manchego and toasties, while sipping a Xingu or Manhattan, yup, that's about as good as it gets.   So yeah, Soul, I don't know what to do with ya. I want to come hang out, often, but the hassle-factors keep me away. So I guess we'll keep our relationship casual. No, I'll call you.

The only bad thing about this place is how small it is. The food is outstanding and the drinks even better. Absolute excellent service. Go early or you won't get a table. The pork belly tacos are what they are known for and for good reason. Delicious!

This place is awesome! I love the atmosphere! The pork belly tacos are amazing! Plan to wait! I mean really plan to wait to get in. Three hours of waiting and we finally were seated! Make sure to download the no wait app to secure a spot in line.

Still not impressed. I came here a long time ago and wasn't a fan. I returned for a friend's birthday dinner and looked forward to giving Soul Gastro another chance. I had the gyro which was lamb and beef mixed on a stick. It came with three pieces and yogurt. It smelled like faint poop and didn't taste well seasoned. Just not a great thing. I also had Brussel's sprouts. They were well seasoned and cooked correctly. The birthday girl had an orange cupcake that we all tasted. No one like the cupcake. Lastly, our server kind of rushed us throughout the entire dinner. Middle of the road friendly. It just wasn't a great experience. I will say that the Korean BBQ wings were good and that's what I would recommend to anyone visiting.
Best tapas in charlotte & the drinks are to die for. Great place to meet up with friends, clients, or cozy date night. We love Soul Gastrolounge!

Soul is, hands-down, my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It's a delicious spot, with a funky vibe, and always makes for a great date night (or just food adventure)!   There are so many staples on their menu that you want to order again and again, but you also want to make room to try some new items as well! Some of my favorite include the pork belly tacos, the lamb lollipops, any of their sushi and their chocolate bread pudding! The bone marrow is also melt-in-your-mouth delicious, and they'll let you take the bone home as a dog treat as well! The Rocky Mountain oysters are something that only sounds intimidating, but in reality, they are perfectly breaded and fried, very similar in taste and texture to a fried oyster. Even writing a review about their food makes me want to make my next reservation now!   There is always a wait for this place, but trust me, it is completely worth it. It also brings out something else I love, the fact that even though there is a wait, the servers never rush you, and you really get to enjoy your time and savor all the food!
INCREDIBLE!!!!!  Pork-belly tacos   YUM!!!  I will be back next time I'm in town.

One of the Charlotte favorites. You can't go wrong bringing out of town guests here, there is something for everyone. They menu is huge and I've never had anything that didn't get eaten up! Some favorites are the pork belly tacos (obviously), the stuffed shells and the hummus. Prepare for a wait but worth it.

Came here for happy hour to check out the pork belly tacos with watermelon salsa. The pieces were huge and the watermelon was sliced in cubes and seemed to have been drenched in vinegar. Wasn't a fan of the slicing and presentation. I did love the flavor of the pork belly but it could have been cooked a little longer for some melt in your mouth kind of meat.   Place was upstairs, parking is on the street, ambiance was nice.

Is it ok if I say that this is my favorite place in Charlotte? Well...non-Asian place that is ;) You enter the room and you are transported to a chic restaurant in a hip city such as New York or LA! There is absolutely NOTHING on the menu that is less that awesome. I personally love the truffle fries, Napoleon sushi roll, wings, skewers,etc, etc. Yum! They also have a cool selection of beers, wine, and cocktails that are worth trying. If you're looking for a fun, vibrant, place where you'll also meet cool new people and eat scrumptious food, come to Soul!!
Fun place for a late meal and drink. Can sit outside or inside upstairs and the music is a nice feel!

I was passing through from Charleston, WV to Savanah, GA for a wedding. The tapas canned out very quickly and the drinks were amazing. The atmosphere and music were a hit with my fianc√© and sister. Overall a great experience.

Food was ok.  Service was terrible....this includes the hostess and waitress!  The manager is the only person who tried to accommodate us for getting a table.  They weren't very patient or understanding when asking about menu items.  Chicken and waffles was just ok, the waffle was better than the chicken.  Just an FYI...Out of all their brunch menu items, they do not do egg whites.

First time at Soul on Monday and was impressed! They had a good selection of food on their menu. Something for everyone. I wouldn't recommend coming here on an empty stomach as waits are pretty lengthy (we waited over an hour after being quoted a 45 min wait for 5 people) and since it is a tapas place, plates are generally small and you could rack up a pretty big bill.   I ordered:  Chimichurri beef skewers : They come with 3 small skewers with about 4 pieces of meat on them along with the chimichurri sauce. The sauce is full of flavor and rich! You'll want to drown your beef in it.   Sashimi Tuna Tacos : 3 to a plate. Burst of flavors, I tell ya! Tuna was def fresh and the marinated cucumber adds such a great taste to it.  Pork Belly Tacos : A little disappointed that they only come with 2 a plate (for $12/plate -_-) but man, that pork belly is AMAZING! I can see why it's such a hit there. Although, I wasn't a fan of the "watermelon salsa" because of the slightly pickled taste, I absolutely loved it. The glaze on the pork belly is to die for. So sweet and delicious!  Korean BBQ Wings: Talk about a kick to the friggin' face! I was really surprised how spicy the wings were after taking a lick of the sauce. After you get through that first taste, these wings are delicious! They had a slight taste of gochujang, korean hot pepper paste (hence: korean bbq), which is probably what gives it such a kick. This was definitely my favorite plate!  Sushi was just above average, but not that impressive.   Unfortunately, they ran out of the dessert we wanted (their bread pudding) so I can't speak too much on that behalf except that I was just sad that I was not able to try it :(   Aside from being misquoted a wait time, the ambiance of the restaurant is perfect for a chill night out, service is good and food is definitely something to try. Can't wait to go back and try more items off the menu!
Great food, but service was ok. The bartender was a little rude and the kitchen closed earlier than scheduled. I would go back and give it another try for the food and ambiance though!

Pros: -Great vibe -Cool bar menu -Great food  Cons: -Expensive -Left hungry (all small plates)  -Pretentious and rude staff -Long long long wait  I don't really understand what all the hype is about. The food was good, but I'm not sure if it was worth another go.
Soul is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Charlotte. They have the best truffle fries, tuna sashimi tacos, and sushi!

Loved it. Cool place. This place is hoppin!! I hate to admit it, but its definitely for the younger crowd, but my old ass will be going back!! They don't take reservations, but they suggest you use the "NoWait" app to keep a place in line until your table is ready. Pretty cool. We had a drink at the bar while we waited and the got our table soon after. Drinks were good but pricey. Our waiter was awesome and knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions. I've been dying for Pork Belly Tacos and they were delicious, but I kinda feel like the taco part goes to waste, because all I ate was the pork belly and watermelon. Tender, juicy little nice size bites of sweet, unctuous pork with a piece of cool, sweet watermelon. Yum fuckin O!! We also had the Cheese platter with apricot preserves and toast points. Nice portions of Blue, Goat, Manchego, and Boucheron.  So good. Had to ask for more toast points, we ran out. We also ordered a sushi called the Dragon Roll. It was some kind of fish, tempura shrimp, cream cheese. and the fish was fresh, flavor was on point, so FN good!!!. My dessert was the Chocolate Brioche with Vanilla Ice cream swimming in what tasted like the best chocolate milk you ever had. I couldnt finish it, but I will next time. Go early or use the app. I can't wait to try all the other stuff. I'm getting hungry again!! Fill your belly and warm your soul here. The wait will be worth it!

My friends and I had such a fun dinner at soul.  Between 4 people we split 5 plates plus 2 desserts. This we the perfect amount of food and each plate was so yummy. Our waiter was excellent and so helpful explaining the menu. My favorite was the goat cheese bruschetta. Very  fun atmosphere for date night, can't wait to go back!
Brilliant. Desireable. Damn you Soul....you can do no wrong.

The place has a great vibe, with a good cross-section of people. We were there mid-week, and got a great big table for four right away. The menu has at least 2 somethings for everyone, and we ate well. The drinks we're great, too, and the service was laid back but didn't miss much.

A MUST try!   Overall great place for tapas style dining! Be prepared for a wait, especially on weekends and parties larger than 4. Everything I've tried on the menu is amazing!   Their sushi rolls are my favorite! Many people suggest the pork tacos with watermelon. (I've never tried them simply because I don't care for watermelon.) Cocktails and cupcakes of the day are a major it as well!

Maybe I don't get out as much as I used to since we had kids, maybe it was the prospect of a well-deserved and overdue date night with the wife, but this was one of the top 10 meals of my life.  Pork belly tacos, ahi tuna skewers, beef chimichurri skewers, korean BBQ wings were all amazing. My wife loved the tuna sashimi tacos as well. Showed up around 7:00 PM on Saturday night and had to wait a reasonable 30 minutes because we wanted to sit inside and it was well worth it. The ambiance inside is great for date night, can easily hear your companion but its not definitely buzzing in there so you don't feel bad laughing and having a good time.  Would highly recommend this place. I think 4 people would probably be the max i would bring considering there aren't that many tables unless you're willing to wait a while, the place doesn't take reservations. Owner told us this place gets really busy around 8:30 PM on Saturday, so would try and get there early in the night if you can. He also told us you can call and put your name down on the list when you're on the way..  My wife and I LOVED this place and hope to be back soon!

Food is awesome. Drinks awesome. Atmosphere awesome- very dark and meaningful. Service is good, a touch slower; is that Euro style?  We sat outside and great locale. Lots of smokers but doesn't bother us. Cocktails are killer. Pricey but worth it. Love this place. Sunday is great night to go, no wait. It still was bumping though.

Let's get the biggest negative out of the way - the wait here is atrocious. We went on a Thursday night and the wait was over an hour and a half. Okay. Now let's move on.  Yum. Yum. Yum. Yum. And yum, again. Everything we had here was wonderful. For drinks, my fella had the Cucumber Mule and described it as "super refreshing". I can't remember the name of my cocktail but it was really good. For meals, we had the dirty south nachos and korean wings (both for him) and the brie bruschetta and red dragon roll (for me). We both enjoyed everything! My favorite was the red dragon roll and I will probably order that every time.   Great spot. So bring a fully charged phone to keep you occupied while you wait (unless the person you are with is someone you've been dating for a few months or less - in that case, talk to them and DON'T mess with your phone) and enjoy :)

* This is my takeout experience from December 2013.  no. no no no no no.  Our group ordered about $120 worth of food. A large enough variety to get a good idea of the food here. We were really excited but very very quickly disappointed as we dug in. Overall the food wasn't cooked, portioned, or seasoned appropriately. A gastro-anything should not fail in these basic aspects! I think if we actually dined in I might be able to give it a 2-star rating to account for freshness and what not, but quite frankly I'm glad I experienced the dulled tastes of our very disappointing food.  the gist: * pork belly/watermelon tacos: overcooked and dried out pork belly (FAIL), mushy watermelon (YUCK) * nachos: unbelievably excessive grease (even for chicken skin) * lamp lollipops: bland and dry * wings: not memorable, so likely not terrible offensive.

I don't get the 2+ hour wait?   The hostess isn't very nice. Had two encounters with her and she's just snobby.  Anyways, the food... Shared a bunch of stuff. The pork belly tacos, bone marrow, tzatziki dip, skewers with chimichurri, a sushi roll. All were okay but nothing super amazing. The skewers were a little bland.   Had the pistachio ice cream which was good but super melted when it came out.  Again, don't understand the hype. It was okay but don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

Stopped in on an early Saturday evening, shortly after they opened. Ate outside as it was a nice day. Food was amazing! Everything is served tapas style and we ordered 5 items in total which was enough for my wife and I. Cocktails were great and the food was very good. Some highlights were the Southern Fried Chicken Wings, Truffle Fries, Sushi, and Mushroom Sandwich. Will definitely go back, but the service was lacking. The waitress made several mistakes on our order and was not very attentive as we waited 10+ minutes before we ever even greeted. Perhaps this was due to us sitting outside, though we were seated by a hostess... The food comes out as it is finished and there were multiple servers that ultimately helped us out which helped the overall experience. Even though the service was lacking, the food more than compensated. If you are in Plaza Midwood, I would encourage you to stop in. Not exactly cheap, but worth it.  Very laid back, trendy, hipster-type of environment.
Super cute for couples. Some times can be a long wait.... Try the Mountain Oyster *side eye*
My husband and I tried Soul because of a recommendation. The food, atmosphere and service were all incredible!!

Definitely my new spot to get sushi, I love this place!  Very trendy and located in Plaza-midwood Soul definitely sets itself apart.  My first impression was "Ok I'm here.... where is it?"  Well Its upstairs, above a skate shop / bar.  Walking up the stairs your first greeted with a metal catwalk type of area with outdoor seating, so of course this is where I sat.  Looking inside,  the Lounge looked very hip and trendy.  What I really like about it was the fact that music was not blasting, and you'd actually be able to have a conversation.  Food:  Rocks.  I had a sushi roll, can't recall the name, but it was great and huge.  The nigiri and sashimi I had were by FAR the largest I've ever had and best tasting.  As a big fan of eal I of course had that, simply amazing.  Two pieces was the size of a typical sushi roll somewhere else.  Had a few other dishes and they were all delish, hands down try this place!

My friends and I met for drinks and date night with our hubbies. It was my first time, I loved the vibe and atmosphere! Our drinks were on point and music was great! Then the food came, everything was shared and very tasty! My only regret was not ordering more food before the kitchen closed. Oh well, next time!

Food and service were excellent! This isn't where I would recommend for sushi but the other side of the menu is superb. Pork belly tacos are a must. Fried brussel sprouts are solid but not really special; they are the rage everywhere now. Shells and cheese are good and gooey...warning: they are super rich. Dirty south nachos were not really our thing-a little weird. The southern fried wings are also tasty.

Food and drinks were awesome. The pork belly tacos are the truth!!!! I'll be back! Funky atmosphere, definitely a foodie spot. Make sure to have your entire party with you for seating otherwise you'll have to wait. It's first come/first serve. Be patient as you will have a wait once you order but it's beyond worth it.

Inventive, expertly mixed craft cocktails, eclectic small plates, and a hip (but not pretentiously so) atmosphere make Soul Gastrolounge tops in our book. It actually has a bit of a West Asheville feel now that I think about it...  Anyways, you will be a better person for ordering the Pork Belly Tacos and the Pan Con Tomate--how DO you whip manchego cheese?!?!  Specials and drinks are always seasonal and on point.  Sushi is solid, but not earth shattering; it is certainly fresh, and I have to admit that it is nice to have rolls that don't try to throw the kitchen sink into them every once in a while.  Friendly and attentive service as well.  The only real drawback is that they do not take reservations, so be prepared to wait.  At least you can try to squeeze into the bar and enjoy one of those fantastic cocktails!

This felt like a very hip place. Cool dj spinning all night long, fashionable 20 and 30 somethings enjoying drinks and tapas style dishes, lots of laughing and fun.  The shrimp skewers were great, so was most everything.

Pork belly tacos, sashimi tacos, lamb lollipops, salmonopita, bone marrow, Korean wings, fried Brussels sprouts, and more. I was there with colleagues and we shared a feast of small plates. All of them were so good. We also had excellent service. This is a gem amongst many good places in Uptown.
Astronomical food! Always start with the pork belly tacos! , Then everything else is the !  Drinks are the best around!

The pork belly tacos with watermelon are the closest thing to a spiritual experience I've yet to experience. Thought it sounded a little odd at first but the flavors compliment each other SO well!  Do yourself a favor. It's worth the trip out here JUST to try these guys. But I recommend coming with a group and ordering a bunch of stuff to taste with friends. EVERYTHING was delicious!

One of my favorites and I'm a major foodie. Pork Belly Tacos and Lamb Lollipops are insane. If you don't get there early, it's a pretty long wait. We don't ever concern ourselves with the wait, we chill at the bar with the amazing creations that the highly knowledgeable bartenders have to offer. It's not a place to go to just eat--it's an experience from the moment you walk in to the last bite.
MAJOR KEY ALERT: This place is amazing, definitely worth the wait. Use the No Wait app to get a reservation without going in first.

You'll have to wait but go downstairs to the art gallery for a drink or two to pass the time. I HATE waiting, but the food is well worth the wait.   Get the lamb lollies, tuna skewers, pork tacos, brussels. My favorite restaurant in CLT.

Date night, Friday night, hell, even a Tuesday at noon; it's always a good time to venture to Soul. Unfortunately, this is not a little known secret, and it has become a popular dining destination. Expect a wait; it's part of the experience.   Yelpers love the pork belly tacos topped with watermelon cubes, and taking their cue, I followed suit. This was a good decision. We also ordered the ramen bowl, which consisted of noodles topped with garlic cream, braised veal, goat cheese fried mushrooms... it was good. This was a moment I had to remind myself not to lick the bowl...  When asked if we wanted to see a dessert menu; I informed our server I would just take a gander. Which lead me to ordering the chocolate brioche bread pudding. I am a sucker for cocoa nibs and caramel ice cream, and couldn't resist.  There are many options on the menu I am excited to try on our next visit, too!

This place puts Charlotte foodie dining to shame. Halibut cheeks, rocky mountain oysters, bone marrow, and anything else a food lover would want. Not to even mention the stellar and inventive bar menu. Don't leave without trying a gin and tonic on tap!

I cannot say enough about this place! We loved the variety of dishes and tried several of them. I love the cucumber in my water as it was a great palate cleanser between each dish. We tried the Rocky Mountain Oyster and hubby enjoyed them but they were not for me. It had nothing to do with the chef, just me. I love that I could try them. The Pork Belly tacos all I can say is amazing! I loved the Guacamole salad and can't say enough about the Pulled Pork Shells. For dessert we had the Banana turnovers which were okay but the Chocolate Bread Pudding I will be dreaming about for a long time. We are not from the area but this will be my stop whenever I go visit Charlotte. As for price, I don't think the prices are bad for tapas but I am sure ordering can get away with you if you let it. Our waiter was great at explaining this and extremely knowledgable.

Meeting a friend for drinks and a quick meal before heading to a party and what a great pit stop.  Soul is located on a major road with cool views for people watching. The parking reminded me of New Jersey/New York having to pay to park or drive around until you find a free one so I chose to pay $5 which ain't bad. Located upstairs and when I say it's a hot spot, it was LIVE and packed. The music was great and the bartender I had (cool guy with these awesome throwback shades) made perfect drinks & recommended drinks for my friends. Our bartender was able to explain the drinks very well and sold us on a few.  We ended up ordering a few tapas which were cooked to perfection & I wanted to order more but this was just a pit stop . It took a while for the tapas to come out (Lamb, Shrimp, Beef, Wings) but was so worth it. We met tons of nice folks.  I will say the place seems small bc it was packed and we were told a 2hr wait for a table so thank goodness we came just in time when a group was leaving. We stayed there for at least 3 hrs and the 3 tables near the bar were there before we got there and we left before them so heads up folks.   Come for tapas & drinks chill at the bar or go outside on the patio. It's good people watching outside so hint hint .

On the fourth try using the app, we were able to get a table. Do yourself a favor and just leave early and go to a bar nearby. The app doesn't update the expected wait time and if you miss your window to be seated, you have to wait for another hour or two.  The atmosphere was the best part. You walk in to a hip feeling diverse environment with excellent lighting. There was a DJ which was different for a dinner experience, his song choices ranged from good to bad and I enjoyed it much more than she did.  We ordered two drinks, both were bad. The drinks actually summarize this restaurant. They try to be too fancy and hip but completely fail to execute. Do yourself a favor, order your favorite classic drink or beer instead.  The food was mediocre for the price. You get the feeling that the chef doesn't know what they're doing in designing some of the dishes, especially their careless use of fresh jalapeno.  The counter to this is that everything seemed fresh, which in Charlotte can be hard to find.  The pork tacos are just bland meat in bland sauce on a bland flour tortilla with watermelon ok top. The sauce should make it pop but it doesnt. I'd rather pay $3 dollars down the street at a Mexican food place and get better food.  I enjoyed the ahi tuna skewers.  The shrimp ceviche was tasty but beware, my dish had bits of suuuuper spicy jalapeno. The jalapeno taste is a bad shock that nukes your pallette until you can recover. I love eating fresh jalapeno but these were either too spicy or just out of place.  We had some sashimi (or is it nagiri) later too that was good. It had a cute salad with it that was good except for again you had to pick past massive strips of thickly cut fresh jalapeno. It added nothing to the dish and was almost a disaster had I not told her that she was about to eat it.  She liked their Brussels sprouts the best out of all the dishes we had.   The people next to us had a glass of wine and a cheese plate. I think that's the way to do this place. Go in with a clear strategy, and maybe try one or two new things. If you go in wanting to taste lots of good food you will be left wanting.

WOW!!!! This place rocks. It takes forever to get a seat, but man it is worth the wait. This place had got a menu that if you don't find something you want you just ain't hungry! From sushi to tapas they got it.

So, so good. My only regret is not ordering from the glorious cocktail menu (although a bottle of ros√© was second best). While visiting my sisters in the area, we stopped into Soul and feasted on tapas after stopping next door for a drink. Starting with the coconut shrimp ceviche with plantain chips, we moved on to the  fried brussels, Southern fried oysters, and bone marrow - all were absolutely fabulous. Despite the wait to be seated, our service was SO quick and efficient (much appreciated). Such a wonderful experience overall - would return in a heartbeat!

Food was off the chart. Goat Cheese Ice Cream sounds crazy I know but with the sweet taste of ice cream the goat cheese added a *bitter and sour* hint of flavor to the dish. Veal Shortribs tender (braised not boiled) but not over cooked great dish. Gryo Lollypops fresh lamb and beef never a bad idea. Tip my hat to the chef  Great staff and vibe

Having moved back to Charlotte and into the Plaza neighborhood it was about time I gave this place another try. Midweek dinner with a friend the hostess was great with accommodating us quickly and the service was great. I wish I could say the same about the food. Don't get me wrong the food isn't terrible it just isn't great. You know I am expecting awesome food when I am paying $10 for 10 brussel sprouts. Unfortunately it just didn't live up to the hype. I would go back for the ambiance - let's be real it's an awesome date spot in terms of being comfy and cozy. However not only was the food lackluster, but the portions are definitely smaller and the price tag larger than the Soul Gastrolounge of yesteryear.
Great food and price but expect to wait some time for a table
So hipster. The waitstaff just kinda has that whatever attitude. Also a cockroach crawled across the bench when we were eating. Eeeeek  However the food was really good so I didn't complain.

Soul is a great place and a unique experience in terms of food and atmosphere. I came to Soul after they first opened and have returned several times for dinner or just drinks. I have been generally impressed with the quality of food, (have tried many specials as well as house favorites) have enjoyed the unique cocktails as well as the creativity of the bartenders. Their location is in Plaza-Midwood neighborhood in an old building which provides the perfect atmosphere for Soul's unique vibe.  The downside of Soul is that it is very small AND pretty crowded. The staff is a bit picky about where small groups can or cannot sit as well as those who intend to eat food vs. just have drinks. I find their logic to be flawed at times as I remember an incident where I came right after opening (to an empty restaurant) and was not allowed to grab a table. I'd suggest they go with the flow and err on the side of satisfied regulars. I'll caulk that one up to a one-off incident and hopefully not the norm.   All of this said, I love Soul and hope they continue to serve things up in their unique and cool way.

I don't eat lamb... or well, that's a thing of the past, now that I've tried the   lamb lollipops at Soul. They were simply delicious, and that's just one of the many good things about this place!! Everything from the cucumber cosmo to the sushi, from the hummus platter to the vibe and atmosphere here.... this place is just overall cool! I recently moved from the bay area to Charlotte, and I've already found a favorite spot here :) I look forward to going back to Soul again and trying other delicious foods off their menu!

Came here on a Sunday night.  Sat outside on the deck with a warm heater.  Food is really good.  Many Tapa dishes to try so perfect for a group.  Sushi was excellent.  The Quean City Roll was fantastic....tempura shrimp and cucumber...oh yea.  My wife loves the brussel sprouts and the local NoDa beer was good.  The great diverse menu will have us coming back.

Food is ok. Drinks are good. The people that work here have serious attitude though. That's the reason I wouldn't come back. The long haired guy at the bar thinks he's too cool for school and the brunette waitress literally looked at me and laughed at me with other patrons like a teenage girl. I don't recommend this place that thinks it's way better than it is. Go somewhere else.

Despite the two-hour wait, I'm relieved to say it deserves the hype.  The Good  I love eel sushi and Soul makes the best eel roll I've ever had. It's served with no extra filling, which means you focus on the succulence and sweetness of the meat alone. Absolutely divine.  Soul also makes the best flatbread I've ever had. It's made with truffle whipped goat cheese, pistachio pesto, honey braised garlic, and fresh arugula.   The Not-So-Good  Oh my god, the wait. We went at about 8:00 on a Friday night and the hostess said it would be a 2.5 hour wait. We walked over to Workman's Friend instead. Determined to try it again, we came back the next night at about the same time. This time a 2 hour wait. Luckily we found bar stools to get comfortable and ultimately decided to eat at the bar.  We ordered mules. We were thrown off that it's served on tap. And way, way too sweet.   The shells and cheese, made with BBQ glazed pork belly, were unremarkable. I wish we ordered the pork belly tacos instead. The fried meatballs didn't wow me either.  So, in summary, a few items on the menu blew me away enough to still give Soul my 4-star rating. Order the eel, flatbread, and prepare yourself for the wait.

awesome food and great service! favorites in order.. veal short ribs, tuna sashimi tacos, bone narrow, fried cheese saganaki style, and the tzatziki/hummus/babaganoush plate was amazing.. you could really tell all of the ingredients in the dishes were fresh as the flavors really stood out. I'm not from charlotte but this restaurant made me wish I was.

Wow ! The food was delicious . There was a wait for seating but they're able to text you when your tables ready . Lucky there was a seat outside and we took it . A bit cozy outside but it worked .   The pork and watermelon tacos were so so good ! Get them if they're available.   The salad was very refreshing and the chicken skins were good , but I can only have many one . It's very very filling .  Another item to get is the Asian style hot wings . Different and delicious.   Also had dessert . It was a thin flaky type of pastry filled and had ice cream on the side . Different but I enjoyed it .   Go here !!!

Soul Gastrolounge has gotten Way too full of itself.  I have never been treated so rudely at any other restaurant, ever.   I have been to Soul at least a handful of times.  I've always enjoyed it.  However, the last time I attempted to dine there I was treated to a truly shocking display of rudeness.  I knew it was going to be a long wait, so when I was told it was going to be 90 minutes I wasn't the least bit surprised. However, I did find it a bit odd that that I was 3rd in line and that it was still going to be that long before I was seated.   I hopped around Plaza Midwood to kill some time.  90 minutes later I called and somehow I was still 3rd in line.  This defied logic.  2.5 hours later I called and was told that I was fourth in line.  Uhmmm... how is it possible to move backward in the line after waiting 2.5 hours?  When I posed this question I was very rudely told that it was my fault for not having downloaded a seating app.  At this point it was so late that other restaurants in the area were no longer serving.    I had out of town friends with me and this was their introduction to Charlotte.  Never in my life have I been treated so poorly at a restaurant.  Soul will certainly be just fine without my business (which they will never get again).  The food is good, but with the ever improving Charlotte restaurant scene, Soul Gastro may lose some of its following if this level (lack of) customer service continues.

This  restaurant  is so close to us, but so far away.  We live a few blocks from it, but it is impossible to get a seat.  So, what is a 7:30/8:00 dinner couple to do?  Go early!  We went at 6:30 on Sunday night, Labor Day weekend and were seated immediately. I ordered the most lucious wine, Butternut Chardonnay.  My man got an IPA. We chose the sushi special, which was called Wasabi. But, it really wasn't spicy on its own.  We also got fried oysters.  Primo!  A flatbread featuring truffle whipped giant cheese, honey, arugula and pistachio goat cheese.  Amazing!  And spanakopita in the shape of those little paper "footballs" that some of us used to make out of paper and thump with our fingers when we were kids.  You could really taste that fresh dill. I always enjoy the vibe in this place.  The energy and service are great.  Love the catwalk music. So next time we want quality tapas food, we will go the Eatly Bird  Special route,.  It's that good.

This is probably my favorite spot in Charlotte. The food is absolutely the best. Such an eclectic menu to keep your tastebuds entertained as well as your date. The ambience is quaint and high class at the same time. High quality without the high dollar.

We went to this restaurant on a Thursday night and got there pretty early in the evening because we heard it gets crowded quickly. I think we got there just in time and probably got the last booth. We sat across from a busy and extremely well stocked bar. Our waiter was very attentive. We ordered pita chips and dip first and they were wonderful! Then we moved on to the pork belly tacos and the Ramen bowl.  Both were superb, although the tacos were my favorite! We added sushi and a pita sandwich and shared everything between the four of us.  This place can get pricy,  especially with eclectic tastes and drinks.  However, it has a huge variety of food and can easily accomidate those who enjoy sharing small plates, as well as those who want their own entree. If you park at the nearby shopping center, it's an easy walk to the restaurant. Great food!

My husband wanted to treat me to a nice evening while we visited Charlotte for my birthday weekend and, because of the great reviews on Yelp and the fact that we love tapas, we gave Soul a try.   It felt a little uncomfortable at first because, as cool as we like to think we are for 50-somethings, we are not that hip. This place attracts a young crowd. They don't take reservations, and I knew we were in for a good 1.5 hour wait and all I could think was, what in the world will we do? In total, this place is less than 1000 sq ft inside and out. There is absolutely no where to stand, sit, or lean against, and the crowd on a Sat. night was tight. The stars must have been in my favor because one barstool opened up in the "first come first served" area and we claimed it for the next, you guessed it, 1.5 hours. While we waited, I sipped wine and water, and my hub tried one of their signature mixed drinks. We had a lot of time to watch all the bartenders, all of whom were very fast, talented, and knew how to handle the crowd (especially a very drunk, loud and offensive guy who was asked to leave. Nice touch).    While we waited, we also tried the dip trio, which came with generous amounts of tzatziki, babaganoush, and hummus, with mostly too-hard-to-eat (and burned) pita chips. As Robert Irvine would say, something like that should have never left the kitchen. Though, our wonderfully attentive bartenders made up for that faux pas by refilling our chips every time the bowl was near empty. It was all good, but I really enjoyed the tzatziki the most, and it would have been even better with warm, soft pita. As you might imagine, I wasn't very hungry by the time our table was ready.   Anyway, after getting there around 7:45, we were seated around 9:30 or so. I ordered the avocado stack, which is a salad of sliced avocado, red onion, cilantro, tomato and fried garlic, drizzled with olive oil. So pretty (see pic) and tasty. I then tried the garlic skewered shrimp, which was light and savory. I enjoyed all of this while my hub sat across from me with nothing in front of him, as I believe his mango sushi order was lost. Ever the patient one, he nibbled off my plates until his sushi finally arrived, and it was beautiful (see pic). A huge portion, and he said some of the best sushi he's ever had.  I saw people ordering the pork belly tacos, which are described on the menu with "watermelon salsa". Interestingly enough, they come out looking like three cubes of meat on a flour tortilla, with three cubes of watermelon on top of the meat, so it's not actually a chopped up salsa. I wondered if the watermelon was marinated and will have to give it a try next time.   We were too tired and full for dessert so didn't indulge, as much as I would have loved to try the bread pudding cupcake with pretzel whipped cream.   So all in all, a great evening of food and entertainment. A DJ did start spinning music about 9:00 or so, and it was a mix of everything from 80s to techno to jazz, which went along with the cool vibe of this place with the exposed brick, open rafters, and low lighting. Just go prepared to be patient and wait if you show up at prime time, and just relax and enjoy something new.

Ventured over to Soul last night for a lite bite with a friend.  I'm so glad I did.  It was a great experience.  The service was friendly, the food was very good (for the most part) and the price was right in my opinion.   It was packed for a Thursday night..they had a 45 minute wait but we were seated at the bar immediately.  Our server was super friendly and he was very attentive the whole evening.   We tried the white bean/goat cheese dip---pretty good, small portion and couldn't really taste the goat cheese but it was decent.  The pita chips were a little stale.  Next we tried the curried lamb skewers with mango chutney....this was the show stopper....SOOOOO good!  The lamb was cooked perfectly and the flavoring was not too spicy/hot...it was just perfect...SOO on point!  I HIGHLY recommend trying it!!  We also tried a tuna roll...I can't remember the name but it had cream cheese, it was flash fried, had jalapeno and something else....it was excellent.  Fresh, tasty, just enough crunch, etc.    Lastly, we tried their newest cupcake addition....it was a dark chocolate cupcake with carmel on the top with whipped cream.  This was the biggest disappointment of the night.  The cupcake was dry as could be with ZERO flavor.  If you closed your eyes to take a bite you wouldn't know what flavor you were sampling.  It might be the worst cupcake I have ever tried.  I noticed they pistachio ice cream on the menu and I should have gone with my first instinct and ordered that instead.  Steer clear of their cupcakes...they are not worth the $4.    Overall...like everyone has repeatedly stated...great atmosphere, fun people-watching, good food and just an overall solid spot.  I'll be back.

Love coming here with my friends! Though I try to avoid going here on the weekend because it's usually a 1-2 hours wait. Which I don't mind since there's the bar downstairs. :) The food here would be classify as eclectic. Like the Pork Belly Tacos has watermelon in it but is phenomenal! Love their drink list. Sushi are great. Duck Banh Mi is amazinggggg! Bone Marrow is fresh (still in the bone kind of fresh lol). All my friends love this place after I take them there and now they're addicted!
I love SOUL!!!  I would give them 5 stats but the bartenders can get a little temperamental at times.  The food and atmosphere is great.  A good variety for everyone's palate.

This is my first Yelp review. But as a decade long front-house restaurant employee who currently works in a 4-star restaurant, I tend to have a more critical eye than the average Yelper. Whether you're fan or not of Soul is immaterial. You should read this (atypical) review regardless.  Within the last two weeks, a friend of mine called Soul to place a takeout order of their Shrimp Ceviche. As I'm en route to pick it up for her, (coming across town 30 mins to do so) she promptly called back to tell me that they wouldn't allow her to buy that specific item for "Take-Out" due to {insert erroneous/illogical reason here from an employee}. The problem was, I've already ordered that item "To-Go" before.  On principle, I was perturbed. Saw I called personally and asked to speak to a leadership position.   I was told [paraphrased]; that the head chef didn't think that particular dish was appropriate to serve as a "To-Go" item, as its quality (and his work) would be devalued upon consumption if not on site.  As someone who eats out 1-2 times a week, I can honestly appreciate the sentiment. Nonetheless, I ultimately felt that if I'm a paying guest for a product (that's in stock) I should be able to receive said item without a hurdle. Cash for product = service, I felt.  Once explained, a female manager (pardon me, as I can't recall her name) promptly and kindly addressed my issue and told me it'll be ready in 20 minutes. I showed up...it was ready...and I left. The food (as always from Soul) was phenomenal, even in a box on a 20 min car ride.  So here's your bottom line...  If you're on the fence about going there, don't be. Trust me, just go there. This place is awesome. Prior to this story, I've been there 20 times and always left happy. Their food and their cocktails (particularly their bourbon list, personally) are worth your time and your money. It can be a first-date or a chill night with your main. Their ambiance covers all bases and their menu covers all tastes. A real staple for the community of Charlotte.   P.S. Pork Belly Tacos...
I had the best cocktail of my life here,  this dude lit the orange in my cup on fire!  Can't go wrong! Talented mixologist for sure. The food is incredible,  I love the div-y feel of this bar.

We ate here before a show at ovens auditorium. It was close enough that we didn't have to rush through our meal. The food was excellent. The pork belly tacos were very good but I cut the pieces of watermelon in half because I'm not much of a watermelon fan.  My wife and I also had the flatbread which was good. The southern nachos were our favorite. We had one of their cocktails (the mule one, can't remember it's name) which was well made and very good. The restaurant isn't that large and doesn't take reservations so make sure to give yourself time to wait. There is an app you can download to get yourself on the waitlist as well.

Hipster vibes with classy eats  Plaza Midwood is kicking and Soul Gastrolounge is no exception. Soul is located on the second level, so don't try to go to the front door. With the doors opening at 5pm and them not taking reservations I suggest arriving early if you want to eat at a decent time. Soul is also on the app "Nowait", where you can put your name on the list only if there is a wait.   Arriving at 6:30pm on a Friday night it was almost an hour wait if we wanted to eat inside. We sat on the enclosed balcony. This area also has heat lamps and overlooks the skyline, not a bad deal. I wanted to sit inside because it was our first time at Soul, but waiting over an hour was not going to fly.   Libations A lot of their specialty drinks are on tap which I found interesting. The Feeling Squirrley was an awesome beverage, but I don't think it was worth $13.  Cucumber Mule was light refreshing and had just the kick it needed.   Grubs Keep in mind these are tapas //small plates. You should share with folks, but when you have a veggie and a meat eater together it's a little hard. We opted to share a sushi and then get our own small plate. The portions are decently sized for being tapas. +Dirty South Nachos, the pickled okra was the best part of these. Felt a little overdone and trying too hard for Soul. +Flatbread- this is the reason I would bring someone to Soul. This flatbread had my taste buds jumping for joy.  +Dancing Tuna Roll- Seared tuna with avocado are what dreams are made of. This roll made up for the wait, the drinks and the chicken skin nachos. I can't even tell you about it because you'll just have to try it yourself.   Try to make it to Soul in the Summer right before sunset.

Hands down the freshest and best prepared sushi i've ever eaten and i've eatin sushi all over the world and im still in disbeleif that id find that great if tasting fish in land locked charlotte. I will tell my kids, kids, kids to way here.     Went on a late monday night and didn't have much of a crowd at all.

I could talk about this place for days, but ille spare you the long review. I absolutely love this place. The wait time is one of the few things I dislike but let me tell you, its worth it. The pork belly tacos are RIDIC. So yummy! Their sweet menu isnt my favorite but even so, i come back again and again for their savory stuff.

Great dinner spot for tapas and cocktails! I tried the pork belly tacos, the pokemon sushi roll, and the avocado salad. All of which were very good. It is definitely too much food for one person though, so I highly recommend sharing! Try to get a place in line through the NoWait app, so that you won't have to wait as long when you arrive. The restaurant almost always has a wait.

Tapas Dining at its best! The decor is very eclectic for example there is a DJ booth that you can sit at with a stuffed Peacock on the wall. If you have been in this area before its to be expected though. I would suggest sharing plates with your dinner date up to 4-5 my favorites were the fried goat cheese on bruschetta, veal shortribs, cubanni, and anything from the sushi menu including the squid salad are superb!

Was home for the thanksgiving weekend and got a chance to catch up with some girlfriends and this place is always first on my list! It's tapas/bar near dt Charlotte and boy is it good!   If you have a big party, this is probably not the best place to go. It's more of an intimate setting / best for small groups. The service is always good - no bad experiences there!  This time in particular we all tried the crunch roll (yum!), truffle fries (to die for), beef skewers, bone marrow, shells and cheese, pork belly tacos, dirty south nachos - all were amazing! Don't think I've tried a bad plate of food here!
Get here early and expect to wait for a table. Excellent bar program and the food is really good too. I just wish they changed the menu more often.

hostess was extremely rude. couldn't seat us at a booth because we didn't have "4" people. If I was a waitress here and wasn't getting seated due to this matter I would have raised hell.. someone needs a new job. we decided to just sit at the bar...the bartender was forgetful but ended up being cool as ukfay. other than that the pork belly tacos were awesome.
Great place to hangout nice atmosphere with great music. We frequently go to Soul great brunch,and dinning, we highly recommend Soul as one of our favorite restaurants.

This place offers a distinguished menu that's unique and flavorful. It's a rather busy place and would require a wait, however it's definitely worth it. The food is always fresh well presented. The servers are well informed and take their time to take your order and explain any item on the menu. I highly recommend this place!

Ok, this place rocks. The atmosphere is very urban. Low light, cool music, a couple of couches to relax. Nice bar. Very cozy. Mixologist's excellent. Tapas on par with anything in the city. The place reminds me of some sweet establishments in Chicago. Come early. After 7:00 it's standing room only.
I'm not sure why all the hype. Everything is a bit pricey. The food is bland. Maybe it's just not my taste.

I had an amazing  meal at this place. I highly recommend the Garlic Fries... these fries are incredible.  Not a big sushi eater but I tried the Queen Charlotte roll and feel in love with it.  We ended up ordering another one because it was so good.  The biggest surprise of the meal was the Pork Belly Tacos....they are a must if you visit  Soul Gastrolounge.

Took my parents to Soul yesterday (Sunday) for mom's birthday brunch.  We just got done with the never-ending halls at the Christmas show.  I was defying all traffic laws and regulations just to make it here before 3 (brunch is from 11-3).   As I was dashing into the door at 7mins before 3, they sat us at one of the loungy couch area immediately.  The waiter knew we were to order brunch and took our orders promptly and calmly.  He was very attentive and helpful through our meal.  Definitely thumbs up on the service (I forgot to catch his name)  We shared 3 dishes: shrimp and grits, chicken and waffle, and southern biscuit with gravy and sausage (added an egg for $1).  Here is my verdict on the food:  Best dish is chicken and waffle.  3 small pieces (2 pieces of wings and 1 thigh meat) fried super crispy yet moist (at least the wings I was eating). The waffle is fluffy. All for $9 which is quite reasonable.   Best side item is sage rope sausage. Very tasty. I can probably eat an entire plate of them. Not too salty, the casing is just crispy enough. Just simple pork greatness.   Worst side item is biscuit.  I guess I am used to flaky buttery bo biscuit. This is a little chewy and doughy.    Least worthy dish is the shrimp and grits.  It wasn't horrible, but for $12 it was disappointing. It looks and smells like awesomeness in a bowl, yet it was more bland than I would ever imagine.   Granted not everything was great (hence not a 5 stars review), I will definitely come back for another brunch. Comparing to nearby places, I find this place more economic and food choices more appealing.
Really good food with interesting menu.  The service and vibe can be weird and a bit stuck-up but in the end the quality and creative menu make it worth it.  Go early to avoid a long wait.

This place is awesome. They have a cucumber mule on tap that is delicious! Served in copper mugs, it's the perfect drink for summer.   The ambiance is really fun and funky. No reservations so you have to be prepared to have some lovely drinks while you wait.   Food: some awesome dishes. Especially love the coconut shrimp ceviche, which is super tasty. The hamachi roll melts in the mouth. The roasted Brussels sprouts have really rich flavor. And best of all, the pork belly tacos with watermelon. These are just incredibly delicious.   Can't wait to go back!
Open till 2 am with a pretty decent menu and some fun things, most anything on the menu is good to go, good atmosphere and wait staff. Legit

My experience at soul Gastrolounge was very terrible I arrived on December 18th at 11:20PM. When walking into the lounge it was very crowded and out of control. The hostess at the door immediately told me that the kitchen was going to be closing in a couple of seconds and I had better place my order now before they close. I proceeded to the bar to place my order and the bartender rudely asked me "what I would like to eat" as if I was wasting his precious time. I felt so disrespected and disappointed after receiving such a great recommendation to visit the restaurant. I have never in my life felt not welcomed in a restaurant I don't think I would ever revisited this restaurant again nor could I recommend it to anyone after the terrible unwelcoming experience.

The food real was great.  I meet a couple of friends here for drinks and we ended up tasting ALOT of food.  I had a Greek salad which was amazing, Brussels sprouts (I don't eat Brussels sprouts BUT) these were amazing!

This is a place I have driven by many times but did not notice.  After finding out it is a popular spot, we finally made a stop.  I love this wonderful spot!  The atmosphere is great, comfy, and as another reviewer, the music is incredible; it makes you take notice!  Our server was great and well informed.  It always helps when the waiter has personally tasted the dishes being served.  Since we could not possibly experience everything on the menu, we had:  - grilled caesar salad: 4/5 - white bean/goat cheese dip:  4/5 (served cold but it grows on you) - Korean BBQ wings (not spicy at all, more sweet):  5/5 - salted caramel-popcorn buttercream cupcake:  4/5 - Punto Final Malbec (Argentina):  5/5  We ordered the sashimi tuna tacos as well, but they never made it to the table...next visit but I really didn't mind.  Soul has a small but adequate wine listing and the couple we ordered were delightful.  This is a hip but inviting spot to hang out for something to eat and drink in the Plaza-Midwood area and I always enjoy great spots that my fellow reviewers love!  Best regards...

Soul was recommended by friends from Charlotte and it did not disappoint! After another restaraunt closely botched our reservation, we came to Soul and were seated immediately despite how crowded it was. The service was nicely done from start to finish. Some highlights on the menu: pork belly tacos (maybe one of the most unique bites that I've ever had), the tuna tacos, the dirty south nachos (very unique concept and well executed), lamb lollipop, flatbread, and the replay roll. Everything was fresh and delicious. I also tried the ramen, which was a special, and it was good, but not as tasteful as the other dishes that our group ordered. I'm looking forward to coming back to Soul the next time I'm in Charlotte. The cucumber in the water was a nice touch!

A visit to Soul makes for a great night on the town. Grab 3 or 4 of your friends and make it an evening. First off, do not come starving as you will likely encounter a wait of 45 minutes up to 2.5 hours on a busy night (Thurs, Fri, Sat). No reservations unfortunately. It will be worth it though and once your name is on the list you can either get drinks at the bar, or walk down to Thomas Street Tavern or the wine bar just below.   The setting is intimate and I prefer the booth seating as it feels like you have your own private room for the group. The other tables are fine too, the only seating I do not recommend is at the DJ booth. There is a great view of downtown from the outside balcony, which is also very nice to take in during the Sunday brunch.   Food wise everything is unique and very well made. Start off with 3 or 4 orders of various tapas items to share amongst yourselves. I recommend the Mushrooms on Toast, watermelon pork belly tacos, or the Soul roll sushi.  Enjoy!

If you're looking for great Sushi and service this is the place to go! I suggest the dancing tuna roll, hands down! It was made to perfection. I also ordered the Tuna Nigiri and the Salmon Nigiri which were both great as well. They have a variety of signature drinks and a full bar. I went there on a weekday so there was no dj playing, however, there is a dj booth and I've been told that it gets pretty packed on the weekends. As for parking, do not park in the CVS parking lot because your car will get towed. There is street parking and I had no problem finding any.

The bartenders (Brian and Kelly) were rly friendly and helpful in terms of recommendations!  My meal of tuna tacos, bone marrow, and the supernova sushi special was actually amazing. I would come back to Charlotte just to eat here again!
GREAT atmosphere! Couldn't ask for a better location just to hang out and have a glass of wine...AND talk to complete strangers! Truly enjoyed myself!

I really love this place, but the small plates, wait times, and price are the things that deter me from giving this place a 5 star review. Love their drink menu and love their food, but I would recommend getting a reservation ahead of time!

Hands down the best cocktails in Charlotte. The bartenders are super attentive and knowledgeable. The food is solidly good. A nice selection of both vegetable dishes and heavier meat stuff and seafood in-between. Most days they also have a live DJ spinning some cool tracks. Overall, the best place to hang out.

This place is amazing. By far the best food and drinks I've ever had. And it's in Charlotte! And so close to my house. The food here is seriously like sex in your mouth. Everything is delicious. This night I got to taste a friends lobster soup and I swear I wanted to jump in the bowl and live in it. I haven't had anything here is didn't like. Example cold meat plate. I would never order that but it's amazing. And of course the lamb skewers are incredible. Better than a filet. Truffle fries, well yes please! This place need to never close down.   And don't get discouraged by your long wait. It's totally worth it. In fact order as much as you can with a friend or many friends and share. Taste as much as you can. I haven't had the brunch but that's hopefully going to be my next visit.

Came by last night for a few drinks with a friend . Was seated promptly ,  but decided to sit at the bar. Bartender  was very friendly and attentive and I loved the fact we didn't have to hunt him down to make a drink .  My friend tried the "James Ryan " cocktail special . He enjoyed the drink  so much he ordered a second and I enjoyed watching it being made . I loved the ambiance and how chill it was . It's definitely a great place for drinks , conversation and some good music .  ( snippet of drink being made uploaded)

Soul is unique with some good/interesting food options.  I wish I had a drink here, as they all looked great, but I had plenty the day before, so I wasn't feeling up to it.  I even saw Bob the Bartender slinging drinks from behind the bar, so that is always a great sign.  We tried to go here a number of times, but the place is small, there is always a long wait, so get there early, (i.e. before dinner time) if you want to sit immediately.  I started off with the Pork Belly Tacos, and they were amazing.  I would suggest splitting these, though, as they get heavy on your stomach pretty quick.  Especially if you are going to sample other menu items.  The fried cheese was also great.  I ended up just eating by itself, rather than on the bread.  The service was slightly below average, as it seems like they serve their food in batches (e.g. they make a large batch of pork bell tacos and everyone gets it at the same time regardless of when you ordered), and our server was mostly absent.  The big down sides are 1) getting a seat, and 2) sitting on the lap of absolute strangers once you do get a seat.  I really hate cramped seating, so next time I would try and get their 1-2 booths that have.  I would love to come back here for some drinks, but I would target an afternoon or an off peak time.

YUMMMMM!! They have a little bit of everything - and everything is GOOD!!  Sundays is brunch only - If you're going for dinner get there between 5p-5:30 if you actually want to get a seat and eat before 7pm (outdoor seating  has views of the city skyline) - Pork Belly Tacos ARE the Best thing on the menu (it sounds gross, watermelon & meat, but seriously scrumdiddlyumptious).  Best tip about this place: Be sure you know your liquor - they don't have Beefeater gin and tried to pass off a lower-shelf for it.
I go this place about once a month for dinner. I've lived in Charlotte for three years and this has been our favorite place the entire time. Takes a while to get a table, but it is well worth it.

I concur with everything regarding dinner so I will review breakfast.  The Sunday brunch is one of the best breakfast experiences I have ever had. Groovy Sunday morning music plays at a good volume as the DJ spins classics, Every item on the menu is decadent and amazing. The bloody mary's and mint juleps pull no punches. And every item is an urgent wake up alarm brimming with flavor and attention to detail.  I think I am addicted. Soul's brunch turns a hungover Sunday into a downright religious experience as we commune at the bacchian temple of good times, good drinks, and good food.

So I got drunk one night in Charlotte and made some new friends.* Whenever there was a lull in our magniloquent discourse on the finer points of the economy, microbiology and NASCAR, I'd ask them where I might find the best meal in Charlotte. There was a lot of hemming and hawing from most people, but about 40% of them instantly pointed me toward Soul.  That kind of percentage can't be ignored, so when I was able to drag myself out of bed the next morning, I headed over for brunch.   I must admit that Soul and I got off on the wrong foot because they refused to serve me liquor before noon. However, once our server was able to gasp out (past my hands wrapped around his windpipe) that it was North Carolina's ridiculous law rather than their personal decision, we moved past it. And everything from that moment on was perfect, because everything included their shrimp and grits.   Our lovely waiter Marlon sold me on the dish, and it truly was architecturally interesting as he described. Instead of a bowl of shrimp and grits (as I'm used to), it was more like fried grit cubes with the shrimp and sauce poured over. And it was beautiful, rich, salty amazingness. The only downside was that I wanted more. (Her french toast panini was nothing to sneeze at either, but I'm a savor-tooth tiger to the core.)  I'm sure it would've been a better brunch with a bloody mary, but this was a meal I'll eat every time I'm in Charlotte, and you probably should too.  _________________  *Depending on your perspective, I suppose you could say that I bothered a lot of strangers.

On my first visit to this Charlotte hot spot I cannot add anything bad to the raving reviews. they're all true. Every small plate we had was delicious, the wine list had some great choices although a couple were not available. I recommend getting there early or on an off night as this place seems to be very popular for very good reason. You should go and be prepared to enjoy some delicious food. One warning, the bill adds up very quickly even though you are having small plates.

You should know before you even plan on coming here that pretty much any night of the week there WILL be a wait. Sometimes it's 2 hours. And they don't take reservations. But having said that, it's worth it. My favorite place to wait is downstairs at Twenty Two, the art gallery. Grab a drink there and look out for them to text you when your table is ready. If it's a nice night, the patio at Soul is perfect. You can watch people walking on the street below and look out at the Charlotte skyline. Most importantly: the food is great. I always always always get the fries. Even if my main course is sushi, I always get fries. They're too good. The sushi is also really good by the way. Mini burgers are great. People rant and rave about the pork belly tacos but they're not my style (too sweet for me -- but still delicious). They have entree, sushi, and drink specials that don't disappoint and change frequently. There are many things on the menu I have yet to try, but I've loved it all so far.
Pan con tomate, pork belly tacos, shells and cheese, meatballs, lamb lollipops...bring friends and split ALL the small plates.  Cucumber mule to die for!!!

I've been here twice and each time I was utterly impressed. The first time I got the ramen which was so tasty, the meat so tender, and the noodles fresh and delicious. I also got the infamous pork belly tacos which lived up to their hype, and are a no brainier. The second time I got the bahn mi duck sandwich that was the perfect size, rich, and filling. Can't wait to try their brunch and sushi!!
First time, everything was delicious! Favorites were shrimp cerviche, fried Brussels sprouts

Long awaited and overdue. I can not believe as long as I have been going here I hadn't done a review on them yet. This is going to be short because I have absolutely no complaints I'm going to sum it all up by saying great food , great drinks, great people, great vibes. Never have I went to Soul Gastrolounge in years of coming here have I had anything I didn't like and in my opinion hands down they have some of the best mixed drinks and best bartenders Charlotte has to offer. Do yourself a favor and make this a must go to stop! Thank me later.

Soul is a trendy new age restaurant/bar and any restaurant that plays music is a winner in my book. I'm just that kind of guy; I appreciate music and believe it adds to the ambiance. The music selection also compliments the decor and Soul's prime upstairs real estate. Some patrons are what we might label as hipsters and C Town is glad to have you Soul.   And now on to the star of the show, fooooooood. The menu is quite eclectic. Tapas is the theme and items range from baba ganoush to sushi to bone marrow. For it not being a true sushi restaurant, the tuna was amazingly fresh and of high quality. So fresh that I can also honestly say that it was better than some real so called sushi restaurants around town. All of the menu items looked so enticing that I really wanted to try them all in one sitting. Next time P, next time.

I really liked this place. It has a great vibe to it, some cool specialty drinks and eats. I heard its hard to get into, but we walked right in and got a seat. We did come relatively early, 5 ish. We had spent some time at the local breweries and decided we wanted some food. Given all the 5 star ratings, we wanted to see what the fuss was about. The place is really quite small, but everything we ordered was very tasty. And the service was also very good. Atmosphere, great food, great drink, adds up to 5 stars from me.

Always crowded here so make sure you are there in time! We always have to wait for like an hour if we arrive later than 6 pm for dinner, especially on weekends. But probably one of the best sushis I've ever tasted! And loved the tuna taco too. I love that they serve smaller dishes combined with larger so you can choose and mix between everything. One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.

I really really wanted to fall in love with this place, maybe my expectations were too high. Everyone I spoke to raved about this place and Yelp gives it great reviews, but if I'm being completely honest, Soul you left me a tad disappointed. We will start with the bad and end with the good.  No reservations- always upsets me, really? why not? The hostess didn't offer to sit up outside ( I wasn't aware we could actually sit outside until I saw a few people grab a table)  We ordered 4 tapas. The eggplant parm skewers were 2/5. They tasted like over breaded, burnt to a crisp mozzarella sticks. Not a great way to start off our dinner. The  pork belly tacos 3/5- they fell short, the pork was very dry and chewy, not a huge fan.  The dumpster downstairs was overflowing with trash and even when I tried not to focus on the awful smell it would creep up and smack you in the face ( Not really sure if it was Soul's dumpster... It could just be bad luck. I thought some of the pricing seemed  pretty high for what you were getting. there is absolutely no way pork belly tacos (2) should be 12 dollars.   Moving on to the good... The waitress was friendly, quick and overall a good and nice waitress ( extra extra brownie points for trying to hard to light the birthday candle)  The dancing tuna roll was awesome- 5/5 stars AMAZING  The Goat cheese flat bread was rich, warm and with a perfect flaky crust... YUM 4/5  The chocolate chocolate  cupcake was quite delish, not the best I have ever had, but not bad at all.  The view was so pretty and with the warm August breeze we never waned to leave. Soul, I will give you another shot and change up my ordering.  Thank you for a different dinning experience even if a few options fell short of expectations.
Awesome place , would definitely come again. I am from NYC and usually have high end standards. This place meets them . Food tastes amazing

Went here based solely on the wonderful reviews online and I was not disappointed. Food was excellent. I got the flatbread and the mini burgers. Both were delicious. My drinks were delicious as well. Next time I'm in Charlotte I will most certainly be visiting again!
Great atmosphere.  Table outside if perfect on a nice night.  Food is really good here, unique choices/combinations.  I recommend you check it out!

If you've never eaten at Soul Gastrolounge, you may be tempted to dismiss it, but if you do, you may be making the biggest mistake of your foodie life here in Charlotte. While it may not look like much from the outside, and climbing those fire-escape-style steps may look like a hazard, you will be rewarded upon entrance with some of the most delicious, food-forward tastes you will have ever experienced here in the Queen City. Not only is their sushi amazingly fresh and considered some of the best in town on many "best-of' lists, but the taste combinations are often amazingly radical even for most sushi devotees. Other non-sushi items are also what could be called flavor-wells due to the sheer amount of good tastes contained within. Even though by some standards the menu could be considered small, everything (if you are an adventurous eater) is constructed for what I call "optimum flavor density". You know how you can taste several flavors when sampling a glass of wine? When eating at Soul it seems like everything is gauged to make you experience multiple flavor combinations, all of them amazing. Some issues are present that may hinder your enjoyment and one is the restaurant is on the small side and tends to get packed quickly so there may be a wait. Another is the lack of parking in Plaza Midwood, which affects all businesses there, not just Soul. There is no parking specifically for the restaurant, so be careful were you park, many places in the area may tow your car. As long as you educate yourself on your parking options you will be fine but the drugstore across the streets tows as well as others so find a safe place where you can park for a few hours and enjoy your dining experience. This restaurant is amazing.

One of my all time favorite restaurants and definitely my favorite in Charlotte. This was our go to date night spot when living here and no return trip there is complete without a visit!  You must try the pork belly tacos, this is the one dish I crave the most! Their sushi is top notch and they always have a delicious cupcake feature which never disppoints.  I have tried to find a surrogate place like this near to where I live but nowhere comes close!

Still good, but for the love of god..change your menu seasonally!! There's too many other great restaurants in Charlotte and in my opinion, this place can no longer compete. The last time I went everything was disappointing (even something as simple as the flatbread; it was overcooked and burnt on the bottom).

In and out in 45 minutes, full and happy. Can't ask for more.  I had the Greek salad, tuna tacos, and tuna skewers - all were fantastic. Washed them down with a NoDa Midnight Madness, which was great. The service was quick and friendly, and it seemed like a pretty hip scene (tattoos and undercuts everywhere). There was also a live DJ, which was pretty cool for a Tuesday night.  My only complaints were that there was a limited selection of beers on tap (although based on the set up, my guess is they make some mean cocktails) and the meal was a bit pricy - I ended up paying close to $40.

If you're looking for culinary excellence in Charlotte, this is definitely a spot you need to check out. The flavors each dish brings will not only blow your mind but also your taste buds. It should definitely be known that each item is small and invokes it's diners to order many plates and share amongst themselves.  But if you decide to eat here, the ASIAN GLAZED PORK BELLY TACOS are a must order with the SALMON-O-PITA a close second.   On the drink side, their bartenders have an exquisite pallet to create drinks with multiple levels of flavor.
